loans.name: Auntie Araba

texts.en:
Auntie Araba P. is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has no educational background.

Auntie Araba sells salted fish in Abura and has been doing this for eight years. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Auntie Araba will use the loan to purchase more salted fish to sell and to distribute to her customers who want to buy in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more salted fish to sell

loans.name: Oasis Del Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oasis del Amor está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mercedes Amalia Gutiérrez en 1999 inicio vendiendo cosméticos de Avon con el tiempo incursionó en otros rubros como ropa y calzado. Ella es tiene seis hijos de los cuales solo tiene a su cargo a su hijo menor de 20 años y un nieto.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elena del Carmen F. P. vende ropa usada, cosméticos, realiza nacatamales entre otras cosas y Gedy Adriana Flete D. comercializa ropa usada, nueva, productos Avon y zermat.
texts.en:
The Oasis del Amor group is made up of three hardworking, striving and enterprising women. One of them is Mercedes Amalia Gutiérrez. In 1999 she started selling Avon cosmetics and with time she entered into other areas such as clothes and shoes. She has six children and only the youngest of 20 and a grandson are under her care. The other members of the group are Elena del Carmen F. P., who sells used clothing and cosmetics and makes nacatamales among other things, and Gedy Adriana Flete D., who sells used clothing, and Avon and Zermat products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, shoes and cosmetics merchandise.

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.es: Tiburcia tiene 55 años, vive con sus  3 hijos en su propia casa. Hace más de 7 años tiene una tienda, por el cual trabaja diariamente en la atención de sus clientes, en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus 3 hijos. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es que no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, además que genera los ingresos que necesita desde su misma casa. Pese a las dificultades que se presentan, como el alza de precios de algunos productos o la competencia que se presenta; ha sabido salir adelante, logrando que su tienda tenga la mayor variedad de productos, con tal de cumplir con la necesidad del cliente además que este al alcance de su economía. Su mayor anhelo es abastecerse de mercadería que le permitirá obtener mas rentas. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos envasados, como: leche, atún, fideos y también arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Tiburcia is 55 years old and lives with her three children in their own house. For the last seven years, she has operated a store where she works every day attending to her customers. Occasionally her children help out. What she likes most about her work is that it does not require much physical exertion, and it allows her to make the money she needs in her own house. In spite of difficulties, such as the rising price of products and increasing competition, Tiburcia has managed to succeed. She has managed to supply her store with a good variety of products that meet the needs of her customers at a price they can afford. Her greatest desire is to stock up on merchandise that will bring more profits. This is Tiburcia’s eighth loan with MFP. She has always been responsible with her payments. She is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all the members are very responsible and united. With this loan, she will invest in packaged goods such as milk, tuna, and noodles, and also in rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy packaged goods as well as rice and sugar

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina G. P., es una joven de 28 años casada y habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, su esposo es comerciante y le apoya en la economía domestica, tienen un hijo pequeño de un año, ella se dedica a la venta de bisuterías, desde hace mas de 10 años, ya tiene su clientela fija a la que le oferta y son de muy buena paga.

Fue con el Apoyo de sus padres que le brindaron un apoyo económico para la compra de sus primeras mercaderías, dentro de  sus planes a futuro está la inversión en la compra de materiales para la instalación en un tramo del mercado central de Managua, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, laminas de zinc, perlines que le permitan las remodelaciones para su vivienda, su pequeño negocio a contribuido en gran medida al mejor progreso de toda su familia que beneficien sus niveles socioeconómicamente de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina G. P. is a young woman of 28 years. She is married and lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Her husband is a businessman and supports the household. They have a one-year-old son. Luz has worked selling costume jewelry for more than ten years and has regular customers. Her parents offered her economic support to get started, buying her first merchandise. In the future, she plans to open a stall in the central market of Managua. Luz is seeking a loan to buy materials to improve her house. She needs to buy cement, metal roofing and trusses. Her small business has contributed to the economic well being of her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeffrey Hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, roofing, and trusses for home

loans.name: Las Negras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Negras está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas, emprendedoras y joviales. La coordinadora del grupo Elizabeth del Carmen  de 28 años quien vende desde cosméticos, dulces, ropa, calzado etc. de manera ambulante junto con su compañero de vida con el fin de que sus cuatro hijos de 10,9, 6 y 1 ½ tengan un mejor futuro.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Verónica Isabel P. es un joven alegre y optimista madre de una niña de 4 años y un bebe que viene en camino, ella se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y Zermat con la ayuda de su esposo y Yolanda Elizabeth P. B. es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The members of Las Negras group are three strong, hardworking, tenacious and cheerful women. Elizabeth del Carmen is the coordinator of the group: she is 28 years old, she is a street vendor and she sells cosmetics, sweets, clothes, shoes and so on; she works with her live-in partner, and their goal is to grant a better future to their four children aged 10, 9, 6 and 1 ½. The other members of the group are Verónica Isabel P. and Yolanda Elizabeth P.. Verónica Isabel P. is a cheerful and optimistic young woman: she has a 4 year-old daughter and she is expecting her second child. She sells Avon and Zermat products, with the help of her husband. Yolanda Elizabeth P. owns a small corner shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different core products for their activities.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is divorced and takes care of eight dependents. She has no educational background.

Adwoa is a palm oil extractor in Abura and has been in this business for six years. She uses her income in providing the basic needs such as food, clothing and shelter for her family.

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase extra palm fruits to prepare more palm oil for sale. With the new profits she hopes to get from her expanded business, she plans to plow them back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase extra palm fruits to prepare more palm oil for sale

loans.name: Hermenegildo German

texts.es:
Hermenegildo V. M., tiene la edad de 54 años vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, es soltero pero tiene  3 hijos mayores de edad,  todos trabajan y apoyan a sus padres en sus necesidades económicas, él se dedica a la venta de rosquillas y otros dulces típicos de Nicaragua, desde hace mas de 30 años que tienen de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Dentro de sus actividades esta la reconstrucción de su hogar para heredárselas a sus hijas y una vez que el falté, tenga la satisfacción  de entregarles un hogar donde morar con sus familias en el que habiten de manera segura y digna, es por esta razon que solicita un prestamo para la compra de bloques cemento, laminas de zinc, madera con el objetivo de llevar su proyecto a cabo.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo V. M. is 54 years old: he lives in the Managua neighborhood of Laureles Sur; he is single and has 3 grownup children, all of them with a job and all of them helping their father facing his economic needs. For more than 30 years he has been selling rosquillas (a Nicaraguan type of doughnuts) and other typical Nicaraguan sweets. The renovation of his house is among his goals: willing to bequeath it to his children, he wants to have the pleasure of leaving them a decent and safe place where to live with their families at the time of his death. For this reason he is requesting this loan: it will be used to buy cement blocks, zinc sheets and wood in order to carry out his project.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela del Carmen S. F. es una joven trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora originaria del barrio Altagracia, Managua. Ella tiene en su hogar una pequeña y modesta venta de gaseosa, fresco y leche agria.
Carmen también comercializa por encargo ropa de todo tipo y estilos.
texts.en:
Adela del Carmen Chávez F. is a strong, hardworking and resourceful young woman who comes from the Managua neighborhood of Altagracia. She has set up a small and modest stall in her house, where she sells fizzy drinks, fruit drinks and filmjölk (similar to yoghurt but less sour). Carmen also sells different kinds and styles of clothes by order.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, yogurt, and clothes.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is a married woman living with her husband, who works as a palm wine tapper, and her seven dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Akua prepares waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and salted fish in Abura and uses her income to support her husband in paying school fees and utility bills.

Akua will use the loan to purchase more fish to salt to distribute to the market women in Abura. With the new earnings she is going to gain from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to salt to distribute to the market women in Abura

loans.name: Teresa De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de los Ángeles T. M., tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores que le apoyan en las actividades del hogar, ella labora como doméstica ganándose la vida de esta manera, desde hace más de 5 años. Ellos son una familia muy humilde que ahora cuenta con el apoyo económico de su hijo mayor que labora para una empresa privada.

Dentro de sus necesidades que más  la agobian, esta la reconstrucción de su hogar, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le permitan componer  su vivienda y habitar con sus hijos en un lugar más digno y seguro para todos los miembros.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa de los Ángeles T. M. is 45 years old; she is a single mother and has 3 grownup children who help her with the household activities. To earn a living she works as a maid, a job she has been doing for more than 5 years. Hers is a very humbler family now counting on the economic support provided by her eldest son, who works for a private company. The renovation of her house is among her more pressing needs, and this is why she is requesting a loan. She will use it to buy construction materials that will allow her to repair her house and to live with her children in a safer and more decent place for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. sells soft drinks in Abura. She has received junior high school education and is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in the general welfare of the home.

Ekua’s loan will be used to buy more drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete her building.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria Esperanza C. mujer emprendedora, esforzada y luchadora  quien es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio vendiendo gaseosa, chiverías y dulces.

Ella con el préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, jabón, ace, cloro, papel higiénico, pañales, toallas, salsa, productos maggi, medicamentos, tang, pastas, cereales, chiverías y leña. Asimismo semanalmente realiza nacatamales comida típica a base de masa y cerdo.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza C. is a strong, resourceful and tenacious woman who owns a small corner shop she initially opened to sell fizzy drinks, yogurts and sweets. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, soap, ACE bleach, toilet paper, diapers, towels, sauce, Maggi products, medicines, Tang drinks, pasta, cereals, yogurts and firewood. On top of this, she weekly prepares nacatamales, a typical dish made of masa (type of dough used for tamales) and pork.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. is married and has six dependents. She has been educated up to junior high level.

Ekua sells soft drinks in Abura and has been selling soft drinks for about two years now. Her husband is a mason. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the home.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase assorted drinks to fill her fridge and then to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase assorted drinks to fill her fridge and sell

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa, D. 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 jóvenes hijos.Durante el día realiza dos actividades, por las mañanas ofrece productos D. belleza (D. diferentes marcas), y por las tardes prepara bebidas (mate y café) y bocadillos (budines, queques y alfajores). En éste negocio trabaja junto con su hijo, quien también  ofrece a sus amigos D. unas cabinas D.  Internet, ubicadas al costado del negocio. Se siente muy satisfecha con las ganancias que obtiene D. las dos actividades; aunque a veces siente impotencia  D. no surtir a sus clientes, con mayor cantidad D. productos D. belleza, y pierD. así varias oportunidades D. venta. Para mas adelante lo que más desea, es ampliar ambos  negocios y comprarse una vitrina para exhibir mejor los productos D. belleza que ofrece en su casa.Es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además esta  al pendiente D. las cobranzas y los depósitos a  realizarse, ya que es la líder D. su grupo.Clarisa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. variedad D. productos D. belleza, para atender las diversas solicitudes D. sus clientes, D. esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Clarisa (61 years old) lives in her house with her husband and two children. During the day, she works two jobs; in the morning she sells different brands of beauty products, and in the afternoon she prepares and sells drinks, like mate and cafe, and snacks, like puddings, cakes and alfajores. In this second business, she works together her son, who offers the use of computers for Internet alongsiD. the food sales. Clarisa is very satisfied with the income she makes from both her jobs; yet sometimes she feels helpless when unable to supply her customers with larger quantities of beauty products, which loses her some sales opportunities. What Clarisa wants more than anything is to be able to grow both her businesses in the future. She wants to buy a glass case to showcase better the beauty products she offers for sale in her home. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. She always keeps an eye out for payments and deposits to fulfill, and she is the leader of her lending group. Clarisa plans to invest the solicited money in the purchase of various beauty products so she can better attend to the diverse needs of her customers. By doing so, she hopes to continue moving forward in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products to increase available merchandise

loans.name: Clara Aurora

texts.es:
Nicaragua es un país con muchas bellezas naturales, con una población carismática y creativa. En 1990 Clara Auro M.  cosía a domicilio y con las ganancias empezó a comprar sus maquinarias y herramientas como tijeras, agujas, cintillo etc. 
En la actualidad M. de 54 años tiene un pequeño taller de costura clase B según la alcaldía de Managua e invertirá en un proyecto que consiste en la realización de ropa típica la cual comercializara fuera del país. 
Esta señora sueña con que su taller cerca y un día hacer una pasarela con sus diseños.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is a country with natural beauty and with a charismatic and creative population. In 1990, Clara began sewing at home and with the earnings, bought machines and supplies like scissors, needles, decorative ribbons, etc. Now, Clara is 54 years old and operates a small sewing workshop (Class B, according to the Managua mayor's office) and she wants to make additional investments in the project, which designs and makes traditional clothing to be sold outside the country. Clara dreams that someday her shop can be closer and her designs can be shown at a fashion show.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH, THREAD, AND DECORATIVE MATERIALS FOR HER SEWING CREATIONS

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. produces palm oil to sell in Abura and also sells plantain and salted fish. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Ama is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been educated up to the senior high level.

Ama will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to process into oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a storehouse in which to keep the oil she makes.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to process into oil for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama G. produces gari for sale in Abura. To be able to prepare gari, she buys raw, fresh cassava from the market, washes it to remove any dirt, peels it, and sends it to the mill to be milled into dough. She puts the dough in a sack with heavy stones placed on it to drain the starch out of the dough and leaves the dough for a day or two depending on the weight of the stones. After this process she stir-fries it in a pan on the fire for some time to produce gari. The gari is then left to cool and is bagged into sacks for sale.

Gari is one of the starchy foods in Ghana that is mostly enjoyed by students and families at large. Students eat gari a lot because it is a quick and easy food to prepare. They use it for soakings (gari mixed with sugar, milk and water and sometimes peanuts). Some students also prepare gari in the form of a dough and eat it with pepper sauces and sardines.

Families also eat gari as lunch or supper with soups or sauces. The soups that are mostly used with gari are okra soup, groundnut (peanut) soup, palm nut soup, vegetable soups and so on. On the other hand, various sauces can also be used with gari such as pepper sauce, curry sauce, tomato sauce and other varieties of sauce, depending on the family. Any kind of meat or fish can also be eaten with these soups and sauces.

Ama has no educational background. She is married and takes care of her six dependents. Her loan will be invested into her gari business to expand it. This she will do by buying more cassava to process into gari to distribute. She plans to build a storehouse in which to keep her increased amount of gari.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to process into gari to sell

loans.name: Luis Albeto

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis Alberto F. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo está casado cuenta con tres hijos, es propietario de una pequeña fábrica de pelotas, una actividad que es muy tradicional en dicha ciudad y su familia.

El Sr. accedió a su primer crédito con nuestra entidad, destinando el dinero para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de pelotas como cueros, hilos, agujas, y cuerinas, ya que contaba con un pedido importante, que le permitiría la captación de nueva clientela y de esta forma aumentar su nivel de producción.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto F. is from the city of Carapeguá. He is married and has three children. He owns a small factory that makes balls, an activity that is very traditional in his city and within his family. Luis has qualified for his first loan from our organization, and he is using the funds to purchase raw materials for the production of balls, such as leather, vinyl, needles and thread. This will allow him to fill a large recent order and also to attract new customers, thus increasing his level of production.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying leather, vinyl, needles and thread to make balls

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, de 33 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 38 años y su única hija Luz de 13 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En el poblado de Cumutay (Provincia del distrito de Tarma), se encuentran los cultivos de Roxana, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que tanto la papa y alverja, son muy bien cotizados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses invertidos en el cuidado de sus cultivos, está dando frutos esperados, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectar su producción. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar sus tierras y así cultivar más. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una persona muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeros. Con los tres mil soles que solicita, comprará abono para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Roxanna, age 33, is a happy and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her 38 year old husband, Luis, and their only child, 13 year old daughter, Luz. She wants to give them a better quality of life. Roxana’s crops can be found in the Cumutay village (Tarma district). Her products are very good, and that is why her potatoes and peas are very sought-after in the wholesale market in Tarma. That is where she sells the yield of her harvested crops. She feels that the months spent taking care of her crops are giving the hoped for results. She has been doing this activity for 19 years. She considers the hardest part to be taking care of her crops so that the pests do not affect production. In time she hopes to get more land in order to grow more. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She has always been punctual making her payments, and she is prepared to do so now as well. In her communal bank she is a very happy person, and she is always joking around with her colleagues. She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy fertilizer to improve productivity in her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve her production

loans.name: Mercedes Victoria

texts.es: Mercedes Victoria tiene 32 años, su actividad es la venta de tortillas y servicio de triciclo. Ella lo inicia con el objetivo de estar más cerca de sus hijos y poder, por lo que tiene más de 3 años en este negocio tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 10, 8, 6 años de edad, pues siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para la familia. Por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y que disfruta de su actividad y de interactuar con sus clientes. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de matera prima como maíz, cal, leña, comal y bolsas plásticas. Siempre sueña con agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes Victoria is 32 years old. Her business is selling tortillas and transportation using a three-wheeled vehicle. She started her business with the aim of being closer to her children. She has operated this business for more than 3 years, and she has three children, who are now 10, 8 and 6. She is always looking for ways to generate income for her family. She has always been a very hard-working woman, and she enjoys her work and the interactions with her customers. She is requesting this loan to use for working capital, buying raw materials such as corn, lime, firewood, a tortilla cooker and plastic bags. Her ongoing dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mario Eleno

texts.es:
El Sr.Mario Eleno vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, está acompañado con la Sra. Irma Jara, juntos tienen una hija en edad escolar, la Sra. trabaja en Asunción como empleada doméstica con varios años de experiencia.

Don Mario se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, y comenta que vende muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes, su zona de venta es por la ciudad de Ybycuì y Carapeguà.

Solicita el préstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de  celulares ya que tiene varios pedidos y le conviene comprar al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mario Eleno lives in the city of Carapeguá. His life partner is Irma Jara and they have a school aged daughter together. Irma has worked as a domestic employee in Asunción for several years. Mario sells cell phones and cell phone accessories. He tells us that his sales are good because he has many customers. His sales area is in the cities of Ybycui and Carapeguà. He is asking us for a loan to buy cell phones because he has several pending orders and it’s advantageous to buy them at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 42 year old married man with three children. Two of his children are in school.  He does welding, paint spraying of vehicles and vehicle repair to earn a living.  He has a high customer demand because of his good services.  Therefore, he has employed two people to help him serve his customers.  

Samuel appreciates Express Soweto group under Faulu Kenya where he is a member.  This is because he has been saving his money with the group on weekly basis.  The group has also guaranteed him a loan of 80, 000 KES.  He wants to purchase a motorbike for transporting his spares parts to the garage. He hopes to expand his garage to accommodate more vehicles for service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: La Mujer Valiente 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Edline is the coordinator of her group, La Mujer Valiente 1 & 2 (Brave Women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are right now are to take her business to the next level, as she started just three months ago.

Edline is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, oil, meats and other goods. She is selling food to people in her community for lunch. She started with her savings, and she wants this loan to improve her business. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to buy some school supplies for her children.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican - many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti - clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production. The second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, Santiago, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy oil, meats, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Magrate

texts.en: Magrate is 38 years old and married with two children aged 15 and 7.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for two years.  She was previously transporting clothes from the neighboring country, Uganda. She decided to leave the business because it was not very economical because of high transport cost. She has been saving part of her income with a group in Faulu Kenya.  The group members guarantee each other's loan and she has requested a loan for 80, 000 KES. This loan will be used to buy dresses, jackets and trousers for resale. She hopes to buy a plot of land to build residential houses in the future. Magrate describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 28 year old married lady with two children.  She owns and operates a retail shop in her local community. She has ten years experience in this business.  Josphine is a member of the Ngegu Small Traders group in Faulu Kenya.  In this group, she has learned how to save her money. 

She is requesting for 40, 000 KES for additional supplies of doughnuts, salt, toothbrush, sanitary towels and soap to sell.  Josphine believes that she will manage to meet her customer's needs with additional stock and hence earn a  better income.

loans.use: To add supplies of doughnuts, salt, toothbrush, sanitary towels and soap

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 36 years old, married and a resident of Machakos town.  She sells fruits and vegetables for a living and also sells second-hand clothes.  In addition, Dorothy does farming to supplement her family’s income. As a member of the Uwo group in Faulu Kenya, she previously serviced one loan of 22, 000 KES which she used to boost her business and successfully repaid.  For this reason, the group has guaranteed her another loan of 20, 000 KES.  

With the loan, she wants to add stock of second-hand clothes and vegetables. She hopes to expand her business to earn more income so that she can buy a piece of land.  She wants to expand her grocer shop into a wholesale shop in ten years.

loans.use: To add stocks of vegetables and second-hand clothes for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old and married with two children.  She has been selling scrap metal for five years while her husband does printing.  She was introduced to Baraka Ukweli group under Faulu Kenya by her friend.  In this group, Joyce has learned how to manage her money by saving on a weekly basis. She is glad to be a member of the group where she can easily obtain loan from Faulu Kenya. The loan grouop members guarantee each other's loan.   

Joyce is requesting for a loan of 20, 000 KES.  This will be her first loan from Faulu Kenya. She wants to increase her supplies of scrap metal.  She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal for resale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma, de 50 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rubén de 52 años y el menor de sus hijos, ya que los 4 mayores viven de forma independiente y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los cultivos de Wilma, son de los mejores cuidados del poblado de Cumutay (Provincia del distrito de Tarma), los productos que cultiva son la papa y alverja, considerados de buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de fertilizar muy bien sus chacras. En el mercado de Tarma, los clientes solicitan mucho sus productos, por tal motivo recibe buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados, de esa manera han transcurrido 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará abono, fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus campos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Wilma, 50, is an unassuming, hard working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, Rubén, 52, and their youngest child. Their four oldest children live independently. Her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life. Wilma’s crops are among the best cared for in Cumutay settlement (a province in Tarma district). She farms potatoes and peas that are considered of high quality because she fertilizes her fields very well. Her customers in Tarma’s market request her products often so her profits are good. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because she feels that the long months of hard work are rewarded. She has been in this line of work for 30 years and considers the most difficult part of it keeping her crops free of pests. In time, she’d like to buy new fields in order to expand production. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She has always repaid on time. She is very committed to her group’s success. She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy manure and fertilizers in order to improve the quality of her farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica M. is a 40-year-old single lady with four children.  She operates Friends Shop in her local community.  Since she is the breadwinner in her family, she works hard to educate her children.  Therefore, she also does tailoring and sells charcoal for more income.  

She is an active member of Bright Angels group in Faulu Kenya because she attends the group meetings regularly and pays her weekly dues well. She has been guaranteed a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) by the group members.  She will use this loan to add stock of charcoal. She hopes to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop for more income.

loans.use: buying charcoal for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijas.Desde hace 3 años se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos y artículos para el hogar. Su negocio esta ubicado  en el mercado principal de su ciudad, y ya tiene gran cantidad de clientes que le compran frecuentemente por los buenos precios que ofrece. Sus clientes potenciales son mujeres jóvenes y público en general, que gustan de la variada mercadería que oferta. Recuerda como años atrás solo su hija la apoyaba, y en la actualidad  se ha independizado en este negocio, y le resulta muy rentable, aunque debe dedicarle la mayor parte del día.  Le gusta la comercialización porque le genera buenas  rentas;  ya que siempre anhelo vender este tipo de productos. Para el futuro tiene planeado adquirir 2  vitrinas para exhibir  mejor sus productos, y de esta manera espera  generarse mayores ganancias.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además se siente muy satisfecha del trabajo responsable  que desempeña  su grupo, pues conoce a todos los integrantes y sabe que son personas  trabajadoras como ella.Felicita tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería (productos cosméticos y artículos para el hogar), para abastecer mejor todos los  pedidos solicitados por sus  clientes.
texts.en:
Felicita, who is 61 years old, lives in her own house together with her husband and 3 daughters. For the past 3 years she has been selling cosmetics and household items. Her business is located in the main market in the city, and she already has many customers who frequently buy from her, thanks to the good prices she gives them. Her client base is young women in particular, and the public in general, who appreciate the variety of her merchandise. Felicita recalls how, with only her daughter to help her, she built up her business and her independence. It is now very profitable, although she has to dedicate most of her day to the business. She enjoys marketing her products because it delivers a good profit; she loves selling this type of product. In future she plans to buy 2 display cases to display her products better, and hopes that this will increase her income. This is the 10th loan Felicita has had with [field partner] MFP, and she vows to make her payments on time. She also says she is very satisfied with the group's performance and their responsible approach to their work, because she knows all the members and knows that they are hard-working people like herself. Felicita has plans to invest the money she is seeking in the purchase of additional merchandise, to better meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her business

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariela Del Carmen tiene 27 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, Su modo de trabajo lo realiza de manera ambulante, en donde les ofrece a sus clientes la mercadería que tiene, dejándolo a crédito, y el tiempo de pago dependerá del acuerdo que tenga con cada uno de sus compradores. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable, ya que puede aumentar sus ganancias, es por ello que desea aumentar su capital de trabajo. Por lo que este financiamiento lo realiza para la compra de perfumes, cremas, ropa interior, manteles, cortinas. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda para que sus hijos puedan tener un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
Mariela Del Carmen, 27, sells assorted merchandise in an itinerant manner. She offers her merchandise on credit and the repayment terms are unique to each of her customers. Her business has been quite profitable because she has been able to increase her profits. Because of this, she’s like to increase her working capital. The loan will be used to buy assorted merchandise like: perfumes, creams, underwear, tablecloths and curtains. She dreams with making home improvements so that her children may have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Flaminio

texts.es:
El Sr. Flaminio   tiene 34 años de edad esta casado con la Sra.  Natividad Godoy  hace más de 10 años tienen juntos 3 hijos en edad escolar y viven en una de las compañía de Carepegua (tajy  Loma). 
Él  empezó desde muy joven a tejer la tradicional sobrecamas y hamacas  que su papá llevaba a vender por la zona  de Aregua,  hace más  10, años atrás  que su papá le dejo  totalmente a su cargo ya que el mismo no podía más por su edad.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudieron comprarse un auto con el cual realizan sus ventas y el trabajo resulta menos sacrificado ya que anteriormente lo realizaban a pie.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Flaminio, 34, has been married to Natividad Godoy for over 10 years. They have three, school aged children together and live in Carepegua (Tajy Loma). From a very young age he started to weave traditional bedspreads and hammocks that his father would take to Aregua to sell. Over ten years ago his father stopped working due to his advanced age. Thanks to his work and efforts, they were able to purchase a car with which to do their sales so the work is less difficult now because they used to have to walk. He is asking for funds to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, sashes and sheets) because he has many pending orders for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Margot Marisol

texts.es:
Margot de 39 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), ella tiene una tienda de víveres, desde hace 15 años atrás para poder mantener a sus dos hijos. 

Ella empezó a vender arroz, azúcar y enlatados a sus conocidos y vecinos para tener dinero suficiente, cuando sus hijos llegan de la escuela le ayudan atender la tienda y después de hacer los deberes ellos se encargan hasta que termina de hacer la comida desde las 06h30 hasta las 21h00pm de lunes a viernes. 

Para poder incrementar su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, fideos y enlatados, en el futuro comprar un terreno para trasladar su tienda a un mejor sector.
texts.en:
Margot, 39, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a periurban area with unpaved streets and eroding hillsides). She has had a grocery store for over 15 years that provides support for her two children. She started out selling rice, sugar and canned goods to acquaintances and neighbors in order to make enough money. When her children return home from school they help her tend to the store and once they finish their homework they watch the store while she prepares the meal. She is open for business from 6:30am until 9pm, Monday through Friday. To increase her stock inventory, she wants to use the loan to buy rice, pasta and canned goods. In the future she’d like to buy a piece of property to move her store into a better neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, pasta, beverages.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is 60 years old and married with five children.  He has managed to educate his children with the income from his business.  For eight years, he has been selling groundnuts (peanuts) and has employed one person.  In addition, he does farming to supplement his income.  He was previously operating a taxi business for a living.  

Moris has been an active member of Faulu Kenya under Ngwate Nukiu group. He previously took out a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) which he used to expand his business.  Since then, he has seen his business grow tremendously.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy groundnuts for resale.  Moris hopes to buy a piece of land for farming and for building residential houses in the future.  In ten years, he wants to own a pick-up for transporting groundnuts.  Moris says that he is very much dedicated to his business and wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: purchasing groundnuts (peanuts)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Secure new clients for their green janitorial services, increase capital flow

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  unas señoras de escasos recursos conformaron su comité para trabajar en grupo dentro del programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a varias actividades.
Las integrantes necesitan de la ayuda crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria Isabel quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas, la venta lo realiza especialmente los fines de semana, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas de varios tipos como vino, cervezas, licores y otros.
texts.en:
A group of low income women from the city of Carapeguá decided to form a committee to work within the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) committee’s program. These women are very active and hard working; they are in a variety of commercial activities. The members need financial help to invest in their various jobs so that they can reach sustainable growth that will make it possible for them to grow as a group and individually. One of the members is María Isabel who sells beverages. Her sales are especially good on weekends and she is asking for funds to buy assorted beverages like: wine, beer, liquor, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like: wine, beer, liquor, etc.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: El Señor Walter solía vivir en casa en alquiler,  pero actualmente tiene su casita que se compro viendo la necesidad de el y su familia ya que tiene 2 hijitos y una esposa que mantener.  El Señor Walter trabajaba con un tráiler  transportaba abarrotes y otros pero este no le permitía estar cerca de su familia ya que tenia que viajar constantemente. Pensando en el y su familia compro un taxi  de segunda mano  que estaba bien cuando lo compro ahora tubo fallas mecánicas y necesita nuevas llantas y el arreglo del mismo  para que el logre trabajar bien es por ese motivo que saco el préstamo de "Emprender" quien ahora esta feliz por haberle dado una oportunidad dándole la taza preferencial de kiva.
texts.en:
Walter used to be a renter. He now owns his own house. He has a wife and two children to support. Walter used to work as a grocery distribution truck driver. However, this work did not allow him to spend time with his family because he had to travel constantly. Thinking of himself and his family, he bought a second-hand taxi which was OK when he bought it but now needs new tires and service so that he can continue to work. This is the reason behind his request for funds from “Emprender” and he is happy because he has been given the opportunity to have KIVA’s preferential rate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es: Maria De La Cruz tiene 46 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 11 años, ella tiene 2 hijos por lo que su hija le apoya a realizar la elaboración de sus tortillas, por lo que siempre ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable pues siempre ha sido difícil salir adelante ya que ella siempre está realizando sacrificios como salir a vender todos los días en bajo el inmenso sol, por lo que tiene que llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, bolsas plásticas y otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria De La Cruz, age 46, makes and sells tortillas. She has been doing this for over 11 years. She has two children, and her daughter helps her make her tortillas. She has always shown herself to be a very responsible person. It has always been difficult to get ahead. She is always making sacrifices like leaving to sell everyday beneath the immense sun. She does this because she has to bring home the daily bread. The loan she is requesting is to buy corn, firewood, lime powder, plastic bags, and other things. She dreams of improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angel Humberto

texts.es:
Ángel de 30 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), El vende legumbres con su esposa desde que llego de la sierra a Guayaquil. 

Con su hija de 7 años ellos llegaron a Guayaquil en busca de mas oportunidades, comenzaron a vender legumbres en las afuera de su casa, poco a poco con su esposa empezaron a tener ingresos para mantenerse en Guayaquil, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabajan desde las 08h00am hasta 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere readecuar su casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia, quiere comprar cemento, bloques, pinturas. En el futuro quiere tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Ángel, 30, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a periurban zone with unpaved streets and eroding hillsides). He and his wife have been vegetable merchants since they moved to the city from the Guayaquil mountains. They arrived in Guayaquil with their 7-year-old daughter looking for more opportunities. They started selling vegetables in front of their house and little by little started to earn enough income to support themselves in Guayaquil. Since those days they work from 8am until 10pm. He will use the funds to make some home improvements in order to provide his family with a better quality of life. He wants to buy cement, cinder blocks and paint. In the future, he’d like to have a store of his own.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, D. 46 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su esposo Evaristo (54), con quien tiene 3 jóvenes hijos, D. los cuales sólo vive con Neykel (7), pues sus dos hijos mayores, trabajan D. manera independiente.DesD. hace 8 años, se dedica a la agricultura y  ganadería, junto a su esposo, quien todos los días desD. las 5 D. la mañana se dirige al campo a labrar sus chacras, donD. siembra papa, alverja, maíz, alfalfa y diversas verduras. Mientras que ella atienD. a las 4 vacas que crían, y D. donD. extraen leche a diario, que les sirve para elaborar unos deliciosos quesos, que venden en las tiendas D. la localidad , o también envían a familiares  para que los comercialicen en las ferias semanales D. la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar verduras porque pueD. disponer D. ellas, no solo para comercio, si no también para su consumo personal. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar  un centro recreacional  turístico en la casa donD. vive, también desea  construir una casa en la ciudad, para alquilar cuartos, y generarse mejores ingresos.Es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y dentro D. su grupo comunal, trabaja D. manera activa, y siempre habla D. la honradez, por eso es muy respetada por todos los integrantes, que son personas solidarias y responsables.Albina tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D.  varios sacos D. guano que necesita  para esparcirlos en sus cultivos ya desarrollados D. alverja, alfalfa y maíz, D. esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Albina, age 46, lives in her own home in the company of her husband Evaristo (54), with whom she has 3 children. Of her children, she lives only with Neykel (7), because her two older children are working independently. For the past 8 years, Albina has worked in farming and ranching together with her husband, who goes out every day starting at 5 in the morning to work in their fields, where they plant potatoes, peas, corn, alfalfa and a variety of vegetables. Meanwhile, Albina takes care of the 4 cows they are raising, which produce milk every day. Albina and her husband use the milk to make various delicious cheeses. They sell the cheese in local stores and also send it to some relatives who sell it in the weekly markets in the city. What Albina likes most is planting vegetables, because she can use them not only to sell, but also for the family's personal consumption. For the future, she plans to construct a recreational facility for tourists in the house where she lives. She would also like to build a house in the city in order to rent rooms and generate a better income for her family. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is a very active member within her communal bank. She is always talking about honesty, for which she is highly respected by all of the members, who are people of great solidarity and responsibility. Albina plans to invest the funds she is requesting in buying several sacks of guano, which she needs to fertilize her fields that are already planted with peas, alfalfa and corn. In this way she hopes to continue making good progress.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying guano to improve the productivity of her planted fields

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 51 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre, Mariana de 84 años, a quien cuida debido a su avanzada edad, asimismo convive con su hermana Kely de 17 años. Hace más de 35 años que se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando papa, arveja y habas en terrenos que posee y que los heredó de su madre. Por otro lado cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y sobrinos, siendo una familia unida, siempre están dispuestos a darse la mano. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es seleccionar la papa que cosecha, de acuerdo a la calidad y el tamaño, para luego ser comercializados en el mercado de Tarma, donde ya tiene compradores mayoristas que conocen la calidad de sus productos. Los terrenos con los que cuenta, quiere cedérselos a sus sobrinos para que se generen sus propios ingresos económicos, que les ayudará a independizarse. Su anhelo es comprarse un auto, ya que mas adelante desea brindar servicio de transporte público. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y está contento porque la entidad de su confianza, otra vez le ayuda a contar con el capital de trabajo que requiere, además continuará laborando en su grupo  comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 51, is single and lives in his mother Mariana’s, 84, house. He takes care of her due to her advanced age. He also lives with his 17-year-old sister, Kely. He has been a farmer for over 35 years. He farms potatoes, peas and broad beans on land that he inherited from his mother. His sister and nephews help him out since they are a very united family; they are always willing to provide a helping hand to each other. What he likes best about his work is selecting the potatoes he will harvest according to size and quality to be sold in Tarma’s market where he has wholesalers that recognize the quality of his products. He wants to pass on the lands he owns to his nephews so that they will have the means to generate their own income and help them become independent. His dream is to buy a vehicle so that later on he can provide public transportation services. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He is happy because he has the institution’s trust and that it will once again help him with capital his work requires. In addition, he will continue to work in his communal group. He will use the funds he receives to buy several sacks of organic manure that he will spread onto his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefina Del Carmen tiene 58 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, ella no es la única que tiene pulpería por lo que tiene mucha competencia, tambien su esposo le ayuda en esta ardua labor. pues Ella trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana  hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días pues gracias a los ingresos que ha tenido en la tienda ha podido mantener a sus hijos en mejores condiciones económicas por eso ella quiere seguir comprando víveres. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, gaseosas y jugos. Siempre está soñando con mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Josefina Del Carmen is 58 years old, and she has been operating a general store for over two years. She is not the only one who has a general store, and she has a lot of competition. Her husband helps her with this arduous work. She works from six in the morning until ten at night everyday. Thanks to the income she has had from the store she has been able to support her children with better economic conditions. She wants to continue buying supplies. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, natural beverages, bread, cookies, soft drinks, and juices. She is always dreaming of improving her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth Concepción

texts.es: Elizabeth Concepción P. de 40 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por: su esposo, el cual trabaja como agricultor, así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 20, 14, 12 y 8 años de edad, de los cuales el mayor trabaja como mecánico y los tres menores que se dedican a estudiar. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de verduras, y su puesto esta ubicado a las afueras del mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, frente al parque Daniel Hernández, un lugar en el cual existe gran afluencia de personas ya que es un lugar muy céntrico en el cual existen diferentes paradas de buses y diferentes tipos de ventas. Ella es una persona muy inteligente, la cual también se dedica a la plantación de pepino en su casa de habitación, cosecha la cual luego incluye en sus ventas. Elizabeth solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras para invertir en su negocio y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos, ella cuenta con la gran ventaja de estar ubicada sobre calle principal, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas ganancias, y es por esto que ella espera poder contar con más verduras y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Concepción P., 40, lives in Santa Tecla, La Libertad department. She lives with her family which is composed of her husband, who is a farmer, and their four children who are 20, 14, 12 and 8 years of age. Their oldest son works as a mechanic and the other three children are students. Elizabeth is a vegetable merchant; her stand is located outside Santa Tecla’s municipal market in front of Daniel Hernández park. This is a place with lots of foot traffic because it’s centrally located and several bus stops are there as well as many businesses selling a variety of items. She is a very intelligent person. She also grows cucumbers in her yard that she includes in her sales. Elizabeth is asking for funds to buy larger amounts of vegetables to invest in her business so that she can have more variety to offer. She has the great advantage of being located on the main street so her profits are good so she hopes to stock more vegetables so that her sales will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
María Otilia tiene 45 años de edad reside en San Miguel, está acompañada, no tiene hijos, ella tiene un taller de costura, y venta de pupusas.
Ella desarrollo dicha actividad,( costura) hace 15 años y la venta de pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso y carne)  hace 3 años,  trabaja los días sábado y domingos en la venta de pupusas, y de lunes a viernes se dedica a la fabricación de ropa; actualmente solicita un préstamo para que le servirá para invertirlo en compra de materia prima: hilos, tela de algodón de diferentes colores, botones), para las dos actividades con esto ella espera generar ingresos que le permitan continuar con su negocios.
Los objetivos de ella son continuar con los negocios para solventar las necesidades económicas, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Otilia, 45, lives in San Miguel. She is in a couple but has no children. She is a seamstress and also sells pupusas (corn tortillas stuffed with meat and cheese). She started her sewing business 15 years ago and the pupusa sales 3 years ago. She sells pupusas on Saturdays and Sundays and from Monday through Friday she manufactures clothing. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials like: thread, cotton fabric in a variety of colors, buttons. She hopes to generate income from both activities that will allow her to continue with her businesses. Her objectives are to continue with her businesses in order to meet household expenses and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, various colors of cotton fabric and buttons.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 24 años, es una joven trabajadora y honesta, vive con su pareja Joel, de 27 años y su hijo Arnold de 3 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica a sembrar papa y de diferentes variedades, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es albañil pero en sus ratos libres ayuda a Marcelina. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus frutos, porque sabe que al comercializarlos, verá recompensado su esfuerzo y trabajo constante. Considera además rentable esta actividad agrícola, puesto que le brinda satisfacciones económicas, por tal motivo desea sembrar en mayor proporción, así como una nueva variedad de papa denominada “mama lucha”. Por otro lado desea instalar un negocio de venta de comestible en su casa. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está feliz porque podrá continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, a quienes respeta por su perseverancia. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y semillas de papa.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 24, is a hard working, honest young woman. She lives with her significant other, Joel, 27, and their son, Arnold, 3. They live in their own home. For over 2 years she has farmed a variety of potatoes. Her husband is a bricklayer but in his spare time he helps her with her farming chores. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because she knows that when she sells her products her work and efforts will be rewarded. She considers farming to be profitable work because it affords economic satisfaction. For this reason, she’d like to plant larger plots as well as a new variety of potato known as “mama lucha.” In addition, she’d like to set up a food sales business in her home. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She is happy to be able to continue to work with the members of her communal bank whom she respects for their perseverance. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of organic manure and potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth Elizabeth B. G. de 37 años de edad, es una señora muy emprendedora la cual posee su propio negocio por medio del cual desea mucho salir adelante. Vive junto a sus padres en el departamento de San Salvador. Ruth posee una librería y fotocopiadora, en la cual trabaja muy duro desde hace un año y medio, gracias a la cual ha logrado superarse y hacer realidad su sueño de contar con un negocio propio y así mismo poseer una fuente de ingresos fijos con la cual sobrevivir y brindarle todo lo mejor a sus padres. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde poco a poco ha logrado ir surtiendo con lo más esencial y necesario, como cuadernos, papelería, lápices, y otros accesorios como bolsas para regalo, listones, chongas y otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda hacer crecer aún más su negocio incluyendo más productos como plastilina, pegamentos, lápices de colores, mayor variedad de papel y muchos otros productos más los cuales pueda comercializar con las personas que residen en los alrededores de su hogar, y así de esta manera poder ser la primera opción dentro sus clientes y vecinos, la cual es la principal meta de Ruth para poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ruth Elizabeth B. G., 37, is a very enterprising woman who owns her own business and hopes to succeed with it. She lives with her parents in San Salvador department. Ruth has a stationery store and a photocopy machine. She has been working hard at this for a year and a half. Thanks to this effort she has managed to get ahead and have the dream of having her own business with which to earn her own income to survive and provide for her parents come true. Her store is located in her home. She has managed to gradually stock it with the most essential and necessary items like: notebooks, paper goods, pencils and other accessories like gift bags, ribbons, beads, etc. She is asking for funds in order to expand her business even more adding stock items like modeling clay, glue, colored pencils, a larger variety of paper goods and many other products that she can sell to the people living nearby so that she can become the first choice of her customers and neighbors. This is Ruth’s main goal in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock stationery items.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de su pareja Erica (24), con quien tiene una pequeña hija Génesis (1).Con la enseñanza agrícola de sus padres, en la actualidad esta dedicado  al cultivo de alverja en sus terrenos ubicados en la sierra peruana, pero también siembra grandes extensiones de papa en terrenos arrendados ubicados en la  costa, y para el cultivo cuenta con la ayuda de sus hermanos. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus frutos, porque al comercializarlos observa en las ganancias la recompensa de todo su sacrificio. Ya lleva 5 años en la agricultura, y ha logrado adquirir una chacra de gran extensión, además puede cubrir los gastos del hogar, y sobre todo ahorrar, pues para más adelante, tiene muchos planes entre ellos están el de sembrar en mayor cantidad, instalar un negocio de venta de combustible y un taller de mantenimiento de vehículos, pues  tiene conocimientos de mecánica automotriz.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta mucho trabajar con su grupo comunal, junto a los demás integrantes de su grupo.Carlos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que distribuirá sobre sus cultivos de alverja ya desarrollados, también adquirirá   semillas de alverja y papa, así espera obtener mejores ganancias con la nueva producción.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 years old. He lives in his parents’ house with his life parter, 24 year old Erica, and their small one year old daughter, Génesis. Using what his parents taught him about farming, he now devotes himself to growing peas. His fields are located on the Peruvian mountain range. He also plants potatoes on large tracts of rented land on the coast. His siblings help him with the crops. What he likes best is harvesting the produce. He likes it because when he sells the produce he sees his earnings as the recompense for all of his sacrifice. He has been farming for five yeas. He has managed to get a farm with a wide expanse of land. He has also been able to cover the household expenses. Above all, he has been saving for the future. He has a lot of plans. Among those plans is planting in greater quantity. He also plans to set up a business selling fuel and a vehicle maintenance shop. He knows about automobile mechanics. This is his second loan with MFP. He really likes working together with the rest of the group’s members in his communal bank. Carlos plans to use the requested money to buy various sacks of fertilizer to spread on his developed pea crops. He will also get pea and potato seeds. That way he hopes to get better income with the new production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds to improve the productivity of his crops

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Amistad inicia su sexto ciclo con 15 socias, las que solicitan préstamo para invertir en sus negocios. María es socia del bancomunal, es casada, tiene un restaurante, este negocio lo posee hace dos años. Ella menciona que no tuvo ninguna dificultad en su negocio.
El sueño de María es tener un local propio y hacer crecer su negocio. 
María es Presidenta del bancomunal Amistad y ya lo ha sido en tres oportunidades. Menciona que el Bancomunal “Amistad” es un ejemplo a seguir para los demás Bancomunales ya que practican todos los valores que les inculcan en Finca Perú. La meta como presidente es poder obtener préstamos más altos, para que las demás socias hagan crecer sus negocios.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra de insumos para el restaurante (verduras, arroz, aceite, azúcar, carne, etc.. María es la socia que levanta la mano en la fotografía.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Amistad” (Friendship) is in its sixth loan cycle with 15 members. They are requesting a loan to invest in their businesses. María is one of the members of this Communal Bank. She is married and has a restaurant that she has managed for two years. María claims that she has not had any difficulties with her business. Her dream is to have her own location and to make her business grow.

María currently serves as President of the Amistad Communal Bank and has done so on three previous occasions. It should be mentioned that the Amistad Communal Bank is an example to other groups of how to practice all the values promoted by FINCA Peru. Her goal as President is to obtain larger loans so that all the members can increase their businesses.

The loan she is requesting for herself will be used to buy supplies for her restaurant such as vegetables, rice, oil, sugar, meat, and other products. In the photograph, María is the woman raising her hand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, rice, oil, sugar, meat, and other products

loans.name: Oscar Amilcar

texts.es: Oscar Amilcar O. G. de 40 años de edad, posee una tienda en la cual se comercializan productos de primera necesidad para las personas como: sopas instantáneas, shampoo, cremas para el cabello, pan, jugos, desinfectantes, y otros más. El vive en Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento de La paz, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa quien invierte su tiempo a las labores del hogar y al cuido de sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad, los cuales son el mayor motivo de Oscar para salir adelante y mejorar su trabajo. A pesar que el negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación el posee muy buenas ventas, las cuales pretende mejorar para obtener una mayor estabilidad económica por medio de la cual le brinde todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos. Oscar solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar productos de primera necesidad por mayor, de manera que los obtenga a menores precios y así mismo brinde una basta variedad de productos, así también desea poder comprar zapatos para comercializar en su tienda. Oscar es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador el cual tiene como muy bien marcada su mayor prioridad en la vida la cual es el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Amilcar O. G. is 40 years old and owns a store where he sells basic necessities and personal products such as instant soups, shampoo, hair creams, bread, juices, disinfectants, and other items. He lives in Zacatecoluca, which is located in the Department of La Paz. His wife spends her time doing housework and caring for their two children, ages 15 and 12, who are the main reason behind Oscar’s desire to succeed and improve in his work. Even though his business is located in his house, he is still able to generate good sales. He aims to achieve greater financial stability so that he can provide everything necessary for his two children. Oscar is requesting a loan so that he will have the required funds to buy basic necessity products in bulk. This will allow him to acquire them for a lower price and at the same offer enough variety. He also wants to buy shoes to sell in his store. Oscar is a hardworking and responsible man who considers the welfare of his family to be a top priority in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel R. M. de 30 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, quien reside en el departamento de La Libertad, a pesar que vive solo, Víctor es alguien quien desea mejorar su negocio y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan contar con una vida mejor y así mismo brindarle ayuda a sus padres. Él posee una venta de productos alimenticios como pupusas, panes, jugos, sodas, fruta, así como también diferentes tipos de golosinas y agua embotellada, su negocio esta ubicado dentro del colegio llamado Francisco Lara, en donde posee la ventaja de ser el único chalet, lo cual le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias diarias ya que vende con la mayoría de alumnos y maestros del lugar. Es por esta razón que él desea poder invertir en productos los cuales los alumnos más solicitan, así mismo incluir productos los cuales son nuevos pero que poseen muy buena demanda como golosinas y bebidas, Víctor trabaja junto a una empleada, la cual se encarga de elaborar los alimentos que comercializan y junto a ella trabajan muy duro de lunes a sábado durante todo el día. Su negocio es muy estable y así mismo le permite brindarles fuente de empleo a otras personas, es por esto que desea mucho salir adelante solicitando un préstamo a Integral a través del cual  mejore su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel R. M. is 30 years old and a hardworking gentleman. He resides in the Department of La Libertad. Despite living alone, Victor wants to improve his business so that he can earn more income to have a better life and help his parents. He has a store where he sells food products such as pupusas, bread, juices, sodas, fruit, as well as different types of candies and bottled water. His business is located next to the Francisco Lara School where he has the advantage of having the only other structure. This allows him to earn a very good daily income since he sells mostly to students and teachers. For this reason, he wants to invest in products that are most requested by the students. At the same time he also wants to include new merchandise that has high demand such as candy and soft drinks. Victor works with one employee who is charge of making the prepared foods that he sells. They both work very hard Monday through Saturday throughout the entire day. His business is very stable, so he hopes to provide employment to other people. In order to get ahead, Victor is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable products

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 29 años, es una persona muy honrada y laboriosa, que vive  en su casa propia, junto a su pareja Primitivo de 30 años y sus tres hijos, quienes son su razón de vivir. Hace más de 10 años siembra diferentes variedades de papa, en terrenos propios y junto a su esposo, también crían animales como toros, carneros y cerdos, los cuales cuida cerca  a las chacras que va trabajando para no perderlos, lo que más le gusta es sembrar las semillas de tubérculos (papa), debido a que tiene que darles el espacio suficiente para su desarrollo, sin embargo el tener que hacer los surcos, le resulta pesado para levantar cierta cantidad de tierra, que abrigue el producto hasta su maduración. Nilda, con el buen entusiasmo que le caracteriza, asegura que la agricultura es bastante rentable, porque con las ganancias, pudo comprar más terrenos agrícolas, además cubrir los gastos domésticos, así como la educación de sus hijos. Por tanto desea continuar sembrando pero en grandes extensiones, además planea comprar más reses para poder engordarlos y venderlos en fechas festivas. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, se muestra entusiasmada el saber que continuará laborando con las personas más responsables en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para que empiece a sembrar papa, que es lo que más produce en su zona.
texts.en:
Nilda is 29 years old and an honest industrious person. She lives in her own home with her partner Primitivo, age 30, and their three children who are her reason for living. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been growing different varieties of potatoes. She also raises animals such as bulls, sheep, and pigs. Nilda keeps the animals near the fields where she works so that she can keep watch of them. What she enjoys most is planting potato seedlings. In order to give them enough space to develop, she must dig furrows and overturn large amounts of soil to keep the seedlings covered until they mature. Known for her enthusiasm, Nilda is confident that farming is a profitable endeavor. With her earnings, she plans to buy more farmland so that she can cover her household expenses and pay for her children’s education. She wants to continue farming, but on larger tracts of land. Nilda also plans to buy more cattle for fattening so that she can sell them on holidays.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Nilda is delighted to know that she will continue working with the other responsible members of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be used to buy several bags of compost so that she can begin planting potatoes, the crop that is most produced in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto tiene 60 años, reside en el Municipio de Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután  es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa, el vende productos de primera necesidad, el negocio tiene por nombre “Tienda Hernández”.
Inicio el negocio gracias al apoya de una hermana quien fue le enseño y le dio las herramientas para mantener la tienda, atiende el negocio en un horario de 7:00 am- 6:00 pm. Actualmente necesita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería (aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, leche en polvo) y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. Este préstamo le permitirá ampliar la líneas de productos que incrementara las ventas y generar ingresos, la desventaja es que las ventas bajen.
Los sueños de Humberto son ampliar el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades básicas, mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is 60 years old and resides with his wife in the town of Concepción Batres, Department of Usulután. They have two children. Humberto sells basic necessities at his business named “Tienda Hernández”.

He started this business with the help of his sister who taught him and gave him the necessary equipment to maintain his store. Humberto operates his business from 7am until 6pm. He currently needs a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, and powdered milk) so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers. The loan will allow him to expand his product lines, increase his sales, and generate more income since his sales have dropped.

Humberto dreams of expanding his business, meeting his basic needs, and improving the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, and powdered milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Natalia

texts.es:
