Segunda is a member of the El Progreso La Delicia Recinto rural loan program, in the San José del Tambo parish. The group is comprised of 19 members, and the community dedicates itself primarily to growing cacao and corn. Segunda plants corn. She makes her purchases in Mata de Cacao and San Jose del Tambo, and sells her products in Mata de Cacao and Ventanas, depending on the prices. She thinks that this loan is a good opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to improve her family’s standard of living and to grow her business. The biggest challenges we face are time and the lack of financial resources. She enjoys working and being happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing corn.

loans.name: Yasohara Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Yasohara Yesenia C. A., tiene la edad de 32 años es casada y su esposo labora como Auditor Interno en una Empresa Privada, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian la primaria, ella se dedica a realizar trabajos domésticos en un casa privada desde hace mas de 5 años, que ha representado una de las fuentes importantes en la economía de su hogar.

Ellos habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, en una casita muy humilde, y ahora en el invierno se le han presentado muchos problemas de inundaciones, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de  materiales de construcción que permitan llevar a cabo estas remodelación del muro del frente de su vivienda esto para una mejor, comodidad, seguridad y salubridad de todos los miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Yasohara Yesenia C. A., 32, is married and her husband works as Internal Auditor in a Private Company. They have two minor children who are in elementary school. She earns a living providing housekeeping in a private home which she has done for more than five years and which represents one of the important sources of income to her household. They live in the Juan Ramón Padilla development in a small and very modest house which during the winter has seen repeated problems with flooding. They are seeking a loan in order to purchase construction materials which would allow them to remodel the wall at the front of their home in order to improve the comfort, safety and health of all the members of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelling the wall at the front of their home

loans.name: Lucia Birmania

texts.es:
Lucia Birmania R. S. tiene 50 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 7 hijos, Marco (22), Silvana  (19), Lady (18) Darwin (20), Gisela (15), Mario (12) y Diana (11). 

Lucia es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Lucia se dedica a la siembra de maíz y al mantenimiento de cacao. Realiza sus compras las realiza en mata de Cacao y San Jose del Tambo  y vende los productos en Mata de Cacao y Ventanas según el precio mejor.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra del insumo de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño buscar mejoramiento en la producción de maíz. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta estudiar y la agricultura.
texts.en:
Lucia Birmania R. S. is 50 years old. She is single and lives in the town of Chillanes in the Bolívar province of Recinto Delicia. She has seven children: Marco (22), Silvana (19), Lady (18) Darwin (20), Gisela (15), Mario (12) and Diana (11). Lucia is a member of the El Progreso La Delicia Recinto rural solidarity group, part of the San José del Tambo parish. There are 19 members in the group, which is dedicated to the production of cocoa and corn. Lucia earns a living planting corn and maintaining cocoa fields. She makes her purchases in Mata de Cacao and San José del Tambo and sells her products in Mata de Cacao and Ventanas depending on where she can obtain a better price. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for her corn crop. She believes this access to credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to seek improvement in the production of corn. The challenge we face is time and the lack of economic resources. She likes studying and agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing corn

loans.name: Delia Rufina

texts.es:
Delia es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, pero actualmente tiene 2 nietos que están a su responsabilidad, Delia venD. comida en un puesto alquilado del Mercado 12 D. abril actividad que realiza todos los días desD. las 10 D. la mañana hasta las 4 D. la tarD. con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Además Delia se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras D. Chacco.
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga y solicita un crédito D. 2200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y pago D. peones.
El sueño D. Delia es aumentar su negocio y tener mayor producción en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Delia is a widow. She has 5 children and she is actually caring for 2 nephews who are under her responsibility. Delia sells meals in a stall she rents in the 12 D. Abril market. She works there every day from 10 am to 4 pm, and her children help hers. Delia also dedicates herself to agriculture in her lands located in Chacco. Delia is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Communal Bank, and she is requesting a loan of 2200 PEN to buy rice and to pay farmhands. Delia’s dream is to improve her activity and to produce more goods on her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and to pay farmhands.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio Z. C. tiene 22 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia.  Tiene 1 hijo, Alejandra (2). 

Manual es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz desde hace cuatro años.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para superarse en la vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta hacer deporte especialmente el fútbol.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio Z. C. is 22 years old. He is single, and he lives in the town of the Recinto Delicia, located in Chillanes, a canton of the Bolívar province. He has a child, Alejandra, aged 2. Manuel is a member of the rural bank El Progreso La Delicia Recinto, located in the parish of San José del Tambo: there are 19 members in this rural bank, and they dedicate themselves to the sowing of cacao and corn. Manuel engages in agriculture, and he has been planting corn for four years. Every month he buys products and farming supplies from the agricultural services division of AGRIPAD. He sells his products at the market in Chillanes. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy corn seeds. He thinks this loan represents an opportunity to progress. He dreams of earning more money in order to improve the quality of his life. The main challenges he has to face are the weather and the lack of economic resources. He likes playing sports, especially soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Ladia Violeta

texts.es:
La Señora Ladia F. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, sus iglesias, los 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad y su gente que es cálida y amble.

La Señora. Ladia tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentren de 20, 17, y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio, su esposo es jubilado de la policía, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado tener su casa propia.

Nuestra socia es empresaria de productos Yanbal, trabajo que realiza hace 4 años, vende sus  productos  todos los días ya que cuenta con una oficina propia.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y todos los crédito le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en incrementar su negocio y así ir creciendo ya que ese es su sueño.
texts.en:
Ms Ladia F. is a member of the Banco Comunal Sol Naciente (Rising Sun Communal Bank): she lives in the city of Cuenca, a place renowned for its beautiful landscapes, its churches, the 4 rivers it is washed by and its warm and kind inhabitants. Ladia is 38 years old, she is married and has 3 children aged 20, 17 and 15. Her eldest son is a university student, the other two children go to school, and her husband is a retired policeman; the joint working efforts of her husband and herself have allowed them to succeed in buying a house of their own. This borrower is a selling agent for Yanbal (a SouthAmerican company similar to Avon): she has been working in this capacity for 4 years, and she sells her products every day, as she has an shop of her own. She has been one of our members for 3 years, and through every loan she has succeeded in making her activity grow; this new loan she is requesting will be used to further improve her activity, thus making it possible for her job to continue growing, which is what she dreams of.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy make-up, perfumes, creams and costume jewellery.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es casada y tiene 6 hijo que ya son independientes ya su responsabilidad tiene 2 nietos que están estudiando, Victoria tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. cereales, productos que adquiere ahí mismo D. los productores, su trabajo se inicia a las 6 D. la mañana hasta las 5 D. la tarD..
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga y solicita un crédito D. 1000 soles para la compra D. menestras y cereales molidos.
Victoria tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is married and has 6 children who live independently, but she is responsible for 2 grandchildren who are in school. Victoria has a stall in the market called "12th of April" where she sells cereals, products that she purchases directly from the growers. Her work begins at 6 in the morning and ends at 5 in the afternoon. Victoria is a member of the community bank "Morenita Huamanga" and she is requesting a loan of $375 to buy beans and ground cereals. Victoria is planning to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and ground cereals

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor Maria S. M. tiene 36 años.  Es soltero vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia.  Tiene 1 hijo, Alejandra (2). 

Flor es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y soya.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz y soya. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener mejor ingreso económico para superarse en la vida. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Flor Maria is 36 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolívar province of Recinto Delicia. She has a 2 year old daughter, Alejandra. Flor is a member of the community bank "El Progreso La Delicia Recinto" which belongs to the parish San José del Tambo. This group has 19 members, and the community works growing chocolate and corn. Flor is a farmer who grows corn and soy. Each month, she buys the products and inputs for sowing the crops at the agricultural suppliers AGRIPAD and sells her products in the market at Chillanes. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies of corn and soy beans. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity for her to move her business forward. Her dream is to have greater income so that she can better herself. The challenges that face us are time and the lack of economic resources. She likes working in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of corn and soy beans

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Mercedes es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudiante de enfermería en un instituto, Mercedes sueña con estudiar 3 carreras como medicina, psicología, Mercedes tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes y frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, negocio que inicio hace 3 años. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de fideo, arroz, atún, aceite.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the community bank "Ccatarisum", which means "get up" in Quechua. Mercedes is single and lives with her parents. She is a nursing student at an institute. Mercedes dreams of studying 3 subjects such as medicine and psychology. Mercedes has a store in her home where she sells groceries, meats, and fruit, and she does this with help from her mother. She started this business 3 years ago. Her loan will be used to buy noodles, rice, tuna, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice, tuna and oil

loans.name: Ángel Misael

texts.es:
Ángel Misael Z. C.  tiene 26 años.  Es Unido vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia.  Tiene 2 hijos, Jaime (2) y Sleiter (5). 

Ángel es un socio de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz desde hace cinco años.  Realiza sus compras cada mes de los productos y de los insumos para la siembra en los Agro servicios de AGRIPAD y vende los productos en el Mercado de Chillanes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener una bodega para dedicarse a la compra y venta de maíz. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Ángel Misael Z. C. is 26 years old. He is married and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar in the Delicia precinct. He has two children, Jaime (2) and Sleiter (5). Ángel is a member of the El Progreso rural solidarity group of La Delicia precinct that is part of the parish San José del Tambo. This group has 19 members, and the community sows cacao and corn. Ángel is an agriculturalist and has been growing corn for the last five years. Every month, he buys the products and supplies for sowing from AGRIPAD agro services and sells the products in the Chillanes market. He is soliciting a loan to buy supplies of corn. He thinks that the loan is an opportunity for him to get ahead. His dream is to have a warehouse and to buy and sell corn. The challenge we are facing is time and lack of economic resources. He likes to work in agriculture and to go out with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of corn

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año, Lida tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril, en donde vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, negocio que inicio hace 2 meses con dinero del préstamo que adquirió.
Lida es socia del  Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua y llego a ser socia por invitación de su mama. Lida necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Lida sueña con construir su casa de material noble pues la que tiene es de material rustico.
texts.en:
Lida is lives with her partner and has a 1-year-old son. Lida has a stall in the “12th of April” market where she sells a variety of fruit everyday from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She started the business two months ago with the money from the loan she obtained. Lida is a member of the Ccatarisum Communal Bank, which means “Lift ourselves up” in Quecha. She became a member by her mother’s invitation. Lida needs a loan of 600 soles, money that will be invested in purchasing fruit. Lida dreams of constructing a house of finer material, since the one she has now is rustic.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Lucrecia Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. Lucrecia M. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive en la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, sus iglesias, los 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad, y su gente que es cálida y amable.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y uno soltero pero todos viven de manera independiente, su esposo es comerciante de zapatos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Lucrecia es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos y se ha decidido a venir a vivir a esta ciudad por su familia, es comerciante de ropa y  ha logrado tener un puesto en el mercado de la Feria Libre, labora 3 días a la semana y tiene este negocio hace unos 6 años.

Es nuestra socia hace 5 años y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como: chaquetas, pantalones, etc. Su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio y llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucrecia M. is a member of the Sol Naciente (Rising Sun) communal bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is renowned for its beautiful landscapes, its churches, the 4 rivers that surround the city and its people, which are warm and friendly. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. Three of them are married and one is single, and they all live on their own. Her husband is a shoe salesman. She does not have a house of her own, so she rents. Lurecia is a native of the province of los Ríos and she decided to come to live in this city for her family. She is a clothing saleswoman and had managed to obtain a stall in the Feria Libre market. She works 3 days a week and has had this business for the last 6 years. She has been a member of the communal bank for the last 5 years and has a very good friendship with all of the other members. Her new loan will be invested in merchandise such as jackets, pants etc. Her goal is to continue growing her business and to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, jackets, blouses

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. María T. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, sus iglesias, los 4 ríos que la bañan,  y por su gente que es cálida y amable.

La Señora María se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 4 años y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias y amigas del banco, se dedica a cocinar en una casa hace 3 años, trabaja todos los días desde las 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., también en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal actividad que realiza hace un año.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 17, 14, 10 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja para sus gastos y estudia en la noche, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en la escuela, su esposo trabaja en la rama de la construcción, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos Yanbal. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank "Sol Naciente". She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is know for its beautiful scenery, its churches, the four rivers that bathe it, and for its warm, friendly people. María has been with the community bank for 4 years and is very friendly with all the members and friends at the bank. She works as a cook in a house, and has done this for 3 years. She works every day from 9 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. In her spare time, she also sells beauty products from the Yanbal company, and she has been doing this for 1 year. Our member is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, 14, and 10 years old. Her oldest, a daughter, works for a living and studies at night, the second child, a son, is in high school, and the youngest son is in elementary school. Her husband works in the construction industry. She doesn't have her own house, so they rent. Her new loan will be used to buy more Yanbal beauty products. Her dream is to have a business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy makeup, creams, perfumes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia tiene 47 años, este no el primer financiamiento que tiene con Fundación. Su actividad es la venta de tortillas, frijoles cocidos y una pulpería. Hace más de 33 años que se dedica a este negocio. Pues siempre está pensando en mejorar su condición y la de su familia, no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio activo pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado. El financiamiento es destinado para la compra de maíz, leña y además la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, congelados, entre otros. El sueño de ella es poder ayudar a sus familiares, pues siempre está pensando en su bienestar.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia is 47 years old. This is not the first loan she has has from the Foundation. Her business is selling tortillas and cooked beans and running a store. She has been running this business for more than 33 years. She is always thinking of how to improve conditions for herself and her family. It has not been easy to keep this business going, but with much effort she has been successful. The loan will be used to buy corn, wood, and also to buy candy, grains, and frozen foods, among others. Her dream is to be able to help her family, and she is always thinking of their wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 48 years old. Carmelita is married and has five adult children. Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2007, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn S. is from the village of Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 34 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronelyn sells fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of RTW in the local community. Ronelyn has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Ronelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ronelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Ronelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
       
About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 
       
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have capital for her fish-selling and RTW retail businesses.

location.town: Bogabongan, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita T. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 37 years old, married, and has seven children. To make a living, Rosita render her service in house to house basis as a manicurist. Rosita has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her business. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used as an additional capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy materials for her business

location.town: Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

Lucresia T. is from the village of Talinga, Leon B. Postigo. She is 58 years old, married and has two adult children. Lucresia owns and operates a  general store. Lucresia has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Lucresia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lucresia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucresia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lucresia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

location.town: Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth R. is from the barangay (village) of P4 Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years of age and already married. She is blessed with a child who is still an infant. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a native vinegar processing and retailing activity. She is also receiving support from her husband. She’s been engaged in this kind business for five years already. She earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (Php) a month from this activity. Just this year, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Medal Pangnegosyo Loan Program, is now requesting 5,000 Php as her first loan to be used for additional capital for her native vinegar processing and retailing business activity. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for a future use, loan repayments, insurance, her child’s education and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her native vinegar processing and retailing business activity

location.town: P4 Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Maricel Donque's Group

texts.en:
Maricel D. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Maricel is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, the members are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Maricel D.'s Group.

Maricel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This will be Maricel's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

To make a living, Desederia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food products in the local community. Desederia has been engaged in her business for 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Desederia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Desederia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Desederia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Desederia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. In 2007, Rita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her hog-raising business. This will be Rita's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog-raising business

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly A. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Merly is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merly runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from serving roasted pork and chicken meat in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Merly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Honiwel

texts.en:
Honiwel S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Honiwel owns and operates a business providing cellphone repair services and selling cellphone accessories to local community members. Honiwel has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Honiwel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI

Renante L. is from the village of Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renante owns and operates a business buying and selling different kind of fruits in the local community. location.town: Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Yanaturo Alto  ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Yanaturo Alto está formado por 14 mujeres luchadoras  que  día a día con su trabajo buscan  mejorar su económica, viven en la comunidad de Yanaturo  que se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes; gran parte de su gente  se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, mucha de su población busca en la ciudad la oportunidad de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora Rosario C. es socia del banco comunal Yanaturo, tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda hace 18 años y tiene 5 hijos los cuales todos son casados y viven independientemente con sus familias, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa propia aunque es una pequeña casita. Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de pollos hace 2 años y también atiende en su tienda, la misma que tiene 15 años, labora todo el día y en sus tiempos libres trabaja en la agricultura cultivando su propio terreno,la producción es para el consumo de su hogar. Es su primer crédito, fue invitada por una amiga que pertenece a la banco comunal, su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y también para realizarse un chequeo médico.  Su meta es seguir creciendo en su tienda.

La Señora María B. se encuentra el la banco comunal hace 4 ciclos, fue  invitada por una amiga. Se dedica a la cría de pollos, los mismos que los vende pelados o vivos según como le pidan sus clientes, inicio este  negocio con el primer crédito que realizo. Nuestra socia tiene 22 años de edad,  vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión tiene una hija  de un año ocho meses, su esposo trabaja en una empresa que realizan instalaciones de agua y gas, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo community bank is made up of 14 hardworking women who strive day to day to improve their economic situation. They live in Yanaturo, which is known for its beautiful scenery and where a large number of residents make a living weaving straw hats. A large portion of the population also seek opportunities in the city. Rosario C. is a partner in the Yanaturo community bank, is 59, widowed 18 years ago, and has 5 children that are all married and live independently. Thanks to her work and effort she has been able to build a small home of her own. She has made a living raising chickens for the past 2 years as well as helping customers in the store she has had for 15 years. She works all day and in her off time she cultivates her own lands, which is for her own consumption. This is her first loan; she was invited by a friend and member of the community bank. Her loan will be invested in purchasing chickens as well as getting a medical check-up. Her goal is to keep growing her store business. Maria B. has been in the community bank for 4 loan cycles; she was invited by a friend. She raises chickens, which she sells plucked or alive according to her customers' orders. She started the business with the first loan she took out. She is 22 years old and lives with her partner, which whom she has an 8-month-old daughter. Her husband works for a company that installs water and gas lines. They do not own their own home; they rent. She plans to use this loan to buy more chickens. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens/ medical checkup.

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture, Meas N. and her husband, have spent their entire lives raising rice crops. Her husband is widely known as a skilled farmer who does an excellent job of helping to support their family. In addition to their farming, Meas N.’s husband also travels to any place to clean up the farmland for a fee.

The rains fell last month and this is good for growing crops. Meas N. wishes to take this opportunity to plant a potato crop, but doesn’t have farm supplies to use on her field. This is why Meas N. decided to look for assistance through Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes T. is a simple mother with simple hopes in life. Along with her family, she dreams of sustaining her “sari- sari” store business that is situated in their own home, which includes selling food she prepares herself. “Sari-sari” store basically sells small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items, and beverages.

“Sari” is a native dialect of Antiquenos for variety. This is just a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Items sold through this business bring convenience to people in the village, especially those who live far away from the town proper where the market is located.

Through the loan she is now requesting, which is twice the amount of her previous request, she plans to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables and other items people can purchase through her “sari-sari” store. By increasing the capital investment in her business, she is hopeful that she can earn more profits, which will be used to support the daily needs of her family and to improve their lifestyle little by little. Lourdes is also aiming to build up a savings fund for her and her husband’s needs when they are old.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in addition to her "sari-sari" store regular inventories.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. Phal A. is 38 years old and is a resident of Kompong Cham Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops and raises pigs, which she is able to do twice a year. Phal A. is a married woman and is the mother of two children who attend school or work as laborers, while her husband (in the photo) works on the farm with her. Phal A. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time when she could be earning money to ensure that her family has an adequate standard of living. She is applying for a loan to use as capital towards building a place where she will distill wine to sell to raise extra revenue.

loans.use: To build a place to distill wine to sell to raise extra revenue.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg R. is 42, married, and the mother of a one son. She lives with her mother in a house, which her mother owns, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, Enkhmend, 26 years old, lives in another town in Ulaanbaatar. Altantsetseg started a shoe trading business by purchasing products in Ereen, a Chinese border city, in 2006. Since Altantsetseg started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her children's education fees.

Now she operates a retail business and purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and resells them for a profit. After years of successful operation, she has managed to increase her working capital to a level exceeding 3,000,000 tugrugs. She is an open and very hardworking person. She is requesting a 1,780,000 tugrug loan to increase her working capital and to purchase cement to build a foundation for her own house.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and to purchase cement to build a foundation for her own house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
A loving mother and a caring wife to her husband and children, Mercy M. is requesting a loan of twice as much as the amount of her previous request. Aside from her intention of growing her duck-raising and dressmaking businesses, she and her husband are also planning to venture into buying and selling fish for an additional source of income. Food being the most important need of people, the couple thinks that fish would be salable -- especially because most people in their village are farmers who are poor and can’t afford to buy meat. 

Mercy and her husband are planning to help one another to directly sell fish to people in the village and in the neighboring village. Together they will walk through every community and house for faster selling to have bigger income. Toward the end of the day, she hopes to bring home food for their children and money for their allowance for going to school the next day. 

After taking out all of her family expenses, including her weekly payment to ASHI for the loan, from the income they made, Mercy hopes to have some amount leftover to build a savings fund for the future needs of her children in attaining their college degree.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of fish for selling, additional ducklings to grow, and cloth and other materials for dressmaking

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son S. is a 52-year-old rice and vegetable grower from the Kompong Cham Province. (Her husband appears in the photo.) She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like cabbages, rice, potatoes and morning glories. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured.

Her husband helps her with the farm work. Son S. has two school-aged children, while another one is now married and a vegetable seller. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Son S. does not have enough farm supplies to use on her field. Son S. is therefore asking for capital to use toward purchasing fertilizers, seeds for growing and some groceries to resell to generate more profit.

loans.use: To use toward purchasing fertilizers, seeds for growing and some groceries to resell to generate more profit

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Brgy. Pipindan, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 39 years old. Rebecca is married and has three children. The eldest is 17 years old and the youngest is a 12-year-old high school student. To make a good living, Rebecca is engaged in the fish-vending business. She has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Rebecca joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in income-generating activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. This previous loan was used for the expansion of her fish-selling business. 

She is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell and to continue to expand her business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rebecca from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to increase her ventures. With the help of ASHI, she has already funded the education of her three children.

With the chance given to her family by KIVA partner ASHI, the couple believes that they are getting nearer to the success of their family dreams. Rebecca’s dreams are for her children to complete college.  Additionally, she hopes to continue fish vending as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell and continue to expand her business

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean S. V. has raised crops since 2000 — a skill she learned from her grandmother when she was young. She is now married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works in the farm frequently alongside her. She has had great success as she is able to plant crops at least twice a year following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing but Yean S. V. doesn’t have enough capital so she is looking for a loan to plant potatoes.

loans.use: To plant potatoes.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela L. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 20 years old. Pamela is single. To make a living, Pamela runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Pamela has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Pamela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pamela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Pamela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
A loving mother and member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Amelia is grateful for access to capital and other services, such as savings and insurance.  With the support of Kiva lenders, Amelia is hopeful that her business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life to move out of poverty.

Amelia is a busy entrepreneur, managing her food production and selling the product in the local community. Her previous loan from Kiva has provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more ingredients for her food preparation. With the loan, Amelia has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory.

Amelia joined Kiva partner ASHI in 1997, attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education and home repair. Prior to ASHI, Amelia had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Amelia fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, Amelia has experienced positive changes in her life and she hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family.

Making and selling foods also contributes a good income for her family and that’s why, even if sometimes it is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another Kiva loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to support the maintenance of her ventures. This will allow her to grow her  business further so that their children fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and experience a life that’s full of happiness.

loans.use: To support the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie T. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Ronie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Ronie operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicab services to local community members. Ronie has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Akhtar is married to S. H., who works in a factory, while she supports her husband financially by stitching clothes for her neighborhood clients.

Akhtar lives with her family in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children who are still very young and have not yet started to go to school. 

Akhtar’s husband also has a fertilizer-selling business which he does after returning from the factory. He has contacts with the farmers and earns a good profit on the fertilizer by selling it to them.

Akhtar has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy fertilizer so that he can fulfill the orders of his customers. She hopes that he will be able to increase his income.

loans.use: To enable her husband to buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan O. is from the village of Talakag in Bukidnon Province. He is 27 years old. Rolan is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Rolan owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing a pedicab service to local community members. A pedicab is operated by a driver who pedals a bicycle connected to a carrier that can contain up to 2 people. Rolan has been engaged in his business for over 3 years, and he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rolan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rolan is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rolan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To invest in renovating his business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married woman from the province of Rizal. She lives with her husband and two children. In 1998, she opened her own sewing business. Her customers come from the surrounding areas and the nearby town of Binangonan, Rizal.

Gemma B. is a hardworking entrepreneur determined to improve her family's standard of living. She joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, in 1998 to gain access to loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. The first few loans she received enabled her to support the family’s sewing business. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income. 

Gemma is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for the much larger amount of 23,000 PHP to purchase cotton fabric for their sewing business. The capital will fund further expansion of the family's business ventures and help realize Gemma’s dream for her children to have a decent way of life. 

With these working funds, Gemma’s business will keep on growing and she will be able to please her regular customers and meet their growing demands. With the support of Kiva's partner, she hopes to see herself and her family change their quality of life and move out of poverty soon. Her goal is to have a tailoring shop a few years from now, so that she can give the opportunity of employment to others, especially her extended relatives in the village. Gemma hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun V. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Chun V. has been married for years and has four children. Three of her children are employed in a nearby country and one is a teenager attending school. 

Chun V. lacks farm supplies to use on her field during the coming season. To help meet her goals, Chun V. has applied for a loan in order to buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en: Pricilla S.'s main source of income comes from providing van or passenger-carrying services to local community members. She is 64 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Westfield, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. Pricilla has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Pricilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Pricilla is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Bahadur's Group

texts.en: Bahadur lives in Chichawatni in Pakistan with her husband and a son in a three-room brick house. Her husband is a laborer but his earnings are not enough to fully support the family. She is a housewife and stays at home to take care of her cattle. She buys young animals, raises them and then sells them in the nearby communities to earn a good profit.  She is always ready to support her family in any way possible. She has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah to help her son who wants to expand his fruit-selling business by purchasing more seasonal fruits. Bahadur is hopeful that her son will be able to improve his business with the help of a loan and as a result, her family’s living standard will improve.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is from the village of Balaos, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old. Evangeline is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns & operates a business providing hairdressing & beauty services, especially pedicures and manicures, to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha G. is a 41-year-old married woman from Binangonan in the province of Rizal. She is blessed to have three children. All of her children are minors and need her support. She is a member of the Tayuman center of Rizal South West Branch. Editha is a very strong-minded woman, and she notes that she works hard to make their life quite meaningful. Despite challenges brought about by poverty, Editha is still strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. Editha’s main goal is to offer her three children a brighter future and this is what motivates her all day. 

To make a good living, she buys and sells RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) and embarked on a rice-retailing venture for added income. She has been engaged in these businesses for 11 years. She joined ASHI, a first Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 1999. During the course of her new loan, this time in the amount of 23,000 PHP, to obtain additional stock for her RTW and inventory of rice, she is positive that, with access to additional working capital through Kiva partners, her dreams of building her own comfortable house will be achieved.

Editha hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall in the market place, instead of just in her house where she sells RTW products and rice. She wishes to be able to make enough savings to pay for her children's education and dreams of the best of life for her family who lives together.

loans.use: To obtain additional stock of her RTW and to purchase inventory of rice.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Regency, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Elsie is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services, especially pedicures and manicures, to local community members. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be Elsie's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is persistent in working towards her dream of making her doormat-making business more profitable. Despite having difficulty maintaining her business because she cannot reinvest her profits into it since it is also the main source of her family's daily expenditures, Grace is hopeful that someday her dream will land in the palm of her hand. To make this happen, Grace wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the same time to sustain its operation. With her great passion for giving her children a better future and decent way of life, Grace will be willing to work hard and supplement her husband’s irregular income as a doormat vendor.

As a loving mother, Grace’s dreams are always for her five children and family. She wants to bring her children a higher quality of life. In 2006, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Grace hopes to secure access to capital for the continuation of her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as additional and rolling capital for her doormat-making business.

Grace is hopeful that her business will grow and that someday she will have more customers around the village. She also dreams of sending all her children to school until college so that they can get better jobs. One of her dreams is to be able to build her own house; one that is durable and spacious.

loans.use: To support the needs of her business and at the same time to sustain its operation.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites has provided for her family by operating sari-sari (variety) store for more than two years. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income. Now that Marites has secure access to working capital, her profits are better than before. Marites is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for the amount of 10,000 PHP to increase her inventory of foodstuffs for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that she will support the educational needs of her five children until they complete college.

Marites is hopeful that her sari-sari (variety) store will generate steady profits to improve her financial stability and provide a better life for her family in a decent way. Marites’s biggest dream is to manage a full-fledged mini-grocery store someday. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of her sari-sari (variety) store is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of foodstuffs for her store.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
A new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Amelita is grateful for access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. With the support of our Kiva partner, Amelita is hopeful that her businesses endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

Amelita is a married woman with one child, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband. She is seen as strong and determined to improve their status of living. She is a caring mother of her only child, Bryan.

To supply additional income for her family, Amelita would like to receive a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional working capital for her sari-sari (variety) store and RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) business. With the loan, she will increase the inventory of foodstuffs for her store and buy more clothes to sell. She believes that offering a wider inventory in her business will attract loyal customers in the neighborhood and attract a steady flow of patrons every day.

Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is her hope to see her child graduate from college and find a stable job.

loans.use: To increate the inventory of foodstuffs for her store and to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tsetsegbal

texts.en:
Tsetsegbal B. is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of four children. She lives with her children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, on their own land. Her older son Batmunkh is an electrician. Her oldest two daughters, aged 16 and 17, attend university. Her younger daughter Battungalag is 13 years old and attends secondary school. 

Tsetsegbal currently operates a household products business at a local market called Asait in Ulaanbaatar. Since Tsetsegbal started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her daughters' education fees. 

Tsetsegbal is an open person who has very good communication skills. She says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good profession for my children."

Her business is very important to her. In June of 2010, she started to build a house. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction material to build the house.

loans.use: To purchase construction material to build a house

loans.name: Chhong

texts.en: Mrs. Chhong T. is 44 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, where she has established a small family home and earns a living as a local farmer. She is married to Mr. Korng Sron, age 46, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has four children, all are working as laborers outside of country. Due to the coming rainy season, which is when conditions are good for planting rice, Chhong T. has requested a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow on her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed to grow on her own farmland

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is 54 years old and works very hard to help her husband with fulfilling the needs of her family. She does embroidery work and is very good at her art. Due to her quality work, she is often able to receive good orders to earn a reasonable income. 

Her husband sells fruits on a four wheeled-cart in different streets of Pakpattan, where Khursheed bibi has lived all through her life. Her husband wants to buy some seasonal fruits to continue the cycle of his living. For this purpose, Khursheed has applied for a loan for the fourth time from Asasah. She hopes that the investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and he will be able to enhance his business and generate a good profit on it.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Ariunzul

texts.en:
Ariunzul A. is 37, married, and the mother of a three children. She and her family live together in a ger (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent), in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Azzaya, attends a local secondary school; her son Nyam-Erdene is 8 years old and attends a Buddhist monastery; and her younger daughter, Azjargal, is 2 years old and stays at home.

Ariunzul successfully operates a bicycle repair service. She also owns a small car repair business that they started in 2009. At first, the couple rented a small tire-repair shop but, after a year of successful business operation, she managed to open a new sales point and expanded her services.

Ariunzul and her family have been planning to grow their business in the future. Ariunzul is a helpful person with a good personality. She says, “My dream is one day to change my repair place into a large and warm auto-repair service.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to start a grocery store.

loans.use: To start a new grocery store business

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en: Laurencia T. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Laurencia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Laurencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia A. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 55 years old. Hermenia is single and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Hermenia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Hermenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Hermenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermenia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Hermenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly A. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Shirly is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Shirly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products and also retailing of rice in the local community. Shirly has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Shirly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirly is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Shirly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty and native delicacies usually for snacks like halo-halo or flavored ice-crushed, sweetened rice or suman, and salted peanuts in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a young dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last two years and has employed one farm-hand. His main product is milk which he sells to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries in Sotik town.

Benard is 24 years old and single. Apart from farming, he also operates a retail shop and a hotel in the same area. His biggest challenge in farming has been lack of enough funds to expand his farming activities and the poor pricing of milk.

He recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.30,000 and has requested this loan of KES.70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will produce enough milk for sale and family use. He will be able to service the loan and meet the family's needs.

Benard would like to improve his dairy farming in the future by building a modern dairy unit and improving the dairy breed to higher yielding cows. He is grateful to Juhudi for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz S. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 20 years old and single. To make a living, Paz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cell phone electronic loads in different networks and also selling cellphone accessories in the local community. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Paz is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina M. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. She is separated from her spouse and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
