As a businesslady, Margaret decided to join Joy group in Faulu Kenya where she could save her money and easily access loans. Being a member of the group, she has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a weighing machine, a sewing machine and also to obtain capital to start a business selling fresh fruit.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine, a sewing machine and to start a new business selling fresh fruit

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es madre de 2 hijos, el primero tiene 45 años y el segundo 42 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, azucar, sal, aceite, leche, huevo, harina, detergente, jabon, champú, fideos, etc., el negocio esta ubicado en su casa. Lorenza antes de ser socia de Finca Perú realizaba las comprás para su tienda por docenas, las cantidades eran menores, pero desde que le facilitan los préstamos ella compra cada producto por cajas inclusive los almacena.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Lorenza lo va ha invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, leche, huevo.
La meta que tiene Lorenza es poder comprár mas exhibidores para poder ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She has two children. The first is 45 years old, and the second is 42 years old. She sells groceries like rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, eggs, flour, detergent, soap, shampoo, and noodles, etc. Her business is located in her house. Before becoming a member of Finca Perú she bought things for her store by the dozen; the amounts were smaller. Since she received the loans she buys each product, including the ones that are stored, by the case Lorenza will use the loan she is requesting to buy rice, sugar, salt, milk, and eggs. Lorenza’s goal is to buy more display cases to be able to present her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, and eggs

loans.name: Gricelda Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Gricelda Elizabeth S. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, la misma está casada y tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropas y su marido se de dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas.
Ella atiende su local de ventas de ropas  y actualmente cuenta con mucha clientela, los dos se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante ya que el deseo de los dos es la mejorar la calidad de vida en que viven.

La cliente solicito un nuevo crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de ropas como remeras, camperas, buzos, camisas, pantalones y otros, a modo de renovar su inventario y cubrir sus pedidos y de esta forma aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Gricelda Elizabeth Sanchez is from the city of Cirapegua, married and has two children. She sells clothing and her husband sells fast food. She attends her clothing store and currently has many customers. She and her husband help each other to succeed since their shared desire is to improve the quality of the life that they live. Gricelda is requesting a new loan with our group to be used for the purchase of clothing such as t-shirts, jackets, sweaters, shirts, pants and others, to update her inventory and cover orders, thus increasing her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clothing items such as jackets, sweaters, t-shirts, pants, shirts, and others

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a dos hijos que aún dependen económicamente de ella, reside junto a su familia en el Caserío Los Positos, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, zona caracterizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en áreas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedida a comercializar animales desde hace mas de veinte años, en la zona es común que las mujeres se dediquen a este negocio, ya que con el ayudan a sus esposos a solventar los gastos familiares. Andrea cría animales menores en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando sus animales ya ha alcanzado unbuen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Ella desea incursionar en la crianza y venta de cerdos, para ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar cerdos pequeños para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.

Andrea es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, ella siempre ayuda a su esposo con las labores de agricultura, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima. En la imagen aparece junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Andrea is a 50 year-old mother. She lives with her husband, as well as her two children who are economically dependent on her. She and her family live in the Los Positos settlement, a rural area in the Mórrope district, which is characterized by having most of its population concentrated in rural pockets with great distance between them. It is located in the Lambayeque province, a little over an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling animals for over twenty years. In her area, it is common for women to work in this business in order to help their husbands with meeting household expenses. Andrea raises young animals in a corral behind her house, and when her animals have grown sufficiently she sells them to the businessmen who always visit the area where she lives. She would like to venture into breeding and selling pigs, so this is why she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. A loan of 2,000 nuevos soles will make it possible for her to buy young pigs to raise and later sell. Andrea is a very hard-working woman and is dedicated to her family. She always helps her husband with the farm work, and in the area where they live, her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in very high esteem. She is pictured with her husband in the photo above.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young pigs, to expand her business breeding and selling animals

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica, de 35 años, vive  en su casa propia, junto a su hijo Alexander de un año y su pareja Denis de 30 años, ambos trabajan con esmero buscando su mejoría económica. Lleva 4 años dedicada al negocio de venta de comestibles, en un espacio dentro de su casa, es capaz de vender todo lo que llega a sus manos, porque es una buena comerciante, pues ofrece sus productos de manera amable. Por otro lado cultiva frutas cítricas y plátanos desde hace dos años, con la ayuda eventual de su esposo, ya que él, trabaja en un asentamiento minero, ubicado en la ciudad de  “Yurinaki”. Como su tienda es la primera en abrir las puertas  a los clientes, su labor empieza a las 4 de la mañana, porque los hombres de campo salen a sus chacras a esa hora, lo que más le gusta es que su bodega este siempre surtida con productos de pan llevar, pues las ganancias le permite cubrir los gastos domésticos. Por el momento está ahorrando, porque más adelante, piensa construir una casa en la ciudad de “Santa Ana” o “La Merced”, para instalar una tienda, en donde pueda vender al por mayor y menor, además planea renovar sus plantaciones de plátanos. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está feliz de seguir siendo parte integrante de su grupo comunal, donde las personas son bastante unidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Jessica is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her one year old son, Alexander, and her life partner, 30 year old Denis. They both work with great care looking to improve their economic situation. She has had a business selling food for four years. It is in a space in her house. She is able to sell everything that comes into her hands because she is a good merchant. She offers her products in a pleasant manner. She has also been growing citrus fruits and bananas for two years. She has occasional help from her husband. He works in a mining settlement, which is located in the city of Yurinaki. As her store is the first to open its door to customers her work begins at four in the morning. The men from the fields leave for their farms at this hour. What she likes best is that her grocery store is always stocked with local food products. The earnings allow her to cover the household expenses. At the moment she is saving for later on. She plans to build a house in the city of Santa Ana or La Merced in order to set up a store where she can sell wholesale and retail. She also plans to renovate her banana fields. This is her second loan with MFP. She is happy to continue being a member of her communal bank where the people are very supportive. She will use the requested loan to buy food and basic needs products to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her business

loans.name: Onyame Gya Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Alice is a hardworking seamstress. She is thirty-five years old and has been running her seamstress business for the past eleven years.

Alice is married to a farmer with four children aged from 3 to 16 years. She had always loved sewing since she was young because of her love for fashion and her passion to sew for others. These inclinations landed her a seamstress apprenticeship many years ago.

Alice currently operates her business in a rented space in her neighborhood. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of fabric materials and sewing accessories like assorted thread, needles and thimbles in bulk in order to avoid price hikes and make more money to support her family and her kids’ education.

Alice is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Onyame Gya” (translated as “God’s Fire”) which is made up of three members. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing fabric and accessories

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es casada madre de 3 hijos, el primero tiene 23 años, la segunda tiene 20 años y la tercera tiene 15 años.
Yolanda se dedica a la venta de tara, cochinilla y cuero este negocio lo realiza desde hace 18 años, ella aprendió este oficio de sus padres, menciona que no tuvo ninguna dificultad en su negocio para la compra de estos productos ella viaja a distintas ferias en los lugares de Seccelambras, Acosvinchos, donde también van otros compradores pero la estrategia de ella para que le vendan estos productos es invitarles un pancito o refresco.
El sueño Yolanda es poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos, construir su casa, y poder tener una tienda de ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Amaquella Community Bank. She is a married mother of 3 children. The eldest son is 23, the second daughter is 20, and the third daughter is 15. Yolanda sells tara tree products, cochineal [a red dye], and leather. She has been in this business for 18 years, and learned it from her parents. She mentions that she did not have any difficulties in her business. To purchase these products, she travels to different markets in the areas of Seccelambras and Acosvinchos, where other buyers also go, but her strategy to get them to sell to her is to offer them a bread roll or a drink. Yolanda's dream is to be able to make her children professionals, build her house, and to be able to have a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of tara tree products, cochineal [red dye] and leather

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials for whitewashing his house; pay for labor

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, tiene 50 años es casada y madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. 
Juana se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción como: ladrillos, arena, hormigón, piedra, arena de asentar, arena de zanja y piedra chancada ella compra los materiales del proyecto cachi todos estos materiales los transporta en 2 volquetes uno es de 5 cubos (propio) el otro es de 10 cubos (alquilado a 5,000 nuevos soles).
Sus clientes hacen estos pedidos vía telefónica, le indican el lugar donde debe llevar y ella manda al encargado del carro a los diversos lugares donde le hacen pedidos. Hasta la fecha no tuvo ninguna dificultad en su negocio, la meta de ella es poder comprar dos carros (de 10 y 15 cubos) y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of six adult children.

Juana sells construction materials such as bricks, sand, concrete, stone, mortar, filtration sand, and gravel. She buys the materials in Cachi and transports them using two dump trucks. She owns one truck with five compartments and rents another one with ten compartments for 5000 PEN.

Her customers place their orders by telephone and indicate where the goods should be delivered. Juana sends the drivers to different places to make deliveries. So far she has not encountered any difficulties with her business. Her goals include buying two more trucks (one with 10 compartments and another with 15) and seeing her daughter become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel & bricks

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina describes herself as a persevering and hardworking woman. She has been operating her retail food business for the past two years, specializing in rice and stew. She sells meals such as these to day-laborers and individuals in her neighborhood.

Currently, Augustina operates her business from a kiosk on the side of the road. She is excited to be taking out this loan so that she can purchase cooking materials that will help her meet her customers’ demand: bags of rice, cooking oil, tomatoes and seasonings. She dreams of generating enough profits to support the education of her children.

In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Augustina, 49, is also married to a commercial driver and together they have seven children ranging in age from 15 to 28 years.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es viuda y madre D. cuatro hijos, el mayor D. 37 años y el último D. 24 años. Rosa se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. ORIFLAME y gaseosas D. diferentes marcas y tamaños, este negocio lo viene realizando desD. hace 16 años, sus clientas son sus amigas del lugar donD. vive.
En sueño D. Rosa es poder abrir una Farmacia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is a widow and the mother of four children. Her oldest child is 37 years old and the youngest one is 24 years old. Rosa sells Oriflame cosmetics and sodas of different brands and sizes. She has been in business for 16 years. Her customers are her friends who live in the same neighborhood.

Rosa dreams of opening a pharmacy and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks by the case

loans.name: José Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. José es de la Ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio Santo Domingo, está casado con la Sra. Ramona, y juntos tienen 2 hijos.

Hace varios años que trabajan juntos haciendo ricas comidas y vendiendo, son muy conocidas en la zona por su buen trabajo.

Realizan pedidos de empanadas, tortas, sopas y otros tipos de menú, de esta forma el Sr. José comenta que siempre se sacrificó trabajando y así poder solventar los gastos de la familia.

Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ingredientes como harina, carne, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Sr. José is from the neighborhood of Santo Domingo in the city of Carapeguá. He is married to Sra. Ramona and together they have two children.

For several years he and his wife have worked together preparing and selling flavorful foods. They are well-known in the area for their good work.

They fulfill orders for turnovers, sandwiches, soups, and other menu items. Sr. José says he has always worked and sacrificed in order to cover the family expenses. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy ingredients such as flour, meat, oil, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, meat, oil, and other products

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 24 años, es soltero, vive solo en compañía de sus padres. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El cuidar adecuadamente sus chacras es su principal función, desde hace 12 años disfruta ver como se desarrollan las plantaciones de plátanos, café, frutas cítricas, entre otros productos oriundos de esta zona, aunque le es difícil tener que limpiarlos, pues no le gusta machetear ni retirar las malezas, ya que estando a diario con esta actividad sus brazos le llegan a doler. Por  eso prefiere plantar y cosechar, además Juan pone en practica las técnicas agrícolas que le enseño su padre. En adelante continuara con esta actividad, puesto que el café y plátano son productos muy solicitados en el mercado, además desea construir su propia casa, y en ella instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y desde un principio trabaja de manera activa en su grupo comunal, junto a sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas de café y varios sacos de abono para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents in a home that they own. His primary job is to provide adequate care to his fields. For the past ten years, he has enjoyed developing his crops of bananas, coffee, citrus fruits, and other products that are native to the area. Clearing his fields is difficult work, which explains why he does not like removing brush and pulling weeds. Doing this type of work every day makes his arms sore. Juan prefers to plant and harvest, as well as utilize the farming techniques that his father taught him. Later on he hopes to continue growing coffee and bananas since these products are in high demand at the market. In addition, he wants to build his own house and establish a business selling groceries.

This is the second time he has received a loan from MFP. From the start, Juan has worked as an active member of his Communal Bank with the other members. The loan he requested will be used to buy dozens of coffee plants and several sacks of compost for fertilizing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & sacks of compost

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah describes herself as a persevering businesswoman who sells fresh yams to customers and also operates a beauty saloon in her neighborhood. She is married to a teacher. She is thirty years old and she is the mother of two children, 1 and 2 years old. She spends most of her time taking care of her businesses and also supporting her kids in school.

Sarah loves selling, and enjoys serving customers. She believes in customer care and her broad smile and friendliness has helped her retain most of her customers. She plans to invest the loan to purchase fresh yams in bulk and to include the sale of charcoal.

Sarah is optimistic about the future and she hopes to supply fresh yam and charcoal to boarding schools.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, tiene 24 años, es conviviente y tiene un hijo de tres años que esta en inicial, se dedica a la venta pantalones Jeans, esta venta lo realiza en las ferias que se organizan en diferentes localidades, también reparte a diferentes negociantes. La compra de los pantalones lo realiza en la ciudad de Lima semanalmente, este viaje le permite traer novedades. 
El sueño de Elena es poder abrir una tienda para poder ofrecer su mercadería, que su hijo sea profesional y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a three year old son in nursery school. Elena sells jeans at the fairs that are organized in different locations. She also distributes her products to various merchants. Elena acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima on a weekly basis. With each trip she is able to bring back new styles.

Elena dreams of opening a store where she can sell her merchandise, seeing her son become a professional, and having a home of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire jeans to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, tiene 45 años, es madre D. tres hijos, la mayor D. 25 años y la última D. 11 años. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, huevo, frutas y gaseosas) este negocio lo viene realizando hace cinco años en su casa que es propia, también ella compra tara, cochinilla y cuero. La meta D. Teresa es que sus hijos salgan profesionales y también hacer los acabados D. su casa del segundo piso.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra D. abarrotes en general para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest one is 11 years old. Teresa sells groceries (sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, fruit, and sodas). She has managed this business for five years out her house.

Teresa also sells tara, cochineal, and leather. Her goals incluD. seeing her children become professionals and finishing the second floor of her house.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy groceries for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, fruit, and sodas

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa K. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education. Her husband sews.

Yaa buys fresh fish from the seashore and fries some and preserves them by smoking them for sale at Abura. She has been in this trade for six years. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to fry and to smoke to distribute to her increasing clientele.

With the new profits from her extended business, Yaa plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to fry and to smoke to distribute to her increasing clientele

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad. Doris tiene un restaurante este negocio lo realiza desde hace 20 años. 
La meta de Doris es que su hijo sea profesional y poder tener un recreo propio (restaurante con juegos, espacio para descansar, piscina, areas para hacer deporte).
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de insumos para el restaurante.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 40 years old and a single mother with a nine year old son. Doris manages a restaurant and has been in business for 20 years.

Her goals include seeing her son become a professional and opening her own recreation center (a restaurant with games, a space for relaxing, a swimming pool, and areas for playing sports).

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, rice, oil, sugar, and meat

loans.name: Juan Simón

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Simón R. es de la compañía Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo está casado cuenta con casa propia, se dedica a la venta de leche y carne porcina hace varios años con clientela formada y buen nivel de ventas.
    
Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de una lechera que se le ofertó a un buen precio y de esta forma contar con una mayor producción.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Simón R. is from the Potrero section of the city of Carapeguá. He is married and lives in his own home. Juan has been selling milk and pork for several years. He has an established customer base and generates good sales.

He has applied for a loan with Fundación Paraguaya so that he can buy a dairy cow that has been offered to him at a good price. This will allow him to increase his milk production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 53 años, es una persona muy luchadora, es divorciada, tiene 6 hijos pero sólo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Los deseos de brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus hijos, mediante una actividad que le agrada mucho, motivaron a que ella, junto a sus hijos cultive plátanos y café en terrenos propios y arrendados. Ya que ellos, consideran rentable la agricultura. Además le permite solventar los gastos domésticos, pagar la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo puede ahorrar para cubrir alguna eventualidad que se le presente en el futuro. Julia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y aunque a veces le disgusta que sus plantaciones sean atacadas por algunos insectos, es perseverante y no se deja vencer, es así que a diario se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos y trasladarse a su chacra, cuidar de ellas hasta que caiga la noche. Como obtiene buenas ganancias con su oficio, en adelante quiere contar con una mayor productividad, por eso plantará más café, producto que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasmada de saber que continuara trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para esparcirlos y nivelar la producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old and a determined individual. She is divorced and has six children, but only two of them live with her in the house that she owns. Motivated by her desire to provide an adequate quality of life for her children, she decided to pursue a business. She and her children grow bananas and coffee on their own property and on land that she has leased. Julia considers farming to be profitable since it allows her to cover the household expenses, pay for her children’s education, and set aside money for future expenses. She has been farming for 15 years and is annoyed whenever her crops are infested with insects. However, she is persistent and does not give up easily. Every day she wakes up at 5am to prepare the meals that she takes with her into the fields, where she looks after her crops until nightfall. In order to generate good income and succeed in getting the highest productivity, Julia plans to plant more coffee since it has high demand at the market.

This is her second loan with MFP. Julia has demonstrated great enthusiasm as she continues to work with the other members of her Communal Bank. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of compost to apply on her crops in order to level out production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Juana Domitila

texts.es: Juana Domitila tiene 54 años de edad. Esta no es primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos, pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Pues siempre está trabajando fuertemente para mejorar su condición económica pues trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana a las 6 de la tarde,  hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho empeño a logrado salir adelante. Por las mañanas vende su queso y cuajada en su vivienda, por lo que sus vecinos recurren a su casa en busca de estos productos. El deseo de Juana es incrementar su negocio cada día más. Este financiamiento es para la compra de leche, cuajada, queso, crema, leche agria.
texts.en:
Juana Domitila is 54 years old. This is not her first experience with loans since they have been a great help to her. She constantly works hard to improve her economic situation. She works from 7 in the morning until 6 at night. She has had her business for more than 6 years. With a lot of determination, she has succeeded in getting ahead. In the mornings she sells cheese and curd out of her home. Her neighbors turn to her to purchase these products. Juana’s goal is to increase her business more each day. This loan is for the purchase of milk, curd, cheese, cream, and yogurt-like fermented milk.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther T. sells fried fish and smoked fish at Abura. She has been through junior high school and is married with two children. Her husband is a shoemaker.

Esther has been in her fish business for four months now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to fry for sale.

Esther hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Martha Dorely

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe un distrito conocido a nivel nacional por sus festividades religiosas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a confeccionar diversos artículos en tela como bolsos, manteles y otros adornos para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña máquina de coser en un ambiente de su vivienda, ella confecciona todo tipo de artículos a pedido aunque también los realiza de modo independiente, su principal grupo de clientes se encuentra en el distrito donde vive.

Martha desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más material, de modo que pueda aumentar su produción y también sus ventas, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar esta acción y seguir trabajando.

Martha es una mujer tranquila y alegre, su mayor anhelo es seguir implementando su taller y  enseñar su oficio a otras mujeres de su localidad, otro se sus anhelos es brindarle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior.
texts.en:
Martha is a mother and lives with her family in the district of Motupe, which is renowned throughout the country for its religious festivities. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She produces various woven articles, such as handbags, tablecloths and ornaments, with a small sewing machine in a room of her home. She produces all kind of articles on demand, but also on her own initiative. Most of her customers live in the same district as she does. Martha wants to expand her business with the purchase of more material, so that she can increase her production and also her sales. Therefore she came for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1000 new soles, which will enable her to carry out this investment and keep on working. Martha is a quiet and cheerful woman. Her greatest desire is to continue to tool up her workshop and teach the craft to other women in her village. Another of her desires is to enable her youngest child to study at a school for higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more material to expand her handicrafts production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is married to a farmer and has a child. Mary sells bunches of bananas and plantains by distributing them to her customers at Abura and her business is two years old. In supporting her husband, she helps to provide the needs of the family.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell. With the new profits she hopes to earn, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia, de 48 años es una mujer que se esmera por lograr sus objetivos, es soltera, tiene un hijo mayor de edad, que trabaja independientemente en Lima, mientras ella, vive sola en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de “Santa Ana”. Ella es una persona muy sociable y reconocida por la zona donde vive, la ciudad de “Santa Ana”,  en la selva central peruana, esto le permite tener amigos quienes la quieren, respetan y colaboran mucho, pues antes de joven, Otilia, era conductora radial en una emisora local de este lugar, ahora siente que su vida transcurre de manera tranquila, por eso en su vivienda instaló un bar donde vende diversas clases de bebidas, además de gasificadas, caramelos, chicles y cigarrillos. Sus principales clientes son sus amigos, que la visitan u organizan alguna reunión familiar, esto es lo que más le gusta, ya que no se siente sola, además que los ingresos económicos le permite vivir cómodamente e incluso arreglar la construcción de su casa, porque con el transcurrir del tiempo, quiere instalar una bodega que este bien surtida. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de la junta directiva de su grupo, hace prevalecer todos los acuerdos que toma la mayoría, además asegura que su grupo comunal, laborará de manera activa en bien de cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bebidas, cigarrillos y diferentes dulces.
texts.en:
Otilia, 48 years of age, is a woman who has a great desire to meet her objectives. She is single, and has a grown son who is on his own and working in Lima. She, on the other hand, lives alone in her own home located in the city of “Santa Ana”. She is a very sociable and well-known person around the zone where she lives, Santa Ana, located in the Peruvian jungle. This allows her to have friends who like, respect, and work with her. When she was young, Otilia worked at a local radio station. Now she feels that life is calm, which is why she installed a beverage bar in her home where she sells a variety of beverages, as well as sodas, candy, gum and cigarettes. The majority of her customers are friends who visit her or organize family gatherings, which is what she enjoys most since she doesn’t feel alone. The income from the business allows her to live comfortably and, in fact, she hopes to make improvements to the house because she wants to have a well-stocked store over time. This is the first time she is obtaining a loan with MFP and, as president of her group’s board of directors, she makes sure that they comply with their commitments. In addition, she assures that her group will work actively for the good of all the associates. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy beverages, cigarettes, and a variety of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame N. sells vegetables, groundnut paste, salted fish and other foodstuffs at Abura.  Maame has received a senior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a chain saw operator. Maame has been selling vegetables for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more vegetables and other foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 34 años, es una mujer honesta y laboriosa que está con su pareja Sixto de 49 años, juntos tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Mientras ella, desde tempranas horas de la mañana prepara los alimentos para su familia, su cónyuge, se encargan de laborar en sus cultivos de café, piña y plátanos,  para cubrir las primeras necesidades familiares y los gastos domésticos. Desde hace 14 años y lo que más le gusta es disfrutar de los campos, por eso luego de tener listos la comida del día,  apresuradamente se dirige a retirar la maleza de sus terrenos, de esa manera ayuda a su pareja a generar mayores ingresos económicos a su vivienda. Los fines de semana venden comida, en la puerta de su vivienda, aprovechando la buena sazón que tiene, el cuál es reconocido por sus asiduos clientes. Como considera que su labor es rentable,  con el tiempo planea instalar una fuente de soda y un bar. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra contenta, ya que disfruta laborando junto a sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos oriundos de su zona.
texts.en:
Yovana, 34, is an honest and hardworking woman. She and her husband Sixto, 49, have 3 children. They own the house they live in. Yovana gets up early in the mornings to prepare food for her family, while her spouse farms coffee, pineapple and bananas to support the family's basic needs and household expenses. It has been 14 years, and what she likes most is working outside. So after preparing food for the day, Yovana quickly weeds her land, helping her husband earn more income from their farm. On the weekends Yovana sells food from the door of her home, taking advantage of her cooking skills that she is well known for amongst her devoted customers. Her work is profitable, and with time she plans to set up a soda fountain and food counter. This is Yovana's second loan from MFP and she is happy working with the members of her community group. With this loan, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on her crops, which are native to the area.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Word Group

texts.en: Hawa S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in a village call Mabanta, in Northern Sierra Leone. She is age 45, married to a farmer and the couple has four children, three of whom are still attending school. For many years now, Hawa has been selling vegetable oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc.  This is the first loan that Hawa and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Hawa will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy margi, salt, vegetable oil, groundnut/peanuts, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy margi, salt, vegetable oil, groundnut, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Sabarnor Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sabarnor” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These small-scale entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses. 
 
The leader of this group is Fatmata K. who is pictured on the left in the first row.  Fatmata was born in Makeni.  She is approximately 26 years old and married with four children – two in primary school and two not of school-going age.
 
Fatmata makes a living by selling clothes, rubber bowls and slippers. With her four years of experience in this business, Fatmata will use her share of this loan to buy bales of clothes, dozens of slippers and rubber bowls to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes, dozens of slippers and rubber bowls

loans.name: Bisimilai Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Bisimilai” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariatu M. K. who is pictured on the left in the back row. Mariatu was born in a place call Sandugu, Port Loko district, Northern Sierra Leone. She is age 34, married and has five children.  Her husband is a businessman and three of her children are attending school. The other two children are still not of school-going age.

For four years now, Mariatu has been selling market food – rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onion, chicken, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy rice, palm-oil, Magi, onion, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Mohamed T. sells cigarettes. He has been managing this business for eight years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy different brands of cigarettes – Gold Seal, Bond Street, Capital, 555, Cosmos, etc,. at wholesale prices. He was born in a place called Konta, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is 27 years of age, married and has two children who are not of school-going age.

Mohamed (who is in the back row on the right) is the leader of this group. They are people running small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 500,000 leones each to enable them to expand their businesses. With the loan, they will be able to add more stock and make more sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy different brands of cigarettes

loans.name: No Promise Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu K. sells bowls, dishes, spoons, plates, cups, etc. She was born in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. Rugiatu is 37 years of age, married to a businessman and they have three children: one is attending primary school, another is in secondary school and the youngest is not of school-going age. Rugiatu has been running her business for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more goods wholesale to add to her current stock. 

Rugiatu (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. They are members of the “No Promise Group". They run small businesses in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living conditions will improve.

loans.use: To buy bowls, dishes, spoons, plates, cups, etc.

loans.name: Gbotima Group

texts.en: Meet the members of the Gbotima Group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 500,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Hawanatu S. K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with two children who are attending primary school. Hawanatu was born in Bo, a city in Southern Sierra Leone. Hawanatu sells fried food: fried fish, potatoes, cassavas roots, etc. She has been in this business for five years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy oil, fish, tomatoes, cassavas roots, etc., to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy oil, fish, tomatoes, cassavas, etc., to add to her business

loans.name: Mess Road Group

texts.en:
Mamusu K. sells bread. She was born in Makeni city, 38 years ago. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and four of her children are attending schools. She has been selling bread for 12 years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy bags of flour, sugar, etc., in order to produce a larger quantity of bread. 

Mamusu (on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. They are members of the “Mess Road Group" from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These small business owners have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, seeking a loan of 800,000 leones each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, sugar, etc., to make bread

loans.name: N.p Squard Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “N.P Squard” group. They are businessmen with small-scale businesses based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 each from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is John Borbor K. who is pictured on the left. John is age 46 and was born in Makeni. He is married and has four children, one of whom is attending primary school while three are in secondary school.

John has been a businessman for many years now. He sells milk, sardines, biscuits, drinks, Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. He will use his share of the loan to expand his business by buying more of the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy more milk, sardines, biscuits, drinks, Margi, etc.

loans.name: Marcos Andres

texts.es:
Marcos de 21 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, caminos pavimentados con lomas en disolución), el trabaja dando servicio de transporte, su papa le enseño a manejar desde pequeño. 

Marcos trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, para ayudar con los gastos familiares, en ocasiones trabaja con su hermano. Aunque es cansado manejar todo el día y tiene miedo que le roben por la delincuencia que hay, el continua trabajando para tener un mejor futuro.       

Quiere ayudar a sus padres construyendo mejor la casa donde viven por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y arena para rellenar las paredes que le faltan. En el futuro quiere estudiar para tener su profesión.
texts.en:
Marcos is 21 years old. He lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban region characterized by paved roads and eroding hillsides). His father taught him how to drive when he was very young and currently he works in transportation. Marcos works from 6:30 in the morning until 8:00 at night every day in order to help with the family expenses. Occasionally, he works with his brother. He is tired of driving all day. Also, as there is a high crime rate in the area, he is afraid of being robbed. Despite these challenges, however, he continues working in order to have a better future. He wants to help his parents improve the construction of their home. He is requesting the loan to buy cement and sand to fill the walls. In the future he wants to study so that he can have a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand

loans.name: Velinda Silvia

texts.es: L. Sra. Velinda inicio su negocio con L. venta D. frutas y quesos en un puesto en un mercado eso fue posible gracias a su cuñada  que luego le traspaso el negocio. Velinda tiene 2 hijas que son su razón D. vivir, elL. cuenta con L. ayuda D.  su esposo para mantener los gastos en casa ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer. ElL. se siente contenta trabajando con Edaprosopo y Kiva. su único objetivo es que sus hijas sean profesionales además del bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Velinda started her business selling fruits and cheese in a market stall owned by her sister-in-law, who later passed on the business to her. Velinda has 2 daughters, who she considers her reason for living. Velinda's husband helps proviD. for the family by working as a driver. Velinda is happy working with Edaprosopo and Kiva. Her dream is for her daughters to have professional careers and to proviD. for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La Sra. Nicolasa S. es de la compañía Potrero de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es propietaria de una despensa ubicada en su propio domicilio ademas de los productos de uso y consumo del hogar ella comercializando tambien  sobrecamas, dedicándose a esta actividad hace varios años.
            
 La Sra. accedió a un crédito el cual lo invirtió en su negocio, realizando compras de mercaderías como carne, fideos, haina, azucar, aceite, carbon, verduras, frutas y otros.
De esta forma cuenta con mayor cantidad de mercaderias y puede brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nicolasa S. is from Portrero, in Carapeguá city. For several years she has owned a store located in her house, where she sells groceries and household products as well as bedspreads. Nicolasa used a loan to invest in her business, buying things such as meat, pasta, flour, sugar, oil, charcoal, vegetables, fruits, and other items. In this way, she can stock more merchandise and provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, rice, pasta, meat, oil.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience E. prepares kenkey (boiled corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and serves it with fried fish and pepper sauce at Takoradi. She has been through junior high school. She is married to a driver and has four children.

Patience has been selling kenkey for some time now and supports her husband in taking care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize to prepare more kenkey to sell

loans.name: Every Day Group

texts.en:
Alice K. (who is pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alice was born in Makeni city about 45 years ago. She is married to a farmer and the couple has five children, two of whom are attending secondary school and one in primary school.

For many years now, Alice has been selling market-food – rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She also sells cooked foofoo (starchy dumpling made from cassava).

This is the first loan that members of the “Every Day Group” have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Alice will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more rice, palm-oil, Margi, foofoo, etc.

loans.name: Celso Gregorio

texts.es:
Celso es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, colindante con la ciudad de Chiclayo, este distrito es conocido como el mas poblado de la región y también es conocido como el más pobre, la mayor parte de sus habitantes vive en zonas urbano – marginales.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para caballero en un puesto de venta ubicado en los exteriores del Mercado Modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (El segundo mercado mas grande de la región). El adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Lima y las ofrece en venta con un trato amable y buena atención, esto ha hecho que cuente actualmente con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su puesto para adquirir los productos que ofrece.

Celso desea adquirir prendas de vestir de estación para que sus clientes puedan encontrar una oferta de acuerdo al invierno, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Celso es una persona amable y tranquila, sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos le conocen por ser una persona honrada y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los que le necesitan.
texts.en:
Celso is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, which is adjacent to the city of Chiclayo. It is known as the most populated district in the region. It is also know as the poorest. Most of the inhabitants live in marginally urban areas. He sells articles of clothing for men in a stand, which is located outside of the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo (the second largest market in the area). He gets his merchandise in the city of Lima. He treats his customers pleasantly and gives them good service. Therefore, he now has a group of loyal customers. They always come to his stand to get the products that he sells. Celso wants to get seasonal clothing so that his customers can find winter clothes. That is why he has requested, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles. That will help him achieve his objective. Celso is a pleasant and level headed person. His work colleagues and neighbors know him to be an honorable person who is always ready to help those that need it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy winter clothes to expand his sales stand at the market

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. sells maize and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Takoradi. She has no formal educational background. She is divorced and has two children and takes care of her children with the profits she makes from her sales.

Mary’s loan will be used to buy more maize and gari for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize and gari to sell

loans.name: Ketty Adelia

texts.es: Ketty tiene 36 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Ella trabaja en la confección de tejidos como son ponchos, capas etc. Lo hace en su propia casa con 3 personas que la ayudan. Ketty trabaja con dos empresas que exportan dichos tejidos a otros y también hacia la provincia del Cuzco, Con la ayuda de los prestamos ella tiene otro negocio que es la venta de postres. Las ganancias de su esfuerzo le permiten aportar con los gastos en casa. Ketty desea apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. Ella está muy orgullosa de una de sus hijas ya que es profesora de una escuela. Ketty agradece a todos los prestamistas además desea que ayuden a otras personas que desean superarse.
texts.en:
Ketty is 36 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has three children. She works as a weaver and makes garments such as ponchos, capes, etc. She works out of her home with three people who assist her. Ketty works with two companies who export her products to others as well as to the province of Cusco. With the help of other loans, she was able to set up another business selling desserts. With the income which results from her efforts, she is able to pay for her household expenses. Ketty wants to support her children so that they will have professional careers. She is very proud of one of her daughters who is already a school teacher. Ketty is grateful to all of the lenders. In addition, she hopes that they will help other people who wish to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional sacks of gari and soap to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina se dedica a la venta de gelatina, marcianos y algunos productos de confitería hace varios años y lo hace ambulatoriamente en frente de una losa deportiva en donde cada tarde juegan vóleibol muchas vecinas de su comunidad. Con las ganancias que obtiene puede hacerse cargo de los gastos familiares. Felizmente tiene el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como cobrador de combi  a Cristina le gustaría mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene 3 hijos que mantener pero, nuestra socia es muy optimista ya que vende en lozas deportivas y en cualquier evento que se le presente. Ella está muy agradecida a todos los prestamistas por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Cristina has been selling gelatin, popsicles, and some candy products for several years. She sells as a street vendor in front of the sports grounds where many of her neighbors play volleyball every afternoon. With her earnings she is able to take care of the family expenses. Happily, she has her husband’s support. He works as fare collector on a minibus. Cristina would like to improve her income because she has three children to support. Our member is very optimistic because she sells at the sports grounds and at whatever event that comes up. She is very grateful to all of the lenders for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso,  es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto, hogareño y respetuoso que tiene 27 años, que está casado con su amada esposa Esmeralda de 24 años, con quien tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 meses de nacido, a quien le pusieron de nombre Wilder. Al recolectar los productos que cultiva, como café, plátano y piña, siente que su trabajo es recompensado y que cada sacrificio vale la pena, por eso tiene 15 años dedicado a la agricultura, además su trabajo es menos pesado porque labora junto a su esposa, pero en temporada de  cosecha y limpieza de sus campos contrata operarios, a quienes por día les paga 20 soles.
Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo, es retirar la maleza de sus cultivos, colocar trampas para evitar que los roedores e insectos afecten y dañen sus plantaciones. Este generoso muchacho, ama a su familia, y quiere que en cada acción  que realiza estén juntos, por eso para su futuro, piensa incrementar su producción de bananas y café, productos que tiene gran demanda en los mercados y son muy bien remunerados. En adelante planea instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa, para que lo administre su esposa y así deje de trabajar en la chacra con él y pueda cuidar bien a su hijo. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y asegura estar contento de seguir trabajando en su grupo comunal, con personas que son responsables y emprendedores como él, además dice que en cada decisión que toma tiene el respaldo de su esposa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, también contratará operarios para que limpien sus tierras.
texts.en:
27-year old Alfonso is a hardworking, honest, home-loving, and respectful man. He is married to his beloved wife, 24-year old Esmeralda, and they have a 5-month old son called Wilder. Alfonso believes that his job growing coffee, bananas, and pineapples is well-rewarded and that any sacrifice he makes is worthwhile. For these reasons he has worked as a farmer for 15 years. Something else that makes the job less hard is the fact that his wife works alongside him. However, at harvest time and when the fields need weeding, he hires workers to help and pays them 20 soles per day. Alfonso most enjoys keeping his fields healthy and setting traps for rodents and insects so they don’t harm his crops. This generous family man who loves to have his family by his side wants to increase production of bananas and coffee. As there is a great demand for them in the markets, he gets good money for his produce. In the future he plans to start a home-based business selling groceries so that his wife can look after it and stop working in the fields. This way she will be better able to take care of their son. This is Alfonso’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP and he says he is very happy to continue working with his community group as they are responsible and enterprising people like him. He also says that every decision he makes is supported by his wife. With the loan he will buy several bags of fertilizer to spread on his fields. He will also hire some workers to weed them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire workers

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret B. operates a provision store at Takoradi. She has been through senior high school and is married with three children.

Magaret has been selling provisions for some time now and helps her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 2 pequeños hijos por los cuales salir adelante. Empezó su negocio vendiendo ropa para una empresa. Pudo juntar algo de capital, y luego se independizo Ahora tiene una tienda de ropa en casa donde vende pantalones, chompas, blusas etc. Las ganancias le permiten pagar parte de sus gastos. Consuelo tiene otro ingreso por el alquiler de mototaxi. Lo alquila desde las 7:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. A Consuelo le gustaría comprar otras motos que le permitan tener mayores ingresos. Además a todas sus vecinas ella les vende productos de belleza por catalogo. Consuelo está muy agradecida con los préstamos, y desea continuar trabajando con Edaprospo y Kiva.
texts.en:
Consuelo has two small children for whom she strives to succeed. She began by selling clothes. She was able to save up some money and become independent. Now she has a clothes store at home. She sells pants, sweaters, blouses, etc. The profits help her pay off some of her expenses. Consuelo has another means of income which is renting motor bikes. She rents them from 8:00 am until 9:00 pm. She would like to buy more vehicles in order to make greater profits. Furthermore, she sells beauty products by catalog to her neighbors. Consuelo is very grateful for the loans and wishes to continue working with Edpaprospo and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more motor bikes.

loans.name: Berenise

texts.es: Berenise, de 20 años es soltera, tiene un hijo de un año de nacido, vive en casa de su madre,  Floriza de 45 años y con tres sobrinos. Con la convicción de que cada cosecha, será  la más exitosa, que le generará una buena producción y por ende buenos ingresos económicos, ella, con la ayuda de sus hermanos y su madre, se dedica a cultivar plátanos, piña y café en sus terrenos propios, que le heredó su madre. Lo que más le llama la atención de la agricultura es retirar la maleza de sus campos agrícolas, para mantenerlos limpios, pues así permite que sus plantaciones crezcan de manera libre. Lleva 3 años en está laboriosa actividad, que le permite sacar adelante  a su hijo, quien es el motor de su vida, además puede ahorrar para poder cubrir mas adelante su educación, así como construir su casa e instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Por el momento continuará  plantando café de la mejor calidad, ya que es la más solicitada por que brinda granos más grandes. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y gracias a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, aprendió a invertir el crédito que llega  a sus manos, por eso le gusta trabajar con ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para esparcirlos sobre sus cultivos ya que le permitirán nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Berenise is 20 years old, single, and has a one year old child. She lives at home with her mother Floriza, age 45, and her three nephews. With the conviction she demonstrates, she becomes more successful with each crop. Berenise is able to generate good yields and earn a nice income. With the help of her siblings and her mother, she plants bananas, pineapples, and coffee on her own land that she inherited from her mother. She focuses most of her attention on removing weeds since it keeps her fields clean and allows her crops to grow freely. Berenise has been farming for the past three years so that she can succeed on behalf of her son, who is her motivation in life. She also wants to have the ability to save so that she can pay for his future education, build a house, and open a food business. For now she will continue planting good quality coffee since large coffee beans are in high demand.

This is the third time she has received a loan from MFP. Thanks to the members of her Communal Bank, she learned how to invest the loan as soon as she received it. For this reason, she enjoys working with them. With the loan she requested, Berenise will buy several bags of compost to apply to her crops so that she can stabilize production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 46 años, vive en una casa alquilada, con su pareja Héctor (51) y con el menor  de sus 3 hijos, pues los mayores trabajan y viven  independientes.Todos los días, desde las 5 de la mañana empieza con sus labores, atiende a los animales que cría – cerdos y vacas- luego vigila sus  cultivos de papa y alverja, junto con su esposo. Ya lleva 4 años dedicada a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, y lo que más le gusta es cosechar las alverjas y seleccionarlas de acuerdo a la calidad del producto para comercializarlas en el mercado, donde tiene varios clientes conocidos, aunque le incomoda trasladar los pesados sacos hasta ese lugar. Además de vez en cuando vende sus animales, y de las vacas saca rica leche fresca, que le sirve para realizar sus quesos, que también comercializa. Como sus actividades son rentables, quiere comprar más terrenos productivos que incrementen su cosechas, también piensa emprender el negocio de venta de papa, verduras y queso en los centros de abasto de la selva peruana, porque sabe que obtendrá generosas ganancias de sus ventas.Es  la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en las últimas reuniones observo como es la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal, y asegura que le gusta porque aprende de las experiencias del resto de integrantes.Julia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono y semillas de papa de la variedad Yungay, de esta manera espera obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Julia, 46 years of age, lives in a rented home with her partner Héctor (51) and the youngest of her 3 children as the older ones are working and now on their own. She starts her work at 5 am every day, tending to the animals she raises – pigs and cows – after which she tends to her potato and pea crops along with her husband. She has been raising livestock and farming for 4 years, and what she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her peas and picking the best ones to sell at the market. There, she has many customers that she knows, although transporting the heavy sacks with her product is challenging. In addition, she occasionally sells her livestock, and her cows produce rich fresh milk that she uses to make cheeses that she also sells. Since her activities are profitable, she would like to buy more fertile land in order to grow the size of her harvests. She is also thinking about embarking on a business selling potatoes, vegetables and cheeses at the general stores in the Peruvian jungle because she knows she can earn a good income from her sales. This is her first loan through MFP and, at recent meetings, she observed the mechanics of how her cooperative group works, which she enjoyed because she was able to learn about other members’ experiences. Julia plans to invest the funds she is requesting into the purchase of bags of fertilizer and seeds for the Yungay variety of potato. Through these steps, she hopes to obtain good earnings that will allow her to continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to improve the productivity of her crops.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is a senior high school graduate and is married with three children.

Gladys sells pans and ladies’ underwear at Takoradi, moving from one area to another. She adds her income to that of her husband in maintaining the home.

Gladys will use the loan to purchase more ladies’ underwear to sell. With the new revenue from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a shop to operate in.

loans.use: To purchase more ladies' underwear to sell

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en:
Benedictor M. sells salt both in small and large quantities to her customers. She is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school. She uses the earnings she makes from her sales to support her husband in maintaining the home.

Benedictor will use the loan to purchase more salt to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a storehouse for her salt since she finds it difficult to store her salt, especially in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more salt to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 33 años, es un ejemplar padre de familia, que lucha ante las adversidades, él está separado de su pareja alrededor de un año, y se hace cargo de su pequeño hijo Ángel de 3 años, con quien vive en una casa alquilada. La agricultura, es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 13 años, al cultivar plátanos, piña y café, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados. Es entonces que Edwin todos los días, prepara sus alimentos para luego dirigirse a sus chacras, en compañía de su pequeño hijo, pues no tiene con quien dejarlo, y permanecen juntos casi todo el día cuidando sus tierras. De toda la labor que realiza, le gusta cosechar los granos de café, asimismo le gusta escogerlos para luego venderlos a los comerciantes mayoristas, quienes conocen la calidad de su fruto y le pagan considerable ganancias. Tener mayor cantidad de plantas de café, le genera productividad, por lo que es bastante rentable cultivar este producto, que vende a S/. 8.00 soles el kilo, por ello planea construir una casa propia y continuar adquiriendo terrenos donde pueda continuar incrementando sus plantaciones. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y como persona entusiasta que es, se siente contento de continuar trabajando en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y contratar operarios.
texts.en:
Edwin, 33 years old, is a model father who fights through adversity. He has been separated from his partner for about a year, and he is raising their small three-year old son, Angel. They live together in a rented house. Edwin has worked in agriculture for 13 years, and he grows plantains, pineapples, and coffee on his own land as well as land that he rents. So every day Edwin prepares his meals and heads off to his fields, and he brings his young son with him because he has no one to leave the child with. They spend all day together caring for their land. Of all the work that he does, Edwin enjoys planting coffee and picking the beans to sell them to the commercial wholesalers, who recognize the quality of his product and pay him a good price. He hopes to plant more coffee plants because this is a very profitable product, which sells for 8 soles per kilo. He hopes to build his own house and continue to acquire land in order to grow the size of his farm. This is the second loan Edwin will receive from MFP; he is an enthusiastic person and is happy to work with the community bank. He will use the loan money to buy bags of fertilizer and hire laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and hiring of workers

loans.name: Eudocio

texts.en:
Eudocio is originally from Peru but moved to the United States fifteen years ago. He owns a fiberglass manufacturing company with his wife. He had experience manufacturing car parts when he expanded into the boat industry four years ago. He generates most of his projects for his community but hopes to work with bigger clients in the area. 

This is Eudocio’s second loan with ACCION USA (see his previous loan here: http://www.kiva.org/lend/164996), which he will be using to buy more materials and molds to better manufacture his fiberglass products. His work will also be showcased in an exposition next month. As a returning client, Eudocio has seen the great impact a loan can have on his business. Since coming to ACCION USA in 2009, he has been able to better keep up with his clientele’s demand. 

Eudocio hopes to acquire more projects with this loan. With new molds and materials, he plans to work on bigger boats for recreational and fishing purposes, as well as manufacturing more auto parts.

Eudocio’s greatest challenge has been overcoming the hardships of the financial crisis and keeping his business strong. He hopes his business will become so successful that it will be very well-known.


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy materials and molds for boat and car fiberglass manufacturing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional second hand cloth items to sell

loans.name: Los Socios De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Paulina es la Presidenta de su Alcancía comunal y ella trabaja con Edaprospo hace 4 años. Es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos. El negocio de Paulina es una pequeña bodega surtida de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, Los prestamos la han ayudado a aumentar su capital de trabajo pero le gustaría ampliar su negocio, A Paulina le gustaría comprar una fotocopiadora para que su hijo trabaje, además para adquirir más ganancias. 
Nuestra tesorera Francisca tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos de segunda 
mano, empezó este negocio en Provincias luego decidió establecerse por la zona, aunque aun lo hace ambulatoriamente le gustaría adquirir un puesto donde le permita exhibir mejor sus productos. Los préstamos la ayudan a mantener a sus hijos.
María Elena es la secretaria del grupo ella tiene un negocio donde confecciona ropa, hace un año. Empezó haciendo tejidos, luego decidió cambiar al rubro de confecciones, Los ingresos le permiten mantener a su hijo ya que aun es pequeño, además de los gastos en casa. La Alcancía Comunal cuenta con  socios muy responsables y puntuales con el pago de sus cuotas, ellos agradecen los prestamos.
texts.en:
Paulina is the president of her community group and she has worked with EDAPROSPO for four years. She is married and has 6 children. Paulina’s business is a small grocery store stocked with groceries and staples. The loans have helped her to increase capital, but she would like to grow the business. Paulina would like to buy a photocopier so that her son can work, and also to gain more profits. Our treasurer, Francisca, sells clothing and second-hand shoes. She started this business in the provinces and then decided to settle in the area. Even though she does traveling sales she would like to acquire a post where she can display her products. The loans will help her to provide for her children. María Elena is the secretary of the group. For a year, she has been manufacturing clothing. She began weaving and then decided to switch to manufacturing. The revenue allows her to provide for her son, in addition to the home expenses. The partners in this group have been very punctual and responsible with their payments. They are very grateful for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su pareja Jeremías (36) y su último hijo de  3 que tiene, pues los dos mayores son de su primer compromiso y laboran de manera independiente, mientras el último hijo es de su pareja actual.Desde hace 3 años, dedica la mayor parte del día a sus labores agrícolas en sus terrenos propios, junto a su esposo, y todo su sacrificio se ve recompensado cuando comercializa los productos oriundos de la zona (café, frutas cítricas y plátanos). En temporadas de cosecha, recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, a quienes le paga 20 soles por día, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es retirar las malezas de sus tierras, para que cada fruto se desarrolle libremente, sin embargo, le incomoda trasladar sus cosechas hacía su localidad para encajonarlas y embarcarlas a los mercados de la ciudad. Como su oficio es rentable, quiere adquirir más terrenos productivos y plantar mayor  cantidad de frutos, asimismo, desea instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles, en un espacio de su vivienda, por lo que tiene planeado terminar de construirla en corto tiempo.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, está feliz de continuar perteneciendo a este grupo, pues los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.Delia tiene planeado invertir una parte del dinero solicitado en la compra de  3 bolsas de abono y con el resto quiere comprar decenas de ladrillos que le permitirán terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Delia is 39 years old and lives in her own house, along with her partner, Jeremías (36), and the youngest of her three children. Her two older children are from her first relationship and they now live independently. Her youngest son is from her current relationship. For three years, she has dedicated the greater part of her day to agricultural work, which she and her partner perform on the lands she owns. All of her sacrifices are rewarded when she sells her products, which are all native to the zone (coffee, citrus fruits, and bananas). During harvest time, she gets help from her sons, who she pays 20 soles per day. Delia's favorite part of her job is weeding her lands so that each fruit can develop freely. However, it is uncomfortable for her to transport the crops to her house to box them and to ship them to the markets in the city. As her work is profitable, she would like to acquire more land and to plant more fruits. She would also like to set up a small grocery store in her house. She plans to finish building this soon. This is the second time that she has taken out a loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. Since she is familiar with how her communal bank works, she is happy to continue working with this group, whose members are very responsible and united. Delia plans to invest part of the money she's requesting to buy three bags of fertilizer, and with the rest, she will buy tens of bricks that will allow her to finish constructing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops and bricks to finish constructing her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase flour and other ingredients to prepare pastries

loans.name: Lizbeth
