texts.es: La Señora Lizbeth tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual ella atiende todo el día, el esposo de la Señora Lizbeth trabaja como obrero en una maquilaora, tienen tres hijos pequeños. Pero la señora es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea invertir en la compra de mas mercancia para el negocio y así poder incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Lizbeth has a grocery store where she works all day. Her husband is a factory worker. They have three small children.

Lizbeth is a hardworking woman and wants to buy more merchandise for her business so that she can increase her sales. Her income will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Floriza

texts.es: Floriza, de 45 años, es una mujer ejemplar que sola supo sacar adelante a su familia, pues es viuda desde hace 16 años, tiene 6 hijos pero solo vive con el menor de sus hijos y sus tres nietos en su casa propia. Su oficio desde hace 30 años, es la agricultura, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos para evitar que él se canse mucho en este trabajo y de esa manera pueda agilizar su actividad.De las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de su cosecha, lo derivará para los gastos domésticos, es por ello que le dedica tiempo, y procura que los insectos ataquen sus plantaciones, por lo que cada tiempo coloca trampas. El cultivar piña, plátanos, yuca, maíz y café es bastante rentable para ella, con el tiempo desea renovar sus plantaciones para tener mayor productividad, de igual modo planea instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, para generar mayores beneficios económicos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y  esta emocionada de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, porque considera que las personas de su grupo son muy buenas y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para nivelar su producción y cosechar granos de café más grandes.
texts.en:
Floriza is 45 years old and an exemplary woman who is able to move her family forward by herself. She has been a widow for 15 years and has six children, but now lives in her own home with her youngest child and three grandchildren. Floriza has been a farmer for 30 years. She has the help of her children which keeps her from tiring easily and speeds up the completion of the work. Using the money she earns from selling her crops, Floriza is able to pay for household expenses. For this reason, she spends time during each planting setting up traps to prevent her crops from being attacked by insects. Floriza grows pineapples, bananas, cassava, corn, and coffee. Since she considers these crops to be profitable, she hopes in time to improve her planting so that she will experience greater production. Floriza also would like to open a food store in her home so that she will have the benefit of more income.

This is the third time she has received a loan from MFP. Floriza is excited about continuing to work with her Communal Bank because the members are considered to be good people and hard workers. The loan she requested will be used to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer so that she can stabilize her production and have a harvest that results in larger coffee beans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 30 años, vive en su casa que es  propia, junto a su  pareja Rosario (40) y su pequeña hija  Medalí (4), y a veces reciben la visita de los 3 hijos mayores que tuvo  con su primer compromiso.Desde hace 15 años, se dedica al cultivo de plátano, café, frutas cítricas y piña, en sus terrenos propios ubicados en su localidad. Trabaja junto con su pareja, especialmente en las épocas de limpieza de los terrenos y cosecha, lo que más le gusta de su oficio es cosechar los plátanos, porque son de rápida producción, por otro lado lo difícil de la labor  es trasladar su mercadería  pues como los cosecha verdes tienen un peso adicional.  Paralelamente a esta actividad también se desempeña como albañil de construcción civil, y como realiza un buen trabajo, siempre lo contratan, por lo que tiene regulares ingresos económicos. Como desea pasar más tiempo con su familia tiene pensado instalar un taller de carpintería y metalurgia, para obtener mayores rentas.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y asegura que le gusta trabajar junto a su grupo comunal, porque los integrantes son personas muy responsables, honestas y colaboradoras.Edwin tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos para nivelar su producción y así espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Edwin is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his partner Rosario, age 40, and their young daughter Medalí, age 4. Occasionally his three older children from his first marriage will visit him. For the past 15 years Edwin has been planting bananas, coffee, citrus fruits, and pineapple on the land he owns in town. He and his wife work together, especially during those times when they have to clear the land and harvest the crops. What he enjoys most about his job is harvesting bananas because they grow rapidly. However, he finds it difficult to transport his merchandise because of the weight. In addition to farming, Edwin works in civil construction as a mason so that he can earn a steady source of income. He always does good work whenever he is hired. Edwin wants to spend more time with his family, so he plans to establish a carpentry and metal workshop in order to generate more revenue.

This is his second loan with MFP. Edwin says he likes working with his Communal Bank because the members are responsible, honest, and cooperative people. He plans to invest the money he requested in the purchase of several bags of compost to apply to his crops so that he can even out production and continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up on wheat flour

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el sector Monteverde del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Ofelia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo Carmen se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo comida en su domicilio, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades apoya a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantenerse en estas actividades.

Ofelia desea adquirir mas productos de belleza para empezar a contar con un stock permanente que permita a sus clientes agenciarse de los productos cuando los necesitan si tener que esperar hasta el fin de mes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y honrada, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband in the Monteverde sector of the district of Tambogrande, which is in the province and region of Piura. The area is known for its residents who primarily grow fruit.

Ofelia sells beauty products by catalog. She has a group of customers who buy her products on a frequent basis. The more orders she obtains, the more points she earns from the company to buy merchandise and generate higher profits. For this reason, Ofelia strives to attract more customers.

In addition, she sells food out of her home. The earnings she receives from this business help support her husband, a farmer, with stabilizing the family finances. She works tirelessly to maintain her business activities.

Ofelia wants to acquire more beauty products so that she can establish a permanent inventory that will allow her to supply her customers with products immediately without having to wait until the end of the month. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN.

Ofelia is a hardworking and honorable woman. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. In the area where she lives, Ofelia is well-known and respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure to fertilize her land and extend her cultivable land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her field and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and pay for ploughing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing the size of her farmland and purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en: Aqil E. is 38 years old trader who sells home accessories in a small shop in Agsu city. Aqil is married and has two children. He has four years of experience in the trade field. His monthly income is 260-280 AZN and he would like to increase it to 350. For this purpose he has applied for 1000 AZN loan. He hopes that this increases his income and that he can one day build his own business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his field and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en: Qadir M. is a 47 years old man who has been a barber master for the last ten years. He has a wide clientele and his barber shop is always full. Qadir is married and has three children. He has applied for 800 AZN to purchase more tools for his work and to increase his income to 300 AZN per month. His current monthly income is 200 AZN .

loans.use: To buy new tools for work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and enlarge area under cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extend her farmable land and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Agababa

texts.en: Agababa A. is a 46 year old man who sells different kinds of women's clothing in the central bazaar of Agsu city. He has been selling women's clothes since 2008 and already has a lot of clients. He has very good taste and he knows his demand, which helps him in choosing season collections. His monthly profit is 300 AZN.  He applied for 1000 AZN to increase his income. He wants to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and extend his farming land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional used clothing.

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en: Gullu D. has been engaged in farming for the last two years. She has her own garden where she raises seasonal vegetables and fruits. She sells her product to the local bazaar traders and her monthly income is about 160 AZN. She applied for 1000 AZN in order to expand her business. Gullu applied for this loan because she needs to increase her profit. She has a son, whom she raises alone as she is widow.

loans.use: To increase her profit via purchasing new sorts of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Get more land under cultivation and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Get more land under cultivation and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu J. sells house decorating items at Bojon. Kadiatu is married to a driver and they have two children: one is in secondary school and the other is in primary school. Kadiatu assists her husband greatly in taking care of the home. She is applying for a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to help her buy more stock, in order to satisfy her customer’s demands. Kadiatu has been a client in one of our solidarity groups and was proven to be a very good client from her repayment history and her promise to continue her good record for individual loan product. The proceeds from this loan will help her earn her livelihood and to educate her children.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow. She has two children: her son is 20 and her younger daughter is only 7. She lives in Stryi. Nataliya owns a small clothing merchandise business. She sells tees, bathrobes, socks and other retail items in her little store. Nataliya offers a nice selection of clothing inventory at affordable prices. She has been in the trade for 8 years. Currently, she has 8,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. Her income is slightly over 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and to boost her sales as a result. Summer is a slow season for many clothing items vendors and sales usually drop drastically. However, Natalya knows she has to keep her business afloat this season and in fall she will get back to her normal sales rates. Nataliya is a hard worker. She is willing to invest much effort in her venture to see it grow and develop more in the future.

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and enlarge area under cultivation

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has a son and a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Kamenka, selling food items, tea, coffee and beverages in her home town. She owns a small vending store which is the only grocery store in the neighborhood. Oksana has a rich experience working as a vendor: she had worked as a salesperson in the same store for 22 years. A year ago she became the owner of the store. 

Oksana loves being self-employed. She enjoys the process of making purchases, dealing with suppliers and serving people in her community. Currently, she has 10,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month. Oksana has many loyal customers. Her little store is always busy with shoppers. Oksana tries to constantly to develop her business. She has recently installed an air conditioner in her store to help preserve groceries better. One of her next business plans is to add a small outdoor cafeteria next to her store to attract even more customers to her business. This time Oksana is requesting a loan of 6,057 Grivnyas to purchase groceries and to re-stock her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of her farming land

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida J. is a 43 year old woman who runs her men's clothes business and has been doing this for the past years. She rents a shop in Agsu central bazaar. She brings clothes from Baku city, which is about 1.5 hours away from her home. She goes for a trip every month and her current income is 180-200 AZN per month. Khalida is married and has three children. She has applied for 1000 AZN in order to increase her profit and to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to increase her income.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married and has two grown children. He is a sewage treatment facilities engineer at the municipal water and wastewater treatment factory. He lives in the town of Nove Davidkovo, Mukachevo region. Ivan's family lives in a modest house without any extravagances. They have long wanted to have a decent indoor bathroom, suitable and comfortable for the family's use. 

Ivan's pay at the factory is barely enough to help meet the ends. His wife runs a small business to provide additional income for the family. Their salaries combined can't cover expenses related to the remodeling of their bathroom. Therefore, they are requesting a Kiva loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to fulfill their plans. They believe that the current loan will help them considerably to improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: To remodel his bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to expand her field

loans.name: Jaka

texts.en: Jaka Dabor is a business woman who sells readymade items at Old Gerehun Road Roma market. She is married and has four school-aged children. She is not living with her husband, so she takes care of the home from the little profit she realizes from the business. She has very good business skills and has a good credit history with ARD. She needs a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to help her buy more stock. Her intention is to see that her children are well educated and she is sure this loan will help do so.

loans.use: The loan is used to buy clothes.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married and has a child. He is a businessman from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Yuryi is in a construction business offering construction services in his region and beyond. He has been working in this sphere for 5 years. Presently, his gross income amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Yuryi is seeking an 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase construction equipment and supplies. Previous loans have benefited his business, promoting its growth and expansion. Yuryi is hoping to further develop his venture in gaining more experience and clientele along with providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase construction equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her cultivable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario, tiene instalado un kiosco para su negocio D. venta D. salchipapas, ella se encuentra en la zona D. Pedregal, ella es esposa D. un cliente relativamnente nuevo D. Emprender, por las referencias D. él, solicita este crédito que invertirá en compra D. papa, y otros insumos para la venta D. su actividad, tiene 4 hijos, todos ya independientes, con actividades propias, y viven por la zona del Pedregal, el esposo maneja un taxi el se dedica al transporte urbano, ambos se compraron el terreno y ahora tienen una casa en esa zona, ellos son muy trabajadores por lo que se solicita  un trato preferencial con la tasa Kiva, ya que son muy responsables en el pago D. sus cuotas. Estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario has a kiosk in the Pedegral District where she sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). Her husband is a relatively new client of Emprender and they both share the same references.

Rosario is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of potatoes and other supplies for her vending business. She has four children, all of whom live independently, operate their own businesses, and live in Pedregal District. Rosario’s husband drives a taxi and provides transportation services throughout the city. Together they bought land and now have a house in the area. They are hard workers who are requesting the preferential interest rate given to Kiva borrowers since they have been very responsible with their payments. Rosario and her husband are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, onions, and other supplies

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carapeguá en el Barrio San Cayetano se encuentra el formar parte del Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Cada una de las integrantes son mujeres muy activas que desean trabajar para salir delante de la mejor manera posible.
 En Carapeguá  una actividad muy común es la artesanía como la preparación de ponchos, hamacas, frazadas de lanas y de otros tipos de hilos, así muchas a de las integrantes se dedican a la artesanía como la señora Luciana quien es artesa.
Ella trabaja en esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, y fabrica los productos con la ayuda de su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos, trapos, colorantes y otros materiales que ella utiliza para la fabricación de sus artesanías.
texts.en:
A group that is participating in the Program of Women Entrepreneurs is located in the neighborhood of San Cayetano in the city of Carapeguá. All of the members are active women who want to work to get ahead in the best way possible.

In Carapeguá a common activity is making crafts such as ponchos, hammocks, wool blankets, and other types of woven products. Many of the members are crafts people, such as Sra. Luciana, who is an artisan. She spends most of her time in this activity and her family helps with making her products. Luciana is requesting a loan to buy thread, cloth, dyes, and other materials that she uses in making her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread, cloth, dyes, and other materials

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La Sra. Hilda  se dedica a la venta de material escolar ya que tiene una librería a lado de un colegio de la zona,  actividad con la que ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del  hogar que esta conformado por el esposo y sus dos hijos los que aun se encuentran en edad  escolar, La Sra. Hilda es muy conocida por la zona  esta hace mucho tiempo con la librería es la única por la zona, el dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de material escolar como ser cuadernos, hojas, boligrafos, perforadoras, engrampadoras, cartulinas, libros agendas, etc. tiene muchos clientes  también podemos indicar que la cliente es muy responsable con sus obligaciones  y muy trabajadora por  esta razón se le dio la tasa kiva, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Hilda sells school materials in her bookstore located alongside a neighborhood school. This activity enables her to help her husband with household costs. Her family includes her husband and 2 children, both still school-age. Hilda has long been very well known in her neighborhood, since her bookstore is the only one in the area. The loan will be used to purchase school materials, including notebooks, paper, ball-point pens, hole punchers, staplers, quality paste-board, calendar books, etc. She has many customers. We can also state that she is very responsible with her obligations and very hardworking. For this reason, she was recommended to Kiva. Hilda is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE, INCLUDING NOTEBOOKS, PENS, PASTE BOARD, AND OTHER SCHOOL SUPPLIES TO SELL

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El  comité Virgen del Pilar se forma mediante el deseo de las señoras de trabajar en forma solidaria y unida en ayuda mutua.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Digna quien se dedica a la venta de chipas que ella misma prepara y luego los lleva hasta el centro de la ciudad para su venta.
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo y con sus compañeras del comité ya que se ayudan mutuamente en todas la necesidad de cada una.
Ella como todas sus compañeras solicita el crédito para invertir en su actividade, como por ejemplo ella que se dedica a la venta de chipa quiere adquirir, almidón de yuca, harina de maíz, queso, grasa, y otros.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen del Pilar” was formed by the women’s desire to work in solidarity and provide mutual support. One of the members, Sra. Digna sells “chipas” (a Paraguayan variety of bread made with corn flour) which she prepares herself and brings them to the city center to sell. She is very satisfied with her work, her group members, and the mutual support for one another. Digna, like the other members, is requesting this loan in order to invest in supplies like: yucca starch, corn flour, cheese, lard and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yucca starch, cheese, lard, and corn flour

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en: Muqaddas S. is a 47 year old man who has been selling different kinds of food in his own shop since 2007. He is married and has three children. Muqaddas`s monthly income is 300 AZN and he would like to increase it to 500 AZN. For this purpose, he applied for 600 AZN and will use this loan to buy more merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to increase his income.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim T. is a 48 year old cattle breeder who has been selling cattle and milk in the small village of Saatli for his entire life. Ibrahim is married and has three children. His monthly income is 200 AZN and he would like to increase it to 300 AZN. He sells milk and milk products to the local people and to the milk factory of Saatli city. He applied for 600 AZN in order to rebuild the shed and to improve livestock-keeping conditions.

loans.use: To rebuild the shed and to improve livestock conditions.

loans.name: Nuride

texts.en: Nuride M. is a 43 year old trader who sells different kinds of food in order to support herself financially. She started her business in 2009 and, since that time, has been doing very well. Her monthly income is about 400-500 AZN because her shop is in a very good location and a lot of people pass along during a day. Nuride has applied for 700 AZN in order to purchase more merchandise and to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El  Sr. Felix V. A.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tiene 68 años de edad, es Viudo. El tuvo  6 hijos  quienes  ya son mayores de  edad, trabajan en forma independiente de su padre. 
       Se dedica en la producción y venta de productos agrícolas, producción y venta de leche y queso, con clientela formada, en los negocios del mercado de   Santani.
El cuenta con un ingreso estable, gracias a las atividades que realiza, actualmente desea adquirir desmamantes para engorde que le dejara un buen buen ingreso. 
Quiere incursionar en esta actividade ya que hay mucho mercado donde puede vender sus productos, y por ello que desidio invertir en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Mr. Felix V. A. is from the town of San Estanislao. He is 68 years old and is a widower. He has 6 children now grown up and working independently from their father.

He produces and sells agricultural products for a living: producing and selling milk and cheese to regular customers at the Santini market.

He has a stable income thanks to his work and now he would like to buy calves to fatten up and earn a good income.

He wants to start up this business because there are many markets where he can sell his products. It is for this reason that he has decided to invest in this enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves for fattening and selling

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, es una joven emprendedora de 21 años que vive en una casa alquilada con su pareja Leo, de 31 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años de nombre Dimas. Piña, café y plátanos, son los productos que cultiva, en ocasiones su esposo la apoya en la agricultura, mientras que Haydee se encarga de la preparación de los alimentos y de la atención a sus hijos. Llevan 5 años dedicados a las actividades agrícolas y con las ganancias que obtiene cubren los gastos domésticos y viven cómodamente sin pasar necesidad ni apuros económicos. A ella, le gusta recolectar los granos de café en sus canastas, pues su fruto es una de las mejores de la zona, por la calidad y cantidad que le brindan, siendo estas comercializadas a los acopiadores, vendiéndolas a S/. 8.00 soles por kilo. Para brindarle lo mejor a su hijo, planea plantar más café, en los terrenos propios que tiene, asimismo quiere construir su casa. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y reafirma que se siente gustosa de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, porque aprende nuevas lecciones en cada reunión donde escuchan las charlas educativas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá sobre sus plantaciones de café después de cosecharlos.
texts.en:
Haydee is a young, 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives in a rented house with her partner Leo who is 31-years-old. Together they have a 2-year-old son named Dimas. She grows pineapples, coffee and plantain. Sometimes her husband helps out in the fields whilst Haydee gets on with preparing their meals and looking after their children. They have been working in agriculture for 5 years and cover the household costs with their earnings. They live comfortably without needing to go without anything. She enjoys collecting the coffee beens in her baskets - they are some of the best in the area, both in terms of quality and quantity. The beans are sold to collectors for 8 soles per kilo. In order to give her son the best in life, she plans to plant more coffee on the land they own. She would also like to build a house for the family. This is the third time that she has had a loan from MFP and she is again happy to continue working in the communal group as she learns new lessons at every meeting where they listen to educational talks. With this loan that she is requesting, she will buy various sacks of compost which she will sprinkle on her coffee plantations after she has harvested them.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of compost

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El Señor Nicanor A. M.  es de la ciudad de Santani, el cuenta con casa propia,  tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Raquel Carolina Vera de 26 años de edad, tienen 2 hijos.
Tiene un colectivo que trabaja con la Empresa San Vicente, desde hace 8 años, en varios tramos de ciudad, ademas del transporte el también tiene animales vacunos y se dedica a la agricultura.
 
           

Este crédito utilizó para la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su colectivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicanor A. M. lives in the city of Santani. He lives in his own home and he is 28 years old. He is married with Mrs. Raquel Carolina Vera, 26 years old, and they have two children together. He drives a bus with the San Vicente company and he has being doing so for the past 8 years. He covers various sectors of the city. In addition to public transportation he also raises livestock and invests his time in agriculture. This loan will be used to purchase new seat covers for the his bus.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new car seat covers for his bus.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 25 años,  vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Lucila de 33 años y su pequeño hijo de un año. Consiente que los cuidados que le brinda a sus cultivos serán decisivos para una buena cosecha, desde tempranas horas de la mañana, sale presuroso a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y piña,  con la ayuda eventual de su pareja. Lleva 2 años empleando las técnicas agrícolas sobre sus terrenos propios, el cual le ha generado buenas satisfacciones por lo que considera rentable su oficio, pues puede cubrir los gastos de su familia, así como ha logrado comprar otro espacio de terreno para cultivar. Lo que más le gusta es observar sus plantaciones siempre limpias, sin maleza que obstruya su crecimiento. Con el tiempo planea tener más plantaciones que le permitan tener mayores beneficios, asimismo quiere instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en su casa, el cual sería administrado por su cónyuge, quien de esa manera podría cuidar tranquilamente a su menor hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta feliz de trabajar en su grupo comunal, donde lo motivan a ahorrar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, para echar sobre sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Luis, 25, lives in his own home with his partner Lucila, 33, and their little 1-year-old son. Knowing that caring for his crops will be crucial to obtaining a good harvest, he rushes out early in the morning to take care of his coffee, pineapple, and banana plants; his partner helps him occasionally. Luis has been implementing agricultural techniques on his land for two years; he's been satisfied and considers his business profitable. His business allows him to cover the household's expenses, and he has been able to buy additional land. What Luis enjoys most is seeing his crops clean, without weeds to hinder their growth. In time, he plans to have more crops, which would allow him to earn more. He also wants to have a store at home from which to sell foodstuffs. The store would be managed by his partner, and would allow her to care comfortably for their small child. This is the second loan Luis obtains from Kiva partner MFP. He is happy to be working with his fellow community bank members; they motivate him to save. With this loan, he will buy several bags of fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Evenor Del Carmen

texts.es: Evenor  del Carmen tiene 56 años, Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de teléfonos y recargas telefónicas. Pues tiene 2 hijos a bajo su responsabilidad, Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que su familia necesita, el es un hombre muy responsable siempre le ha gustado ganarse el pan de cada día de la manera más humilde. El financiamiento es para la compra de recargas telefónicas de mayor cantidad para suplir la demanda de sus clientes y también para realizarles mejoras a su local. Sueña con seguir creciendo en su negocio cada día más.
texts.en:
Evenor del Carmen is 56 years old. He offers pay phones to the public and he also sells prepaid cell phone cards. He has 2 children in his care. He has been running his business for the past 6 years, always making sure that his family's needs are taken care of. He is a very responsible man and he has always enjoyed being the bread winner, in the most humble possible way. This loan will be to fund the purchase of prepaid cell phone cards on wholesale so that he will be able to supply his clients' demands. He also wishes to do some renovations to his shop. He dreams of being able to continue developing his business, every day more and more.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, tiene 54 años, está casado con Vicenta, de 54 años, ambos viven en su casa propia, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales viven con dos de ellos, ya que los demás trabajan de manera independiente, en la ciudad de Lima. Los productos que cultiva son: Plátano, café y piña, en terrenos que posee, desde hace 30 años, pues le gusta trabajar con esmero junto a su amada esposa, de esta manera cubre los gastos de su familia. Ambos logran producir buena cosecha, en la que son comercializados en los mercados de la ciudad de Lima, para ello ya cuenta con comerciantes mayoristas, quienes  conocen la calidad de sus productos, lo que asegura una venta rápida, pero el trasladar sus cosechas les resulta un costo muy elevado por el flete. Como su actividad es bastante rentable, le permite vivir cómodamente, es por ello que quiere incrementar la cantidad de producción y ser uno de los mejores productores. En el futuro planea instalar un vivero de café, para renovar sus plantaciones en la siguiente campaña de siembra. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y desde que empezó a trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, está contento porque le gusta el desempeño que tienen. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en sus plantaciones, también comprará plantas de café y bolsas para instalar un vivero.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 54 years old and is married to Vicenta, also 54. They live in their own home and have six children. Marcelino and Vicenta live with two of their children, while the rest of the kids live and work in Lima. Marcelino has grown bananas, coffee and pineapples on his land for 30 years. Not only does he enjoy working hard along with his beloved wife, but he is also able to cover the household's expenses. Marcelino and his wife recently had successful harvests and were able to sell their produce at a wholesale market in Lima, where his clients know the quality of his produce and readily buy from him. Transporting the harvest to the market, however, costs a lot of money. Because his business is quite profitable, Marcelino lives comfortably. Nonetheless, he wants to increase the size of his crops and become one of the more profitable farmers in the area. In the near future, he would like to build a greenhouse where to start the next generation of coffee plants. This is his third loan with Kiva partner MFP, where he is happy working with his fellow members at the community bank. With this loan, he will buy organic fertilizer for his crops, as well as coffee plants and materials to build his greenhouse.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying organic fertilizer, coffee plants, and materials for a new greenhouse

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama C. est une femme de 28 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de BOYINGUEL depuis 2007.

Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre, d'huile végétale, de riz et de condiments de cuisine. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son capital et augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement pour faire la promotion de son activité. 

Ces bénéfices lui serviront à prendre en charge sa progéniture par rapport à la nourriture, la santé, l'habillement etc.
texts.en:
Adama C. is a 28-year old woman, a widow and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BOYINGUEL since 2007. She runs a small business selling sugar, vegetable oil, rice, and cooking condiments. With her new loan, she plans to strengthen her capital and increase her supplies to promote her activity. Her profits will allow her provide for her children with food, health care, clothing, etc.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, rice and condiments

loans.name: Arco Iris ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Arco Iris esta formado por un grupo de 9 mujeres quienes  luchan  día a día en sus trabajos para mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en la comunidad de 3 Marías la misma que es reconocida por su producción en la agricultura, mucha de su población joven sale a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo y también han migrado para buscar una mejor estabilidad económica para sus familias.

La Señora. Mariana vive en la comunidad de 3 Marías, es nuestra socia hace 4 años y  los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, el mismo que es la cría de pollos y cuyes, inicio este negocio cuando se caso y ha sido la manera de ayudar en la economía de su hogar, también se dedica a cultivar sus tierras, en donde siembra verduras que son para el consumo de su hogar y también las vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 29, 27, 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos son solteros, trabajan y ayudan a la economía de su hogar, solo su cuarto hijo es casado y vive independientemente, su esposo es jubilado y  gracia al trabajo conyugal han logrado tener su casa propia. Nuestra socia va ha invertir su nuevo préstamo en la  compra de alimento para sus pollos, su meta es  crecer  en su negocio.

La Señora. Lourdes  vive en la comunidad de 3 Marías, nuestras socia es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 17, 11 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia trabaja en el bar de una escuela de la comunidad por 10 años, ahora se encuentra de vacaciones y esta muy ansiosa que retomen las clases los niños para volver al trabajo,  también se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes actividad de ha empezado hace un año y le va muy bien ya que hay mucha demanda.

La Señora. Lourdes se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal, ya que extrañaba a sus compañeras del bankito,  su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento, su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Arco is made up of a group of 9 women that work hard every day in their businesses, to improve the finances of the family. They live in the community 3 Marias, the same community that is well known for its agricultural products. Much of the young members of the population leave the city in search of better work and they also migrate to look for greater financial stability for their families. Mariana lives in the 3 Marias community. She has been a member of the community bank for the past 4 years and the loans have greatly benefitted her business. She raises chickens and guinea pigs. She started out the business when she married and it has been her way of contributin to the family's finances. She also cultivates the land, where she sows vegetables for their own use and for sale in the community. This member is 53 years old, she is married, and she has 5 children, aged: 29, 27, 23, 21 and 19 years old. Her four sons are all single and they all work. They contribute to the family's finances. Only their fourth child is married and lives independently. Her husband is retired and it was in working together that they are able to have their own home. The member will be investing her new loan in the purchase of chicken feed. Her goal is to make her business grow. Lourdes lives in the community of 3 Marias. She is a single mother of three children, aged 17, 11 and 8 years of age. Her eldest child is in college and the other two are schooled. With hard work and with the help of her business she has managed to build her own home. She has worked for the past 10 years in the community school cafetaria. She is currently on holidays but she is anxious to have the kids go back to school so that she can go back to work. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs. She started this out last year and it has been going well, as there is a great deal of demand. Lourdes has rejoined the community bank after having missed her colleagues. This loan will be invested in the purchase of chicken and their feed. Her goal is to keep her business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ilda Isabel

texts.es:
La  Sra. Ilda Isabel B. P.   es de la ciudad de San Estanislao,  tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alcides Almiron con 40 años de edad, Actualmente tienen 2 hijos todos en edad escolar.
 
Posee una Despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, es una señora muy trabajadora,  excelente cliente con la Fundacion Paraguaya.

El cliente con este credito quiere comprar mercaderias para su despensa como azucar, arroz, yerba, fideos, aceite y otros, para esto solicita el prestamo y de esa forma concretar la compra.
texts.en:
Ilda Isabel B. P. is from San Estanislao city. She is 30 years old and is married to Alcides Almiron, who is 40 years old. They currently have two school-age children. She manages a store from her own home and has a good customer base. She has a good income, good business and personal references and she is a hardworking lady, a great customer of Fundacion Paraguaya. With this credit the client wants to buy merchandise for her store, such as sugar, rice, tea, noodles, cooking oil and other. She is requesting the credit to finalise the purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, flour, tea, noodles, cooking oil.

loans.name: Daliz De La Luz

texts.es: Daliz De La Luz tiene 62 años, su actividad es un bar y comedor. Hace más de 23 años que tiene esta actividad, por lo que sus inicios se dan cuando una señora le dio la oportunidad de trabajar como empleada en un comedor y así aprendió por lo que se decide establecer su propio local, con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de los financiamientos. Ella se levanta muy temprano para buscar sus productos y ofrecer una gran variedad de platillos en su establecimiento, con la ayuda de su esposo y los sacrificios han salido adelante. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, juegos, utensilios para la cocina, gaseosas y otros productos.
texts.en:
Daliz De La Luz is 62 years old. She owns a bar and cafeteria. She has been in business for over 23 years. She started when a woman gave her the opportunity to work at her cafeteria. That is how she learned, and she decided to set up her own premises with great effort and help from the fundings. She gets up early to search for products to offer a great variety of dishes in her premises. The business is going ahead thanks to the help of her husband and their sacrifices. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of basic grains, dinner services, cookware, soft drinks and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 40 años, es una persona que ante todo primero busca el bienestar de su familia, pues vive con su pareja Mary Luz de 26 años y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. El amor a las tierras que lo vieron nacer ha hecho que Roberto, lleve 8 años dedicado al cultivo de plátanos y café, en sus terrenos propios. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa, pero en temporada de limpieza y cosecha necesariamente contrata operarios para agilizar dicho trabajo. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus frutos principalmente el café, para luego despulparlos y observar la calidad de su producto, que luego los secará para su debida comercialización a los acopiadores, quienes le pagan S/. 8.00 soles por kilo. Para su futuro, planea incrementar su producción de café, renovando sus plantaciones con otra variedad de mejor calidad. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra entusiasmado de seguir laborando en su grupo comunal, ya que sus compañeros son personas muy alegres y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que quiere esparcir sobre sus cultivos para nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Roberto (40) works - first and foremost - toward the welfare of his family. He lives in his own home with his partner, Mary Luz (26) and their two children. The love he has for the land has pushed Roberto to plant bananas and coffee for the last eight years. Occasionally, Mary Luz helps him, but during clean-up and harvest seasons, he must hire help to get the job done. Roberto greatly enjoys harvesting, especially the coffee. He likes observing the quality of the fruit, which he would eventually dry and then sell to the coffee processors, who will pay him around PEN 8 (US$ 2.75) per kilo. In the future, Roberto would like to increase his coffee production and plant a better coffee variety. This is Roberto's third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is excited to continue working with his communal bank and its members, a group of people who are honest and happy. With this loan, he will buy fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es:
El señor Alvaro Jose P. V. tiene la edad de 32 años, es casado y su esposa labora como cajero, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, gracias al apoyo y esfuerzo de su esposa lograron instalar una pequeña pulpería en donde venden abarrotes, lácteos, productos para uso personal y domestico.

Es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo ara la compra de un mayor inventario de productos que le permitan incrementar  sus ventas, y favorecer a la economía de la familia en la incursión de nuevos proyectos o fuentes de ingreso para el bienestar continuo de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con los fondos Kiva, ellos son una familia que posee del prestigio y buena recomendación de toda su comunidad por haberse esforzado para poseer su propio negocio siendo fuente de inspiración para otras familia aledañas.
texts.en:
Señor Alvaro Jose P. V. is 32 years old and married. His wife works as a cashier and they have 2 underage children. With the support and effort of his wife, they set up a small store where they sell groceries, dairy products and personal and household items. He is requesting a loan for his business so he can increase his product inventory. This will allow him to increase his sales and thereby improve the household finances with new projects and new sources of income for the continued well-being of his family. This is his first loan with Kiva. They are a prestigious family that comes highly recommended by their whole community because they have worked hard to own their own business. They are a source of inspiration for other families in their community.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his store

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria tiene 61 años, Hace más de 6 años trabaja con el destace de cerdo. Desde entones cada fin de semana ella sale a buscar los mejores cerdos para realizar su trabajo. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, porque le permite estar en el campo y apreciar del bello paisaje que rodea su comunidad, además la recompensa lo obtiene cuando realiza la venta de la carne. Su meta es tener otro negocio en el que pueda generar más ganancias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de cerdos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Macaria is 61 years old. For more than six years, she has worked butchering pigs. During that time, she has gone out every weekend in search of the best pigs for her business. She enjoys her work very much because it allows her to be out in the country and to appreciate the beautiful landscape that surrounds her community, and furthermore, she is rewarded when she sells the meat. Her goal is to have another business so that she can generate more income. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase pigs in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering

loans.name: Cindy Rosalina

texts.es: Cindy Rosalinda es una mujer muy trabajadora, es por eso que le ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, los dos trabajan y tienen 2 hijos, ellos quieren lo mejor para su familia, es por eso que solicitan este crédito para mejorar la seguridad de su vivienda y por lo tanto también la de su familia, ya que no cuentan con ninguna protección en la parte frontal de la vivienda, y es peligroso para los niños.  La señora Cindy  y su esposo requieren de este préstamo más que nada para la protección de sus hijos ya que son pequeños.
texts.en:
Cindy Rosalinda is a very hard-working woman, which is why she helps her husband with their household expenses. Both of them work and they have two children. They want the best for their family, and that is why they are requesting this loan to improve the security of their home, and therefore the safety of their family. Right now, they do not have any protection on the front part of their home, which is dangerous for the children. More than anything, Ms. Cindy and her husband need this loan to protect their children, as they are still small.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add protection to the front of her house

loans.name: Armi

texts.en:
Armi C. is a 53-year-old woman who supports her family by selling of different types of office and school supplies. She lives in Tambongon, San Remegio, Cebu City with her six children who are currently going to school.  She is separated from her husband.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business of selling different types of office and school supplies, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Armi is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to use as additional working capital for the business. This will be her 9th loan cycle with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 5,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Armi aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en Quechua y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones. 
Marina es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudia, estudio para ser estilista y trabaja en un spa actividad que realiza todos los días, su mayor deseo es implementar su spa propio, además Marina viaja a la ciudad de Lima de donde compra ganchos, aretes que vende al por mayor a diferentes tiendas de la ciudad. Solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles para la compra de ganchos.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the Ayllu communal bank - "ayllu" means "family" in Quechua. What she likes most about the bank is the training she receives as a member. Marina lives with her common-law husband and has two children in school. She is studying to be a stylist and she works every day in a spa. Her dream is to open her own spa one day. Marina also travels to Lima, where she buys pins and earrings that she then sells wholesale to various stores in her city. She is asking for a loan of 1050 Peruvian Soles to buy pins.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pins

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural que se encuentra comprendida dentro del distrito de Pomalca. Las actividades económicas de la zona son la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la elaboración artesanal de sombreros.

Martha cuenta con un equipo de sonido, el cual alquila a sus vecinos del sector en donde vive y también a clientes de diversas zonas aledañas para que amenicen actividades de todo tipo como por ejemplo fiestas sociales y algunas ceremonias, generalmente los días en que alquila su equipo de sonido son los fines se semana, lleva mas de un año trabajando con esta actividad.

Adicionalmente trabaja criando y vendiendo animales, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento económico de la familia. Martha desea implementar su equipo de sonido y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de su equipo de entretenimiento musical, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a cumplir su meta.

Martha es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para colaborar con su esposo y juntos brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 43 and lives with her husband and two children in San Pablo,a rural area located in the district of Pomalca. The economy of this region is based on agriculture, the raising of small livestock, and the manufacture of handmade hats. Martha owns a sound system that she rents to people who live in her area and to customers in neighboring areas, for use in activities like parties and ceremonies. Generally she rents out the sound system on the weekends, and she's been working at this business for over a year. Martha also works raising and selling animals. With her earnings she helps her husband, who is a farmer, to support the family financially. Martha would like to make improvements to her sound system, and in order to reach this goal she is asking for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner]. Martha is a hard working woman who always gives her best to help her family get ahead. Her greatest desire is to keep working in order to help her husband to give the family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of a sound system

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, 3 varones y 1 mujer, Sonia vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en una avenida transitada de la ciudad, cerca del terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza todos los días desde muy temprano. Además Sonia vende cosméticos por catálogos, que ofrece a amigos y familiares.
Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en Quechua y solicita un préstamo de 600 soles que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Sonia desea tener una bodega en su casa y ser directora de ventas de Cosméticos.
texts.en:
Sonia is married and has 4 children who are in school: 3 boys and a girl. Sonia is a street vendor who sells fruit on a busy avenue in the city, close to the bus station. She carries out this activity every day from the early hours of the morning. In addition, Sonia sells cosmetics through catalogs to her friends and acquaintances. Sonia belongs to the communal bank "Ayllu," which means "Family" in Quechua. She requests a loan of 600 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of fruit. Sonia wishes to have a store in her house, and to be a director of sales of cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.es:
Doris tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende ropa variada actividad que aprendió de su mama, además viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana en donde vende también ropa, también a fiestas patronales en donde se queda el tiempo que dure la fiesta, porque en estas ocasiones vende mas. Doris solicita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas.
Doris pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en Quechua, Doris es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4, 2 años, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Doris has a stall in the "12 de Abril" market in the city of Ayacucho where she sells a variety of clothing, a trade she learned from her mother. In addition, she travels to the markets in the region 3 times each week where she sells clothing. She also sells at festivals, where she stays for the length of the festival, because on these occasions she sells more. Doris requests a loan of 1,050 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of pants and coats. Doris belongs to the communal bank "Ayllu" which means "Family" in Quechua. Doris is single and has 3 children aged 6, 4, and 2 years. Her main wish is that her children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pants and coats

loans.name: G.s. Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Maria De Los Ángeles y Ángela Mercedes. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante por lo que así puede tener una gran variedad de clientes, pues inicio desde muy joven hace 25 años, fue así que logro conocer a su amiga Ángela por lo que juntas han salido adelante y aprovechado su amistad para realizar financiamientos por lo que ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene 15 años, en este negocio. Actualmente solicitan este crédito para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisetas, vestidos y trajes. Juntas sueñan con tener un negocio más estable para su actividad.
texts.en:
María de los Angeles and Ángela Mercedes belong to this solidarity group. María sells clothes in the streets and for that reason, she has a wide variety of customers. She began 25 years ago while very young. This is how María came to know her friend Ángela and, as a result, they are advancing together, taking advantage of their friendship to gain financing. Ángela also sells clothes and has been in this business for 15 years now. At present, María and Ángela are requesting a loan to buy underwear, pants, blouses, dresses, and suits. Together, they dream of having a more stable business for their activity.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING UNDERWEAR, PANTS, BLOUSES, DRESSES, AND SUITS TO SELL

loans.name: Ana Milagros

texts.es:
Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayllu que significa Familia en Quechua, durante este tiempo aprendió a ser responsable.
Ana es soltera y tiene una hija de 10 años, trabaja en una institución, Ana vende ropa variada de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, ofrece sus productos a sus compañeros de trabajo, amigos, familiares, actividad que inicio hace 3 años. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños.
Ana sueña con comprar un departamento en la ciudad de Lima y que su hija salga adelante.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the “Ayllu” Communal Bank. “Ayllu” means family in Quechua. During this time she learned to be responsible. Ana is single, and she has a ten year old daughter. She works in an establishment. Ana sells a variety of clothes according to her customers’ orders. She sells her products to her work colleagues, friends, and family. She started selling clothes three years ago. The loan will be used to buy children’s clothes. Ana dreams of buying an apartment in the city of Lima and that her daughter gets ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children’s clothes

loans.name: Jenne

texts.es: Jenne tiene 19 años, vive en casa de sus padres y en compañía de ellos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a los bordados de trajes típicos de su zona, en un inicio fue solo un pasatiempo pero después se convirtió en una fuente de ingresos muy importante en su economía y con esto aporta  en su casa  ayudando a sus padres. Su mama en ocasiones la apoya en el bordado, pero generalmente cuenta con la mano de obra de 2 señoras que trabajan para ella. Le gusta realizar este trabajo porque le permite tener tiempo libre para estudiar además  que disfruta este trabajo. La temporada que más pedidos tiene es durante los meses de julio y agosto, por ser muy festivas, es por eso que desea tener un taller grande de bordados. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permitirá crecer en su negocio, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Jenne is 19 years old and lives with her parents in their home. For the last ten years, she has embroidered traditional garments from the region in which she lives. At the beginning, embroidering was a hobby, but it soon turned into a very important source of income for her. Embroidering now allows her to contribute to her parents' household. Sometimes, Jenne's mother helps her with the business, but more often than not she hires two other women to work for her. Jenne loves this work, which allows her some free time to study. During July and August - the most festive season - she receives the highest number of orders. Jenne would like to one day own a large embroidery shop. This is Jenne's first loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is really happy knowing that she can count with the financial support needed to grow her business. She is thankful to the people making this loan possible, a loan that would prove very useful to her business. She will use the loan proceeds to buy wholesale fabric and embroidery thread.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric and thread

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Josefa del Carmen S. H., tiene 40 años de edad vive en el Barrio Buenos Aires, es casada y su esposo labora como bombero y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y la apoyan en los trabajos del hogar, ellos se ganan la vida vendiendo frutas y verduras, son una familia muy humilde y gracias al apoyo de su esposo que le apoyó en la inversión para este pequeño negocio.

Es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario en verduras y frutas y de esta manera a futuro tener los recursos económicos para la compra de un tramo en el mercado y poder vender en un espacio más digno y espacioso para el desarrollo del negocio, esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con los fondos Kiva, notándose la buena recomendación de su comunidad por la honestidad, trabajo y unidad familiar que goza la familia.
texts.en:
Josefa del Carmen S. H. is 40 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. She is married, and her husband works as a firefighter, and she has five adult children who work or help her at home. She earns a living selling fruits and vegetables. They are a very humble family, and she is thankful for the support of her husband, who supported her in investing for this small business. It is for her business that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a larger inventory of fruits and vegetables. In this way, she will in the future have the economic resources to buy a stall in the market and be able to sell in a larger and more dignified space for the development of her business. This is the first time Josefa has asked for a Kiva loan, making note of her community's recommendation for her honesty, work, and the unity of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua, durante el tiempo que es socia los prestamos le ayudaron mucho en el crecimiento D. su negocio.
Emilia es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la ciudad D. Lima, Emilia tiene un puesto en el mercado Central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venD. carne variada, los animales los adquiere en las ferias D. la región, actividad a la que se dedica todos los días. Emilia solicita un crédito D. 1250 soles para la compra D. una vaca. El sueño D. Emilia es mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia belongs to the Wiñarisun (meaning 'we will grow' in Quechua) Communal Bank. Since she became a member, her loans have helped her business to grow a great deal. Emilia is married and has 2 children who study in the city of Lima. She has a post in the Central Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells a variety of meat. She buys her animals in regional fairs, an activity she is involved in every day. Emilia is requesting a loan for 1,250 sols to buy a head of beef. Emilia's dream is to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A HEAD OF BEEF FOR HER BUTCHER SHOP

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años, que estudian, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios para en el futuro salir adelante, Maximiliana inicio con la venta de carne, negocio que dejo de realizar por lo forzado del negocio, ahora vende ropa variada en las diferentes ferias, Maximiliana viaja todos los días a diferentes pueblos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de chompas. Maximiliana sueña con tener un local estable.
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y durante este tiempo aprendió a ahorrar además que los prestamos le ayudaron mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is single and has two children, 15 and 12 years old, who study. Her greatest dream is for her children to finish their studies so in the future they can get ahead. Maximiliana began by selling meat, but she stopped doing this because the business was so tough. Now she sells assorted clothing at the different markets. Maximiliana travels everyday to different towns. Her loan will be invested in buying sweaters. Maximiliana dreams of having her own shop. Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank. The name means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. During this time she learned to save, and the loans helped her a lot with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof on his house for his family

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Sonia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, Sonia inicio su negocio hace 10 años de manera ambulatoria, actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende pasamanería, joyas, mercería, sus ventas son al por mayor y menor, además su esposo tiene otro puesto del mismo rubro, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Sonia solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganchos, aretes y esmaltes.
Sonia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "let´s grow" en Quechua. Sonia is in a common-law marriage and has two small children. She started her business 10 years ago as a traveling salesperson, but currently has a stall in the central market of the city she lives in, where she sells handicrafts, jewelry, and notions. She sells both wholesale and retail. Her husband has a stand where he sells similar products which he acquires in Lima. Sonia is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles, which will be used to purchase clothes hangers, earrings and nail polishes. Sonia´s hopes and dreams are that her children become professionals and her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes hangers, earrings and nail polishes.

loans.name: Deysi Judith

texts.es:
Deysi es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua. 
Deysi es conviviente y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Deysi vende carne en el puesto de su mama que se encuentra en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noches, la carne los compra de la ciudad de Lima, su mama le envía 3 veces por semana. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de carne.
Deysi sueña con vender mas cantidad y su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Deysi is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "let´s grow" in Quechua. Deysi is in a common-law marriage and is expecting her first child. She sells meat at a stand in the central market of Ayacucho, an activity she does every day from 7 in the morning to 7 at night. The meat is purchased in Lima, and her mother sends it to her 3 times a week. Her loan will be used to buy more meat. Deysi´s hopes and dreams are to sell more and that her child becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, actualmente solo vive con 1 hija que le ayuda en el negocio, Senobia tiene un puesto en el mercado Central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venD. caldos típicos, que prepara por la noche, y venD. desD. las 7 D. la mañana hasta la 1 D. la tarD.. Además Senobia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general. 
Senobia pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y solicita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, leche, sal, jabones.
Su sueño es tener un recreo en su casa y ya no salir al mercado.
texts.en:
Senobia is married and has 3 children, currently only 1 daughter lives with her and helps with her business. Senobia has a stand in the central market of Ayacucho where she sells traditional regional soups, which she prepares the night before. She sells from 7 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. In addition, Senobia has a general store in her home where she sells basic goods. Senobia belongs to the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "let´s grow" in Quechua. She is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles, which will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, salt and soap. Her dream is to have small restaurant in her home so she does not have to go out to the market. .

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, sal, jabones.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es casada y tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Teodora tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende carne, los animales los adquiere en las ferias de la región, a donde viaja una vez por semana.
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y durante este tiempo aprendió temas de familia, además que los prestamos le ayudaron mucho. Teodora solicita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y oveja.
texts.en:
Teodora is married and has 5 school-age children. She has a stand in the city´s central market where she sells meat from animals she buys in the regional markets, where she travels once a week. Teodora is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "let´s grow" in Quechua. During the time she´s been a member, she has learned about family-related topics in addition to receiving loans which have helped her a lot. Teodora is requesting a loan for 1,250 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of pigs and sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y lo que mas le agrada es la facilidad del préstamo.
Karina es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 1 año, Karina viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana en donde vende ropa variada, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años. Su prestamo sera invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.
Karina sueña con que su hijo sea un profesional exitoso y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means Growing in Quechau. What she likes the most is the simplicity of the loan. Karina is in a common-law marriage, and she has a one year old child. Karina travels to the regional fairs three times a week. That is where she sells varied articles of clothing. She gets her products in Lima. She started her business three years ago. Her loan will be used to buy pants and polo-type shirts. Karina dreams of her son being a successful professional and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and polo-type shirts

loans.name: Ercilia

texts.es:
Ercilia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 estudian y el ultimo es pequeño aun, Ercilia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama.
Ercilia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua y solicita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, arroz y azúcar.
Ercilia sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ercilia lives with her partner and has 3 children. Two of them are in school, and the last is still young. Ercilia has a store in her house, where she sells basic groceries, produce, meat, a business she manages daily with the help of her mother. Ercilia is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means “let’s grow” in Quechua. She is requesting a loan of 900 soles, to invest in purchasing cookies, candy, rice, and sugar. Her dream is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies, candy, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy two tires and perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of material (sand, cement, rods)

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Reque, un distrito ubicado veinte minutos al sur de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado por mas de quince años a la ganadería, ella cuenta con algunas vacas productoras de leche, las cuales cría en unos corrales situados cerca al lugar en donde vive. Martha extrae la leche junto a su esposo todos los días y luego la venden a una empresa acopiadora de la zona, que a su vez es proveedora de la mayor empresa procesadora de lácteos del país.

Esta actividad le sirve para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar, por ello siempre brinda a sus vacas el mejor de los cuidados, de modo que puedan tener una excelente producción. En esta oportunidad ella desea adquirir alimento balanceado para que sus animales puedan seguir produciendo leche, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Lucila es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lucila, age 44, lives with her husband and their two children in the Reque district. This district is located twenty minutes south of the city of Chiclayo. She has devoted herself to livestock for over 15 years. She has some dairy cows, and she cares for them in corrals close to where she lives. Martha milks the cows with her husband everyday. They then sell the milk to a local amassing company, which is the largest producer of dairy products in the country. This activity serves to help her husband support the family. Therefore, she always gives her cows the best care so that they can have an excellent production. On this occasion she wishes to get balanced feed so that her animals can keep producing milk. That is why she has requested a 2,000 soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa. The loan will help her achieve her goal. Lucila is a hard-working woman. Her greatest desire is to keep working to help her family get ahead. She has previously worked with our institution. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed to improve production of the dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her house by putting in a new floor

loans.name: Vicente
