texts.es: El Señor Vicente  O. es un hombre muy trabajador, que cuida y protege mucho a su familia. El adquirió una vivienda de interés social a la cual quiere hacerle algunas mejoras. Es por eso que el requiere de este préstamo, para la pintura de paredes exteriores, el señor Vicente quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Señor Vicente O. is a hardworking man who looks after and protects his family. Through Social Services he obtained a house to which he wants to make some improvements. For this reason he needs a loan to paint the exterior walls. He wishes to provide his wife and small children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to paint the exterior walls of his house

loans.name: Mayra Yaneth

texts.es: La Señora Mayra Yaneth es una madre de familia que se preocupa por el bienestar de ellos, es por eso que  la señora Mayra pide este crédito por que  requiere de la compra de un aparato de aire por que el calor extremo de la ciudad obliga a sus hijos pequeños a estar dentro de la vivienda la mayor parte del día,  ellos no cuentan con ningún otro aparato de aire y es insoportable el calor que siente ella y su familia. La señora Mayra esta preocupada por sus tres hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Yaneth is a mother worried for the well-being of her children. For that reason, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase an air conditioner due to the extreme heat in the city. The heat requires her young children to stay inside their home the majority of the day. They have no other form of ventilation or air units and the heat is unbearable for the family. Sra. Mayra is worried about her three small children.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, onion, potatoes, cabbage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Change the electrical system in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to sell

loans.name: Victor Bacilio

texts.es: Víctor Bacilio es un hombre trabajador, el señor tiene dos trabajos, en la noche trabaja en una maquiladora como  operador y en el día atiende su negocio de venta de abarrotes, el señor requiere de este prestamos para invertir en la compra de mas cosas para la tienda. Y así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. El señor víctor siempre se ah preocupado por la educación de sus hijos es por eso que el necesita de su apoyo para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor Bacilio is a hard-working man. He has two jobs: at night, he works in a factory as a machine operator, and during the day, he runs his own business selling groceries. He needs this loan in order to invest in buying more goods for his store, in order to increase his sales and his earnings. Victor has always been concerned about his children's education, and for this reason he needs your support, so that he can give his children a better education and an improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his business

loans.name: Erasma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito D. Urcos en la provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Erasma; ella tiene 60 años D. edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, independientes todos ellos, la socia vive en el distrito D. Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand en el mercado central D. Urcos ella venD. jugos, La socia también trabaja en el stand con su hija, la hija D. la socia vio que el negocio D. su mamá es muy rentable y decidió apoyarla y ambas trabajar con este negocio. La socia se mantiene ocupada debido a que ella necesita estar activa y seguir trabajando para que no pierda su independencia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas y una licuadora nueva.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO”. She lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. The member is Mrs. Erasma, 60, married with three independent children. All the family lives in the Urcos district. She has a retail business with a stand in the main market of Urcos where she sells juices. The member also works with her daughter in a stand. The member’s daughter saw that her mother’s business was profitable and she decided to help her and for them to both work with it. The member stays busy since she needs to be active and to continue working so that she doesn‘t lose her independence.. She is requesting the loan to buy fruit and a new blender. The member infinitely values and appreciates the loan issued her since this allows her business to grow and improve the quality of her life. Because of this she promises to make the payments in the required time.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for a loan to buy fruit and a new blender

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Graciela ella tiene 44 años de edad y La socia es casada con 5 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Urcos,  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand en una esquina de la plaza de Urcos, la socia vende panes desde muy temprano hasta que se le acabe, Ella administra y trabaja en su propio negocio desde hace 21 años, todos en el pueblo la conocen y cuando pasan los carros con destino a otras ciudades, ella ofrece panes frescos a los viajeros, La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar un nuevo stand y para los estudios de sus hijos aún dependientes de ella.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "QORI ORCCO". She lives in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco state. Graciela is 44 years old, married with 5 children. She lives in the Urcos district. Her business is retail sales. She has a stand on a corner in the plaza in Urcos where she sells bread from very early until she runs out. She has managed and worked at her own business for 21 years. Everyone in the town knows her and when cars pass by traveling to other cities, she offers fresh bread to the travelers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new stand and for the education of her children who are still at home with her. Graciela values and is extremely thankful for the loan as this allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She also promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new stand and for her children's education

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe N. is from the village of Sto.Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Fe is married and has two school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as eggs, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 4,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Fe is now requesting her third loan from GDMPC, for 5,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house and for family expenses.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda E. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 52 years old. Erminda is married and has two adult children. Erminda owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling banana cue in the local community. Erminda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Erminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Erminda is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials (corn, firewood, mineral lime)

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Conchita is married. Conchita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies,shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia D. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old. Alicia is married and has one adult child. Alicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods, candies, and boost food in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her house and for family expenses

loans.name: Thuk

texts.en: Thuk S., 40, is a villager living in Kompong Cham Province. She is a farmer, growing rice and some vegetables on her own farmland. Her husband helps her with the physically demanding farming activities. The couple is blessed with five children, three of whom attend the local public school; the other two are too young for school. Thuk S. planted different types of rainy rice months ago, but they are not growing well because they need fertilizer. She has therefore applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda T., 53, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jose T., a pensioner, and mother of five children, four of whom are already working and are settled down with their own families, while the youngest is still in college. By the grace of God, Yolanda has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Yolanda, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Yolanda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Juanita earns by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Yolanda’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Yolanda dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work at her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Miech

texts.en: Miech S. is a 37-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Kompong Cham Province, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is always hired by neighbors to decorate or to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies. Her husband works with her in the same field. The family includes three devoted children who are single and living at home. Miech S. would like a loan of $800 in order to purchase piglets to raise in a stall next to her house that she built a few months ago. This will provide her with extra income that she will be using to meet her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
This is Meldred A., 40, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Raul A., a soldier. Meldred is mother of three children, one of whom is already working and settled down with a family, while the other two are in high school. By the grace of God, Meldred has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the younger ones to college. A dream for most Filipino parents, like Meldred, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Meldred operates a charcoal and firewood business. Many Filipinos are still using the old ways of firewood and charcoal cooking, which is the cheapest way to cook. Charcoal is sold in PHP 5 bags for easier lighting up. She also sells mineral water in their neighborhood. This is mostly used by nursing mothers and households with children, as normal tap water is already part of a normal adult's life. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 650 in sales every day for her firewood and mineral water refilling businesses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of firewood and charcoal to be incorporated into her inventory. She will also be using a portion of the loan to buy mineral water to be retailed to her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Meldred dreams to be able to give her all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of firewood and charcoal to be incorporated into her inventory. She will also be using a portion of the loan to buy mineral water to be retailed to her customers.

loans.name: Soeup

texts.en: Mrs. Soeup S. has established a small home where she lives with her family. To earn a living, she raises a few vegetables and has been cultivating crops since 2000. Soeup S. has two children who are students at the public school. She has another partner in her husband, who has learned to decorate and paint vehicles from a private school. He has been using his skill to earn a living and uses a rented workshop to provide his service. Soeup S. is taking out her first loan to buy modern accessories for her husband to improve the good service he provides.

loans.use: To buy modern accessories for her husband to improve his painting business

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Si Nob, have been married since 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the children attends school and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Samnang S. has been selling vegetables for more than three years. She buys them from Kean Svay district, where she lives, and transports by her motorbike to sell at Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh. Mr. Si Nob is a military policeman.

Samnang has asked for Kiva loan. Her motorbike is old and does not work well, which costs her a lot of money in repairs. Hence, she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

Samnang will be able to save some money by not spending a lot of money for repairing costs any more.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Kimhour

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhour K., is a widow and has three sons and two daughters. She lives on an Island in Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Kimhour has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She grows corn, tomato and mushrooms on her farmland in the village. Some parts of her house break down and she wants to repair it, but Kimhour doesn’t have money. That’s why she is requesting a loan of $700, in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where she is living.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. Theary S. (pictured above), age 33, and her husband, Mr. Sithol An, age 35, have been married since 1992 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of their children are garment factory workers and the other two are in school. They are living in a small village along national road number four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Theary has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Her husband is a construction worker. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn C. (pictured with his wife) is 49 and his wife, Mrs. Sitha Say, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The son is in school and the daughter attends school and works. The family is living in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.  

Thorn is a motor taxi driver. He drives in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. Thorn is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to work

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach O. (in the photo) is a widow with seven children: three sons and four daughters. Four of them are married; two live in separate homes. One is a tailor and the other two stay at home. They are living on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Thach has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market or other places. Thach does not have capital to purchase silk materials for her silk-weaving business and that’s why she is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000. She also will use a part of her loan to build a tailoring shop for her daughter, who is a tailor.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and build a tailoring shop for her daughter

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis is a resident of a city called Vehari, in Pakistan. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years. 

A very active lady, Bilquis stays at home to manage the domestic chores and take care of her family. She gets up early and waits until the family members come back home. They help each other in their work. 

Her husband's name is S.. He runs a canteen in a local school, where he sells home-cooked food such as nan kababs and finger chips. His items are very famous among the students. He recovers the financial expenses from his canteen business, but as the expenses are going higher day by day due to the high cost of purchasing the required items, Bilquis has decided to apply for a loan from Asasah. With the loan amount, they will buy the required items and save the purchasing cost by buying in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase required items for canteen business

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mr. P., 39 years old, is a villager living in the province Battambang, in the north of Cambodia. He is married and blessed with two young school-aged children. His wife appears in the photo; she sells a few groceries to generate a daily income. P. owns a motorcycle that he uses to provide a taxi service around his community. P. sees that the grocery-selling business his wife operates is profitable for his family, and he hopes to improve it through assistance from Kiva.

loans.use: To improve the grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Twenty-two-year-old Adeline G. is a loving wife to her husband, Roger. Even though the two are not yet blessed to have their own offspring, still they are happy and they look at it as the opportunity to improve their lifestyle and financial status. In time, she believes that they will both have their own children to raise with love and a better kind of life. 

In the meantime, Adeline manages her time equally to her responsibilities at home and to a business she put up when she joined ASHI last year and first received a loan. The amount she received then was just small, however, it was just right to start buying and selling “muscovado” sugar. “Muscovado” is a variety of sugar that is processed naturally and free from any chemicals and preservatives. This is supposedly is the most expensive kind of sugar, wherein customers are people from class A and B. But for small-time vendors like Adeline, packaging and marketing strategies to sell more are very poor. It will incur a lot of training and financial investment for them to be able to do that, plus the fact that in the province, supply of “muscovado” sugar is abundant and demand in the market is therefore low. Middlemen buy a large volume and are the ones to improve the packaging for export, selling in other cities through malls. Therefore, they’re the ones who gain bigger profit. 

After six months of running a business, Adeline feels happy for the profit she has able to have out of it. She feels her business is a great help to augment the sporadic and small income of her husband, who is a hired farm laborer. With that, they are able to have a little taste of a better kind of life and Adeline is wishing to have the full taste of it by growing her business.  

To be able to do this, she is requesting a much larger amount of loan. The entire amount will be used to increase the volume of “muscovado” sugar to sell and she could also buy other items or products for the same purpose.  If now she sells sugar per kilo directly to people in the market, someday she hopes to become a supplier within other provinces and/or cities.

loans.use: To purchase larger volume of "muscovado" sugar and other products for selling

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a wife of G. M. and they belong to a city called Vehari in Pakistan. They have a small house of two rooms and have been living in it for the past 15 years.

A very caring lady, Naseem stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother as well. Her husband has a business selling bed sheets. He purchases them from the cities of Faisalabad and Multan (both are famous for textiles) and sells them in different areas of the community. His earnings are good from this business, but due to a lack of stock and the urgent demand of his customers, he sometimes isn’t able to fulfill orders.

Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy bed sheets in bulk, improve his business and generate a good profit on it.

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets for reselling

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs. Yi S. is a 41-year-old rice and vegetable grower from the Kompong Cham Province. (Her husband appears to the left in the photo.) She runs her business on her own farmland, where she grows different kinds of crops like rice and potatoes. She will sell the crops to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. Yi S. has five children who are no longer in school and who are employed at a various occupations. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. However, Yi S. does not have enough capital to support her efforts. Yi S. is therefore asking for capital to use toward planting potatoes.

loans.use: To use toward planting potatoes.

loans.name: Jeanifer

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Jeanifer T. is a hardworking woman who strives to give her eight children a brighter future and comfortable kind of life. Together with her husband Danilo, a farmer, she has been able to supply her family with their daily needs; however, she failed to sustain the education of her eldest children, who are 20 and 18 years old. In addition to her six other children, these two are still dependent to their parents for all of their needs because they hardly get employment. 

Given a chance to grow and make her businesses of selling “muscovado” sugar and beer profitable, Jeanifer would really want to send all of her children to college until they earn a degree. Most of her customers for the beer are farm laborers. Selling is at its peak during the season of planting rice and sugar cane.   

“Mucovado” is a variety of sugar that is processed naturally and free from any chemicals and preservatives. This is supposedly is the most expensive kind of sugar, wherein customers are people from class A and B. However, in the province where supply for this is abundant, demand in the market is low. Middlemen buy a large volume and improve the packaging for export, selling in other cities through malls. Therefore, they’re the ones who gain bigger profit.  

Aside from the loan Jeanifer will access through ASHI and its partners, she is also hopeful to improve her marketing strategies and packaging to increase her sales turnover and profit, thus making her dream for her family come true.

loans.use: To increase the volume of "mucovado" sugar and beer she buys to resell

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun M. has spent her whole life cultivating crops on her own five hectares of farmland. She has used this skill to earn a living since she was young. She is now married and has a young school-aged child. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is an activity with which she has had great success for several years. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, but Bun M. does not have enough capital to use on her farm. So Bun M. is looking for a loan to purchase farm supplies to support her farming activity.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Seui

texts.en: Mrs. Y., 36, is a villager who has been a rice farmer since 1979. She owns a plot of land next to her house where she raises crops. She was married, but divorced her husband years ago, and has two children. Y. needs money to plant rice in this rainy season and is asking for a loan in order to hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to grow rice.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the farmland and then to grow rice.

loans.name: Nonnie

texts.en:
Nonnie D. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Nonnie works in a family member's business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nonnie has been engaged in this business for over 6 years.

Nonnie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Nonnie from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers etc.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita B. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 46 and married. To make a living, Paulita raises rice for sale. Paulita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years. Her wishes are to be successful in her business and for her family to have good health.

Paulita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Paulita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido F. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 32 years old and single. To make a living, Bienvinido raises rice for sale. Bienvinido has been engaged in his business for over 4 years. He says he works hard to save for the future because he hopes to have his own family someday.

Bienvinido joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the first loan taken out by Bienvinido from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo B. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 53 years old and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelo raises rice for sale. Despite the difficulties he faces in his business, he still works hard to provide for his family and sustain them.

Marcelo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marcelo from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's school fees and improve his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Якубова Гулнора проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Муж с сыновьями в Росии на заработках. Сама Гулнора занимается растениеводством. Ей приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить семью. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян, т.е. для повторного посева.
texts.en:
Gulnora Y. lives in Yavan. She is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. She has a high school education. Her husband and her sons work in Russia. Gulnora farms. She has to work very hard to support her family. The plot of land she uses to grow vegetables is near her home. She has been doing this work for more than five years. She is taking out a loan to buy seeds to replant her crops.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seed

loans.name: Airforce Group

texts.en:
Amina Said, age 24, is married and has one seven-year-old daughter. She has sold eggs door to door for 6 months. She works from 9 am to 12 noon daily and is able to make a monthly profit of around $189. This will be Amina’s first motisha (motisha is to motivate good payers) loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of eggs.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Air Force, which consists of 9 men and women from her community. The members of the group hold each other accountable to pay back the loan. 

In the picture,  Amina is on the right in an orange dress.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 54 years old and married with three children – Grace 12, Legaw 9, and Victor 6, who all go to school.
Samson runs a retail shop and rents out houses. He has six years of experience in the business. He is an active member of Tumaini Kabiku group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Previously he took out a loan of 20,000 KES through the group, which he used to boost the business and successfully repaid. Because of this, he has been allowed to take out another loan of 30,000 KES. He will use the loan to purchase sugar for resale and to renovate his rental houses. He hopes to expand his business for better returns in the future. (This photo was taken in a garden behind his rental houses.)

loans.use: To buy sugar for resale and to renovate his rental houses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto M. is 23 years old and from the town of Bunawan. He is a very jolly person. He is married and has a one-year-old child. Crisanto is a farmer who learned his skills from his parents. He has been planting and harvesting rice crops for over five years. He and his wife work together to sell their harvest and earn income for their family. He says he works hard to save for his child's future.
Crisanto joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be his fourth from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly L. is from the town of Trento. She is 30 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Nelly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.
Nelly joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelly is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen A. has spent her entire life cultivating crops on her own land. She specializes in growing potatoes, a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She also harvests the crops when they are mature and sells them in bulk to local industries that turn them into snack foods. Chhen A. is now married and has four school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing potatoes is an annual operation with which she has had great success for several years. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Chhen A. wants to plant the next potato crop since the farming season is approaching, but Chhen A. doesn’t have capital to use on her farm. So, she decided to borrow a loan from Kiva to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza M. is from the town of Trento. She is 34 years old and married. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale.
In 2009, Flordeliza joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Rochie

texts.en: Rochie M. is from the town of Trento. She is 22 years old and married. Rochie helps her husband maintain their rice farm, and has been involved in farming for over five years now. She rents a stall at their town's market where she sells their harvest. They have just prepared their land for planting and  need farm inputs. Therefore, Rochie has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, CEVI, where she is a member. She has asked for a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase seeds, seedlings and fertilizers. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Bwaloni Group

texts.en:
Cleophas P., aged 42, is married and has three children aged 13, 16 and 21. For the past eight years, he has worked as a cameraman taking and selling photos. He works from 8am to whatever time required – he can work up to midnight or beyond because he sometimes gets a contract for an occasion such as a wedding. He is able to make a monthly profit of around $47.
This will be Cleophas’ second motisha (motisha is to motivate good payers) loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to buy a camera. He is now requesting a loan to improve his office.
Cleophas will share this loan with his loan group, Bwaloni, which is made up of eight men and women from his community. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Cleophas is third from the left.

loans.use: To improve his office

loans.name: Alex Ainea

texts.en:
Alex C. is 39 years old and married to Lucy Kavetsa, a housewife. They have three children – their eldest son is in high school while their last born is in primary school.
Alex has run a pharmacy for the past eight years and has a huge customer base consisting of patients from the nearby local health dispensary. This is the fourth loan that he has taken from Kiva partner, KADET, and he has a good credit history with them. He wants to use the loan to buy more drugs to add to the stock he already has. Alex has customers who have ordered drugs and he needs the money to purchase them. His main hope and dream is to educate his children to university level with the profits made from his business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to stock his pharmacy

loans.name: Soch

texts.en: Pictured is Mrs. Soch P., 61, who lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by planting a variety of domestic crops. They grow things like rice and some vegetables. They run their farm on their own land next to their house. They can grow twice a year and will sell their crops to buyers every two months after they begin growing them. Soch P. is taking out her loan in order to buy farm accessories to supply her in the field when the farming season comes.

loans.use: To buy farm accessories

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Trento. She is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.
Gloria joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is 34 years old, married to Gordon Ouma, and has four children. The family live in the Oruba area of Migori town.

Judith has run a cereals business for the past seven years. Her business is located at Moi bridge and her customers are usually boarding schools. She is applying for her second loan from Kiva partner, KADET, after completing her first one successfully. She normally uses the profits made to cater for her family's upkeep and pay her children's school fees. She hopes to own a cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to stock her business

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie A. is from the town of Trento. She is 39 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She wants to earn better and be able to save for future emergencies.
Vergie joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and other farm inputs. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.name: Izolde

texts.en:
Izolde D. is from the town of Trento. She is 42 and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Izolde has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Izolde joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and for land preparation and transplanting. This will be the third loan taken out by Izolde from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 42 years old and lives in Arosho, a town in Migori, with his wife Rose Kwamboka and their two children — Joshua 14, and Stephen 12. 

Charles sells tomatoes and is applying for a loan of Kshs 20,000. This is the second loan he will be taking from Kadet Ltd after successfully completing the first loan. He wants to buy more tomatoes to add to his business since this is the peak season and harvest time and this will give a boost to his profits.

He hopes to buy a grinding machine as a secondary business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to add to his stock

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora N. is an industrious and loving woman to her six children and second husband. Even to her first husband, the woman was very loving yet their relationship did not thrive. When her first husband left, he left their two children with her. She raised them alone, supporting their needs and  education until she found another man to love and to partner with, in improving their lives. From then, she had another four children and an additional inspiration. Teodora has always been willing to venture into different kinds of income-generating activities to support her family's daily needs. Roger, her second husband is a farm laborer who makes a small income sporadically. He also cultivates a small lot in their back yard to plant vegetables. This is not enough to support the growing needs of their family, especially the education of their children who range from five to 12 years old. Teodora’s children from her first husband are now 17 and 20 years old. Sadly, she was not able to send her eldest child to college but is happy to have been able to graduate her second child from a vocational course as a nursing aid. For the rest of her children, she hopes to support their education for a brighter future.

Last year, Teodora joined ASHI and has received a first a loan, which she used to finance her husband's vegetable farming business and sale of fruit and vegetables. During harvest, she sells these products to people in different market places may it be rain or shine. What matters to her is to earn money to support her family and dreams. Teodora hopes to strengthen her business and its profits through the support of this loan. No matter how hard things are for her family now, Teodora is optimistic that one day, all her dreams will become real.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Jocelyn J. is from the town of Trento. She is married. She has been doing farming duties since she was still a teen. She used to help her parents maintain their farm by making sure it was free of weeds and pests. 

Now that she is married, she farms with her husband. She plants rice crops and sells their harvest to her town's market. They have just finished preparing their land for planting and farm inputs are needed for it. 

She applied for a loan from CEVI, where she is a member. She asked for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos that she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will truly help her have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melcer Achieng

texts.en:
Melcer Achieng Wesonga is 25 years old and married to Samson Wesonga. They live in the Ranen area in the outskirts of Migori town. They have three children: Elisha, 9; Judy, 6; and Emily, 5.

Melcer is a well-known tailor in her neighborhood as she is known for making the latest good fashions for men, women and children. She has a scarcity of materials and is applying for 25,000 Kenyan shillings to enable her add more materials and meet the demands of her clients. She also wants to buy another sewing machine to enable her to work more efficiently as the one she is using is old. This is the second loan she will be accessing from Kadet Ltd. after successfully paying the first loan.

She hopes to open a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials to add to her stock

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a citizen of a city called Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its sugar and for its saint places. 

She is a very vigorous lady. She owns and operates a domestic-sewing business for her neighborhood clients. She learned this art from her mother and now is getting benefit from it. She utilizes her money for paying the utilities. 

Her husband's name is M. I. and he is a daily wage laborer. Both utilize their income for improving their financial condition. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan amount, she will buy an electric sewing machine and expand her business by sewing more clothes and maintaining more customers.

loans.use: Purchase an electric sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Guillerma is married and has 11 children. Her eldest is aged 32 and she still has children who go to school. She dreams for her children to finish college and have bright futures. To make a living, Guillerma raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Guillerma has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years. Guillerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Guillerma is requesting a new loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the third loan taken out by Guillerma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum Y. is a 20-year-old married woman and a villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of farmland that she uses to grow different kinds of crops. She is married with a lovely baby and her husband works on the farm with her. Sum Y. planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer. Sum Y. was not available when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth Achieng

texts.en:
Elizabeth Achieng is 41 years old and married to Sabiano Ogola. They have three children, two are in high school; i.e Dorothy, age 16  and Kennedy age 14.  The last born, Andrew, 10 years old, is in primary school, .

Elizabeth has a grinding machine that is used to grind maize into maize flour. It is a business that she has been running for the past 3 years. Her grinding machine is situated in Migori market and most of her clients are from the nearby hotels. Elizabeth is applying for a loan of Kshs 80,000 to buy more cereals for the grinding machine. This will be her third loan. She has a good credit history with KADET.  With the profits from her business she pays the school fees for her children.

Elizabeth hopes to buy another grinding machine which will be a boost to her family as it will improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for the grinding machine

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is the wife of M. A.. They are citizens of the city of Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its sugar and shrines to the saints.

Manzooran and her family are very simple persons. They spend their life with simplicity. They have a dairy business. They get milk from their cows and sell it to the milk shops and in the neighborhood.

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Asasah for the dairy business. With the loan amount they will buy another dairy cow and expand their dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow for the dairy business

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore T. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 46 years old. Madiore is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Madiore owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Madiore has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.  She says she experienced a lot of difficulties but she still hopes to be successful someday.

Madiore joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madiore has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Madiore is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Madiore from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada A. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Amada is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Amada owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Amada has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amada is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Amtullah's Group

texts.en:
Amtullah is a resident of the city of Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its sugar and it's shrines to the saints.

Amtullah and her husband own & operate a vegetable selling business. They have a cart on which they sell their vegetable stock. They sell to their community. Amtullah helps him in this business and sells the vegetables in his absence. In this way they meet the financial expenses of their family.

Amtullah has applied for a loan from Asasah for their vegetable selling business. With the loan amount they will buy seasonal vegetables in bulk and be able to increase the amount they can sell.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables for the vegetable selling business

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Shown in the photo are S. and her husband who have spent their life cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents. This couple was married years ago and they have three school-aged kids. Growing crops is an annual action with which they have had great success for several years. The family is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing; however, the family doesn’t have capital to use on their farm. So S. discussed this with her husband and decided to seek a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds

loans.name: Ana Theresa

Ana Theresa B. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Ana Theresa is married and has 3 school-age children. loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Tuya T. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her children attend a local middle school while her husband commutes from their local town to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tuya operates a women's clothing and lingerie retail business from a stall at a local clothing market. She sells a variety of different clothing items and and her wide product selection attracts many customers. Tuya started her women's lingerie business in 2008 selling only general woman's clothing items. After finding success and achieving stable business operations, she expanded her product line to include scarves and other garments. Tuya is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well liked by her customers. With their business earnings, Tuya and her husband have started building a new house.  For the future, she says, "I would like to expand my business and increase my sales". She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to complete their house building.

loans.use: To complete her house

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie D. D. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Melanie is married and has 5 school-aged children. Melanie owns and operates a business whose main source of income is selling personal home products from different suppliers to the  local community members. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou B. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business whose main source of income comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Monica Achieng

texts.en:
Monica Achieng Ang'ela is 61 years old and is a single mother of one son by the name of George Omondi who is 26 years old. They live in Oruba estate in Migori town.

Monica has a hotel and restaurant business she has operated for many years. She is applying for a 2nd loan of Kshs 20,000. She repaid her first loan without any problems. She will use her loan to replenish the ingredients she uses to cook for her clients, who are mainly people who live in her neighbourhood and work in the surrounding offices. She has been a client in Kadet Ltd for sometime now and her credit history is good. She mostly uses her profits to pay for her son's college fees and for the family upkeep.

She hopes to diversify into a cereals business to run co-currently with her hotel business.

loans.use: To replenish food items for cooking for clients

loans.name: Baljid

texts.en: Baljid D. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Arhangai province, central part of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her elder son is a student and her younger son attends a local middle school. Her husband makes a variety of wooden products including home furniture. Baljid operates a used-clothing retail business which she began in 2004 with the help of her family. She is getting more customers every day. Baljid started her business with the working capital of 1,000,000 MNT, but now it exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. She would like to expand her business and says, "My only wish is to be able to support my children to be better people in the future”. Baljid is requesting a 1,050,000 MNT loan to purchase clothing in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:

Cheryl owns and operates a business whose main source of income comes from selling personal home products to the local community members. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Bat-Erdene D., 40 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, central Mongolia, in an apartment. His son attends a local high school, his elder daughter is a student and his wife works a a teacher in their town. Bat-Erdene manages a grocery business selling food he grows on a field that he owns. He started his business in 2005 and has since found success and built a stable business operation. He attributes his success to his good customer relationships and communication skills. Today, his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. Bat-Erdene is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more seed to plant on 10 hectares of land.

loans.use: To purchase more seed
